Headline: Petrobras End 2006 Brazil Reserves Stable At 10.573B BOE-2
Story: Of the domestic reserves, 9.002 billion barrels were from oil, Petrobras said.   Petrobras said that its 2006 domestic oil and gas reserves would last for 14.9 years at current production levels.   The company's domestic reserves replacement ratio was 99%, meaning that Petrobras replaced each barrel produced with 0.99 barrel of new reserves.   The company's domestic and overseas reserves combined fell 2.7% to 11.458 billion BOE at the end of 2006, from 11.775 billion BOE a year earlier.   With that, Petrobras' overall reserves replacement ratio was 60% at the end of 2006. The company said its overall reserves would last 14.5 years at current output levels.   The reduction in overall reserves came mainly due to a 26% plunge in overseas oil and gas reserves to 885 million BOE at the end of 2006, from 1.197 billion BOE a year earlier.   The massive reduction came mostly as Petrobras had to cede part of its production in Venezuela to state-oil firm Petroleos de Venezuela (PVZ.YY) in an early 2006 revision of production contracts with the Venezuelan government.   International reserves will increase in the future once new reserves in Nigeria and Bolivia enter more advanced stages of development, Petrobras said.   According to the less strict criteria of the Society of Petroleum Engineers, or SPE, Petrobras' 2006 Brazilian reserves actually rose by 3.9% to 13.753 billion BOE at the end of 2006, from 13.232 billion BOE a year earlier.   The SPE also accepts as reserves areas in earlier stages of development.   The increase came as the company incorporated new discoveries into its reserves, among them the Maromba field in the Campos Basin and the Catua field in the Espirito Santo Basin.   Petrobras also incorporated discoveries into nearby producing fields, among them the Mexilhao gas field in the Santos Basin.   According to the SPE criteria, Petrobras' overseas reserves fell 24% to 1.27 billion BOE at the end of 2006 from a year earlier.   The firm's combined domestic and overseas reserves according to SPE criteria rose to 15.023 billion BOE at the end of 2006, from 14.913 billion BOE at the end of 2005.     -By Bernd Radowitz, Dow Jones Newswires; +5521-3288-5004; bernd.radowitz@dowjones.com;     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 08:37 ET (13:37 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE: Banque Populaire Steps Into French Real-Estate
Story: By Digby Larner   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     PARIS (Dow Jones)--Mutual bank Groupe Banque Populaire Monday said it has agreed to buy a 61% stake in real-estate business Foncia Groupe (5219.FR) for around EUR800 million, marking its first foray into the real-estate market and giving it the chance to offer retail bank services to Foncia's one million clients.   Apart from financing real-estate lending, Banque Populaire will also offer Foncia clients consumer loans and insurance.   Banque Populaire Chairman Philippe Dupont said in an interview published by Le Figaro Monday that the move is part of the bank's plan to expand into markets with high growth potential.   "The real-estate financing market represents EUR8 billion while property services are worth EUR7 billion," he said. He added that over 85% of Foncia's revenue is recurrent and not sensitive to cyclical market trends. The company reported EUR360 million in revenue for 2005.   He said the acquisition should generate revenue synergies in future but didn't say how much they would be.   Foncia earns 92% of its revenue from the French market while the remaining 8% comes from Switzerland, Germany and Belgium. Banque Populaire said it will help the company expand its foreign activities.   Banque Populaire is paying Foncia founder Jacky Lorenzetti EUR40 per-share for the 61% stake. This represents an 11% premium Foncia's Jan. 12 share price, Banque Populaire said.   The bank expects to acquires the stake in March and, under French stock market rules, it must then offer to buy minority interests on the same terms as the original offer. Dupont told Le Figaro that Foncia won't have to be delisted as part of the deal but said he didn't rule out this option.   Lorenzetti will continue to manage the business and will retain a Foncia stake of around 7%.   In November, Banque Populaire and fellow French mutual bank Groupe Caisse d'Epargne launched Natixis - a listed joint-venture corporate and investment bank. Each partner owns a 34% stake in the business which combined most assets from the two banks apart from their retail networks.   Caisse d'Epargne itself has a number of real-estate interests but Dupont said its Foncia acquisition won't damage its partner's market share. "We don't have the same sort of (retail bank) clients as Caisse d'Epargne," Dupont told Le Figaro.   French real-estate businesses have become attractive acquisition targets in recent years following a 2003 law change giving publicly quoted property investment companies a favorable tax treatment.   Spanish companies have been particularly active in the French market. In 2004, Spain's Immobiliaria Colonial (COL.MC) bought Societe Fonciere Lyonnaise. Fellow Spanish real-estate company Metrovacesa SA (MVC.MC) recently took control of France's Gecina (1004086.FR) in a deal valued at more than EUR5 billion.   At 10.59 GMT, Foncia shares were unchanged at EUR36. The SBF 250 index, where the shares are traded, was up slightly.     Company Web sites: http://www.banquepopulaire.fr                      http://www.foncia.fr     -By Digby Larner, Dow Jones Newswires; digby.larner@dowjones.com   (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 06:17 ET (11:17 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Mexico Stocks Close Higher In Quiet Trading; IPC +0.6%
Story: MEXICO CITY (Dow Jones)--Mexican stocks closed higher in light trading Monday with U.S. markets closed in observance of Martin Luther King Jr. Day.   The market's IPC index of 35 leading issues rose nearly 0.6%, or 155.65 points, to 26,480.03. Volume was 32.9 million shares worth 914.6 million pesos ($83.4 million).   Monday marked the IPC's fourth consecutive positive close after rebounding from profit-taking early last week triggered by a weak peso and news that Venezuela plans to nationalize a telecommunications company that two Mexican carriers were trying to buy.   "In general, we should continue to follow U.S. markets (this week) with a positive bias to 26,800 points, provided U.S. economic data, especially inflation, is favorable," a Mexico City trader said.   On local markets, the L shares of mobile operator America Movil (AMX) rose 0.3% to MXN24.35, and shares of fixed-line phone company Telefonos de Mexico (TMX) gained 0.1% to close at MXN14.95.   Meanwhile, the CPO shares of cement maker Cemex (CX) rose nearly 1% to MXN36.86, while the B shares of homebuilder Sare Holding (SARE.MX) closed 0.6% higher at MXN46.83.   On Monday, Sare raised its forecast of 2007 revenue growth to 19%-20%, up from previous guidance of 18%.   Among declining issues, the O shares of banking group Banorte (GFNORTE.MX) fell 0.4% to MXN42.70, while the B shares of copper miner Grupo Mexico (GMEXICO.MX) gave up 1% to finish at MXN39.43.     -By Ken Parks, Dow Jones Newswires, 52-55-5080-3453, ken.parks@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 16:27 ET (21:27 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Urbana Corporation Purchases Additional Exchange Membership & Shares>URB.T
Story: TORONTO, ONTARIO--(CCNMatthews - Jan. 15, 2007) - Urbana Corporation ("Urbana") (TSX:URB)(TSX:URB.A)(TSX:URB.WT) is pleased to announce that it has entered into an agreement to buy a seat on the American Stock Exchange ("AMEX"). Urbana has also purchased shares of the London Stock Exchange ("LSE") and Deutsche Bourse AG, the stock exchange of Germany. The AMEX is a private entity. Headline: Credit Saison To Sell No-Load Funds To Cardholders-Nikkei
Story: TOKYO (Nikkei)--Credit Saison Co. (8253.TO) will begin marketing no-load investment trusts to its 24 million cardholders in March through a tie-up with U.S. mutual fund giant Vanguard Group Inc., The Nikkei learned Monday.   By selling the products directly instead of through a financial institution, Credit Saison will be able to waive sales commissions and keep management fees low.  This will mark the first foray into the investment trust fund business by a credit card company.   The Financial Services Agency on Monday approved the investment trust fund operations of a wholly owned asset management unit established last year by Credit Saison.  This unit will obtain products from Vanguard Group and repackage them into funds of funds that invest in diverse holdings including domestic and overseas stocks and bonds.  Sawakami Asset Management Inc. is also slated to provide products to Credit Saison.   Credit Saison plans to keep its annual management and custodial fees low by charging customers around 0.7% of their investments. This contrasts with the average 1.5% fees charged on traditional investment trust funds and the more than 2% for some mutual funds that specialize in international investments.   Credit Saison will also waive its sales commissions, giving customers a break from the roughly 3% usually charged by asset management companies.   For the time being, Credit Saison will market the products to cardholders through its monthly credit card statements and over the Internet. In a bid to woo investment novices, Credit Saison will market its funds from Y5,000. Eventually, it will enable cardholders to pay for the investments by credit card.   Credit Saison will target a net asset balance of Y200 billion by 2010.   To keep its sales commissions at zero, the credit card company does not plan to outsource sales to other financial institutions. It plans to eventually expand its product lineup, but will maintain its low-fee strategy.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 12:15 ET (17:15 GMT)

Headline: Countrywide Adjourns EGM On 3i Buyout Vote - 3
Story: The scheme to take Countyrywide private can be blocked by shareholders representing 25% of Countrywide shares.   The company said it had received proxies from 1,392 shareholders representing 53.55% of the independent scheme shares. Of this percentage 61.7% of the shares were in favor of the scheme and 38.3% against.   Meanwhile, 3i said in a press briefing following the adjournment of the extraordinary general meeting that it didn't intend to revise its offer, which it believed was fair and reasonable. It also noted that there was no other offer on the table.   "The proxy votes submitted ahead of the Court Meeting and EGM demonstrated that a clear majority of votes cast by way of proxy are in favor of the scheme of arrangement succeeding.   In addition, we note that proxies submitted against the scheme amounted to less than 20% of Countrywide's issued share capital, it said in a subsequent statement.   -By Marietta Cauchi and Molly Dover,  Dow Jones Newswires;  +44 207 842 9241; marietta.cauchi@dowjones.com.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 06:35 ET (11:35 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Trucking Veteran John T. Hickerson To Lead FFE Transportation Services, Inc. Dry Van Division>FFEX
Story: DALLAS, Jan. 15, 2007 (PRIME NEWSWIRE) -- John T. Hickerson, 55, has joined FFE Transportation Services, Inc. ("FFE"), as Division President of American Eagle Lines, the company's 500-truck dry truckload fleet. Mr. Hickerson will also lead FFE's freight brokerage operation. The announcement came Monday from Stoney M. Stubbs, President and CEO FFE and its parent Frozen Food Express Industries, Inc. (Nasdaq:FFEX).   "We are fortunate to have brought to our team such a seasoned veteran with an extensive background in our industry," Stubbs said. "John has proven his ability to successfully lead diverse organizations and we look forward to the success we know he will have with American Eagle."   Prior to joining American Eagle, Hickerson served as Chairman and CEO of Pacer Transport, a division of Pacer International, Inc., Vice President of Domestic Intermodal at the Burlington Northern Sante Fe Railway, President - Roadway Next Day Corporation, and he spent 22 years in the CF / Con-Way family of companies most recently as the founding President and CEO of Con-Way Southern Express.   Hickerson is active in the American Trucking Association, where he has served as Vice President for Texas. He also is a past chairman of the Texas Motor Transportation Association and is a past board member of the Texas Chamber of Commerce.   Hickerson received his Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration from Centenary College in Shreveport, LA. He received post-graduate education through the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA) Anderson School of Business and Columbia University's Senior Executive Program.   The FFE Transportation Services, Inc. logo is available at http://www.primenewswire.com/newsroom/prs/?pkgid=3209     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 16:54 ET (21:54 GMT)

Headline: : New Vishay Siliconix N-Channel PowerPAK(R) ChipFET(R) MOSFETs Offer Same 3-W Maximum Power Dissipation as Larger SO-8 in 81 % Smaller Footprint
Story: New Devices Feature Low On-Resistance Values Down to 0.015 Ohms  MALVERN, Pa.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   Vishay Intertechnology, Inc. (NYSE: VSH) today released eight n-channel power MOSFETs in an innovative new PowerPAK(R) ChipFET(R) package that offers advanced thermal performance in a compact 3-mm by 1.8-mm footprint. Featuring a broad variety of configurations and voltages, the new devices allow designers to easily replace larger power MOSFETs in a wide range of power-conversion applications.     As a space-saving alternative to MOSFETs in the much larger SO-8 package, the new PowerPAK ChipFET devices deliver higher power density by offering the same 3-W maximum power dissipation with an 81 % smaller footprint area and a 48 % thinner height profile (0.8 mm).     For optimized design efficiency, n-channel power MOSFETs in Vishay's new PowerPAK ChipFET family are designed for point-of-load, synchronous rectification, and logic-level dc-to-dc conversion applications in low-power computer and fixed telecomm applications where space is at a premium.     N-channel PowerPAK ChipFET devices will also be used as load switches in portable electronic systems and notebook PCs, delivering footprint savings of 33 %, a 23 % thinner height profile, and a 9 % reduction in on-resistance at a 4.5-V gate drive compared with power MOSFETs in the TSOP-6.     Among the eight new devices announced today are single, dual, and single-plus-Schottky-diode power MOSFETs, with breakdown voltage ratings from 20 V to 60 V.     Single n-channel power MOSFETs in the PowerPAK ChipFET family are rated for typical thermal resistance values as low as 3 degrees Celsius/W (junction to case), with maximum on-resistance values as low as 0.015 ohms in a 20-V drain-to-source n-channel single-channel device and 0.039 ohms in a dual-channel device. The single-plus-Schottky-diode power MOSFETs feature on-resistance values as low as 0.039 ohms and Schottky diode forward voltage of 0.375 V at 1 A.     All of these new PowerPAK ChipFET devices are pin-compatible with products in the standard ChipFET package.       Links to product datasheets:       http://www.vishay.com/doc?73783 (Si5486DU)       http://www.vishay.com/doc?73589 (Si5484DU)       http://www.vishay.com/doc?73594 (Si5482DU)       http://www.vishay.com/doc?73585 (Si5480DU)       http://www.vishay.com/doc?73663 (Si5476DU)       http://www.vishay.com/doc?73460 (Si5858DU)       http://www.vishay.com/doc?73463 (Si5938DU)       http://www.vishay.com/doc?73683 (Si5944DU)     Samples and production quantities of the new PowerPAK ChipFET devices are available now, with lead times of 12 to 14 weeks for larger orders.     Vishay Intertechnology, Inc., a Fortune 1,000 Company listed on the NYSE (VSH), is one of the world's largest manufacturers of discrete semiconductors (diodes, rectifiers, transistors, and optoelectronics and selected ICs) and passive electronic components (resistors, capacitors, inductors, sensors, and transducers). These components are used in virtually all types of electronic devices and equipment in the industrial, computing, automotive, consumer, telecommunications, military, aerospace, and medical markets. Its product innovations, successful acquisition strategy, and ability to provide "one-stop shop" service have made Vishay a global industry leader. Vishay can be found on the Internet at http://www.vishay.com.     PowerPAK and ChipFET are registered trademarks of Siliconix incorporated. Headline: : Ted Nieman Joins Claude Resources's Board >CGR
Story: SASKATOON, Jan. 15 /CNW Telbec/ - Josef Spross, Chairman of the Board of Claude Resources Inc., (TSX: CRJ, AMEX: CGR) is pleased to announce that Ted Nieman has joined the Company's Board of Directors. Mr. Nieman, a resident of Saskatoon, began his career with the law firm of Estey, Robertson, Muzyka, Beaumont, Barton & Bell in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada in 1973. He spent almost 20 years with that firm and its successor firm, Robertson Stromberg, becoming a partner in 1977 and a senior partner in 1987. In 1993, Mr. Nieman joined Canpotex Limited ("Canpotex"), the world's largest exporter of potash, as General Counsel and Corporate Secretary. In 1995, he was appointed Vice President and in 2001 he was appointed Senior Vice President. Mr. Nieman has held several senior positions in Canpotex including Chief Operating Officer (2001-2004) responsible for all Canpotex operations. He is a current member of the Canpotex Executive Management Group, and is a member of the board of directors of all Canpotex subsidiaries and affiliates. Mr. Nieman received his Bachelor of Arts degree in 1971 and his Bachelor of Laws degree in 1973, both from the University of Saskatchewan. He is a member of the Law Society of Saskatchewan and the Canadian Bar Association. "Mr Nieman's skill and experience represents another significant addition to Claude's Board of Directors," stated Mr. Spross.    Claude is a public company based in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, whose shares trade on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX-CRJ) and the American Stock Exchange (AMEX-CGR). Claude is a gold mining and exploration company with producing oil and natural gas assets. The Company's entire asset base is located in Canada. Since 1991, Claude has produced nearly 750,000 ounces of gold from its Seabee mine in northeastern Saskatchewan. The Company also owns 100% of the Madsen property in the Red Lake camp of northwestern Ontario.    %SEDAR: 00000498E          %CIK: 0001173924         /CONTACT: Neil McMillan, President and CEO, (306) 668-7505, Fax: (306) 668-7500, clauderesources@clauderesources.com; Renmark Financial Communications Inc.: Neil Murray-Lyon, nmurraylyon@renmarkfinancial.com; Christina Lalli: clalli@renmarkfinancial.com, (514) 939-3989, Fax: (514) 939-3717, www.renmarkfinancial.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 17:15 ET (22:15 GMT)

Headline: 3rd UPDATE: Vedanta 3Q EBITDA Jumps On Prices, Output
Story: (This updates an item published at 0903 with further analyst comment and updated share price.)     By Jackie Range   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--Metals and mining company Vedanta Resources PLC (VED.LN) Monday said its third-quarter earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization, or EBITDA, had jumped, crediting higher prices paid for its commodities and larger volumes produced.   But while production across all the metals Vedanta produces in India rose, output from the company's Zambian assets suffered after production was hit by environmental problems.   Vedanta's EBITDA was $724.3 million for the three months to Dec. 31 2006, compared with $264.6 million for the comparable period in the previous financial year. The number outstripped an average expectation of $698.4 million expected by seven analysts surveyed by the company.   FTSE 100-listed Vedanta produces a range of metals, with key products including aluminum, copper, zinc and lead. Its main operations are in India.   The production and earnings update got a mixed reception from analysts.   One analyst, who asked to remain nameless, said the results looked "pretty solid to us," adding that the numbers were "pretty much in line with our expectations."   Vedanta's shares "should trade pretty positively" Monday, the analyst added.    At 1047 GMT Vedanta's shares were trading up 2.2% or 25 pence at 1135 pence, outperforming a mixed mining sector.   But another analyst, while saying the company had posted a "reasonably good" set of numbers, with a strong performance from its Indian assets, highlighted the problems in Zambia.   Costs at Konkola Copper Mines - Vedanta's Zambian business - are "astronomically high," the analyst said, calculating that they are running at $1.71 per pound of copper. "I think you need to see a bit of progress there to get radically positive on the stock."   The second analyst pointed to the stock of copper miner Kazakhmys PLC (KAZ.LN) as providing better exposure to base metals - pointing out that it is cheaper on the basis of price to earnings ratio.   In terms of production, the biggest increase on the same quarter last year came for the company's aluminum division, which produced 98,000 metric tons, up from 60,000 tons in the third quarter of last year. The first analyst said this performance offset the disappointing showing in Zambia.   Copper cathode production in Zambia was 35,000 tons, down from 46,000 tons in the third quarter of the previous year. A mine effluent spillage late last year caused the company's copper leach plant to be closed and 50,000 residents in a local town to be left without water. The company said the environmental issues had been resolved and "steady and cautious steps are now being taken to bring the leaching plant back to its normal levels of production," Vedanta said in its press release.   Vedanta's revenues rose to $1.76 billion, up from $974.7 million in the previous year period. The company attributed the gain to higher volumes and prices.   Lehman Brothers said Vedanta's third-quarter numbers were disappointing, and cut its target price for the shares to GBP14 from GBP15. Lehman rates Vedanta equal weight.   The volumes of commodities produced by Vedanta were in line with Lehman's expectations, but revenue and EBITDA came in lower. "We view these results as somewhat disappointing. We believe Vedanta shares trade at an attractive valuation, but we would wait for pullbacks to be a buyer," Lehman said.     Company Web site: http://www.vedantaresources.com     -By Jackie Range, Dow Jones Newswires; +44 207 842 9257; jackie.range@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 05:58 ET (10:58 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Badger Income Fund January Cash Distribution>BAD.UN.
Story: CALGARY, Jan. 15 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ - Badger Income Fund ("Badger") today announced that the trustees of Badger declared a cash distribution for the month of January of $0.105 per fund unit, representing $1.26 per fund unit on an annualized basis. Payment will be made on or about February 15, 2007 to unitholders of record on January 31, 2007.     Badger Income Fund is an open-ended trust that is North America's largest provider of non-destructive excavating services. Badger traditionally works for contractors and facility owners in the utility and petroleum industries. Our key technology is the Badger Hydrovac, which is used primarily for safe digging in congested grounds and challenging conditions. The Badger Hydrovac uses a pressurized water stream to liquefy the soil cover, which is then removed with a powerful vacuum system and deposited into a storage tank. Badger manufactures its truck-mounted hydrovac units.     Badger Income Fund's business model involves the provision of excavating services through two distinct entities: the Operating Partners (franchisees in the United States and agents in Canada), and Badger Corporate. Badger Corporate works with its Operating Partners to provide Hydrovac service to the end user. In this partnership, Badger provides the expertise, the trucks, and North American marketing and administration support. The Operating Partners deliver the service by operating the equipment and developing their local markets. All work is invoiced by Badger and then shared with the Operating Partner based upon a revenue sharing formula. In limited locations Badger has established corporate run operations to market and deliver the service in the local area.     This press release contains forward-looking statements subject to various risk factors and uncertainties, which may cause the actual results, performances or achievements of Badger to be materially different from any future results, performances or achievements expressed or implied by such forward-looking statements. Such factors include, but are not limited to, fluctuations in the market for oil and gas related products and services, political and economic conditions, the demand for services provided by Badger, industry competition and Badger's ability to attract and retain key personnel.        The Toronto Stock Exchange has neither approved nor disapproved the        information contained herein. Headline: SmartMoney(2/1) Street Smart: Changing Gears
Story: (From SMARTMONEY)     By Reshma Kapadia   No one likes to admit their youth is behind them, and corporate executives are no different. But a handful of big growth companies are discovering that to really improve profit growth, downshifting a little may be smarter than putting the pedal to the metal.   Thanks to the rapid growth at many firms in the 1990s, it's been difficult for many CEOs to fathom a future without hyperexpansion. Some, such as Time Warner, tried to keep it going through mega-mergers, while others, like Home Depot, saturated existing markets with new stores. But those efforts often backfired, lowering return on capital and, of course, weighing on share prices. "A lot of the time, companies were so preoccupied with chasing the next big growth opportunity, they weren't good stewards of capital," says Todd Lowenstein, manager of the HighMark Value Momentum fund. "But a few are beginning to get religion." In other words, they are realizing that it's time to generate better returns with what they have.   For some companies, of course, that means cutting costs or using excess cash to increase dividends or buy back shares. But growing old gracefully also includes dumping unprofitable businesses and focusing more on innovation than acquisition. Ultimately, investors should look for firms that are focused on maximizing shareholder return, says Susan Byrne, manager of the Westwood Equity AAA fund. "Investors should look for companies generating a lot of free cash flow," Byrne says. "Those are the stocks we want."   IBM is one example, Byrne says. Big Blue has successfully reinvented itself, leaving behind its hardware roots and making strides in the more profitable software and burgeoning services businesses. It has produced strong earnings surprises in the past two quarters and doubled its free cash flow-the amount of cash left over after paying all the bills and reinvesting in the business. It has also boosted its dividend an average 15 percent annually over the past five years. "It's a highly profitable, quality company selling at a discount to the market," Byrne says. "That doesn't happen often. People haven't realized how much  their business model has changed." Byrne thinks the stock can hit $150 in three years.   After years of acquisitions and expanding market share, Waste Management concluded that it won't do much good to keep getting bigger, says Friedman Billings Ramsey environmental services analyst Brian Butler. So the company is now focusing on its bottom line, in large part by raising rates. "It's a sign of maturity," says  Butler. The country's largest garbage hauler is now tapping more of its expanding free cash flow to buy back stock and raise its dividend instead of servicing acquisition-related debt. Butler expects the stock to rise at least another 11 percent, to $42, as investors recognize the company's new strategy is not short-lived.   McDonald's is also betting on becoming better rather than bigger, boosting return on invested capital rather than crowding the world with too many golden arches. A couple of years ago, a quarter of the chain's new stores were placed within a mile of one another, leading to cannibalization, says UBS restaurants analyst David Palmer. Now McDonald's is trying to make its existing stores more profitable by attracting more per-store customers. (It's improved its breakfast offerings, for example.) The company is also selling stores in troubled markets, such as Brazil, and taking on the role of franchisor more frequently than operator, which frees up cash and creates a more stable income stream, says Palmer, who thinks the stock can rise to $47.   ---   SmartMoney.com: Find more mature growth companies at www.smartmoney.com.   ---                             GROWING OLD GRACEFULLY                                         Mkt. Value         2007  Company (Ticker)      Price          ($bil)              P/E    IBM (IBM)             $94             142.8               14  Waste Management (WMI) 38              20.3               19  McDonald's (MCD)       44              53.7               17    Data as of 12/8/06. SOURCE: BASELINE     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 06:00 ET (11:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: WSJE(1/15) Breakingviews: BP's Lord Browne Ran Out Of Gas
Story: (From THE WALL STREET JOURNAL EUROPE)   LORD BROWNE has rightly quit BP early. While long considered Britain's best businessman for crafting a global oil giant from a former state monopoly, the chief executive of the oil giant became a dead duck after losing a series of power struggles with Chairman Peter Sutherland. His legacy was also tarnished by a series of mishaps. He will step down officially in July.   Lord Browne's days were numbered when the board failed to agree to his wish to stay on past the company's normal retirement age. He then tried to take control of the appointment process for his successor. When that failed, he faced a scenario in which he would have been reduced to impotence. The final blow came from Tony Hayward, now appointed to succeed him. The head of exploration and production launched what some perceived as a thinly-veiled attack on his boss's management style on BP's intranet just before Christmas.   Lord Browne may not have been as effective at boardroom politics as the pugnacious Mr. Sutherland. But that disadvantage might not have mattered if BP hadn't simultaneously suffered a series of serious operational problems in the U.S.: the Texas City refinery blast, corrosion on its Alaskan pipeline and alleged abuses in propane trading.   These didn't just cause bad publicity. They raised questions over whether BP was actually well-managed -- and, in particular, whether Amoco and Arco, Lord Browne's two big acquisitions, had been properly integrated. BP's shares, once a gusher, started to underperform.   Mr. Hayward takes over at a difficult time. He must restore confidence among investors that the colossus Lord Browne created can be run effectively. He also has to do this against a background of falling oil prices. The good news is that, with Lord Browne going in six months, there's no question about who's in charge.     EMI     It looks as though EMI Group has effectively run up the white flag. The British record company has warned on profits, sacked its two top music men and hinted at a balance-sheet restructuring. With negative free cash flow in four of the past five years, a dividend cut is also possible. Having narrowly fended off two takeover approaches last year, this no longer looks like a firm with much of an independent future, or much longterm shareholder support either.   That may sound harsh. But in many ways, the company's fate mirrors that of ITV, the U.K. broadcaster. Both have struggled to cope with the digital age. Both, too, were led by bosses known for their cost-cutting skills but not their media savvy. ITV's Charles Allen came from a catering firm, and eventually got the boot. The only reason ITV retained its independence is that it got in a heavy-hitting new boss to replace him. EMI, by contrast, is going the other way. Out goes its respected recorded-music boss Alain Levy. Down comes EMI Chairman Eric Nicoli instead, a former biscuit-company boss, with a stronger focus on marketing music than finding new hits.   So it seems that EMI may be getting ready to disappear, at least in its current form. Still, it has to go through the motions of independence. Hence its announced restructuring plan. Taxed and capitalized, the GBP 110 million, or $215.5 million, of annual savings it has targeted are worth almost 100 pence a share. But investors clearly take these plans with a pinch of salt; they marked down EMI stock by 20 pence following the announcement. The only reason the shares didn't fall further is because of hopes EMI will eventually be sold.   A tie-up with Warner Music still makes industrial and financial sense, regulatory approval allowing. Alternatively, private equity might make a repeat approach, buying EMI's stable publishing division and selling on its more volatile recorded-music business. There is little to suggest that Mr. Nicoli would be averse to this idea, at the right price. Indeed, the suggestion that EMI's debts might be re-apportioned between its two divisions can even be seen as a prelude to a break-up.     Endesa     Amidst all the noise surrounding the Endesa bid battle, Caja Madrid has kept unusually quiet. The Spanish regional savings bank, which owns 10% of the power company, hasn't said whether it plans to sell its stake to E.On or Gas Natural, or to side with Acciona, the Spanish construction company that has amassed a 21% stake in Endesa. But thanks to Endesa's quirky bylaws, Caja Madrid could ultimately decide who wins or loses.   The bylaws stipulate that no shareholder can vote more than 10% of the shares outstanding, which means Caja Madrid has as much power as Acciona. E.On's 36 billion euro ($46.5 billion) offer is conditional on removing the voting cap. That requires approval from 50% of the shares eligible to vote.   It won't be easy for E.On to prevail, as Acciona will probably vote against E.On's current offer and some shareholders won't show up at all. If Caja Madrid votes against a change, then 77% of the free float would need to show up at a meeting to push through the change, which is all but impossible. But if Caja Madrid votes in favor, then the odds improve to 67% of the votes -- hard, but conceivable.   Of course, E.On could waive the condition and plow ahead with its offer anyway, hoping to change the bylaws after the fact. But that would be risky.   Which way will Caja Madrid turn? Ultimately, it is a political animal, accountable to local politicians in Madrid. Caja Madrid's chairman, Miguel Blesa, is associated with the opposition party, the Partido Popular. The PP hasn't been as vocal against the German bid as the ruling Socialist party. But the Socialists, as well as other left-leaning parties, are also represented on Caja Madrid's board.   There is one way E.On could make the decision easier for Caja Madrid: Pay through the nose. Endesa's shares are trading more than 2 euros above E.on's already generous 34.50 euro-a-share offer. It may have to get closer to 40 euros to get the savings bank to speak up in E.On's favor.   ---   Hugo Dixon and Simon Nixon; John Paul Rathbone; Fiona Maharg-Bravo   ---   For more commentary, go to www.breakingviews.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 00:30 ET (05:30 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: FOCUS: More M&A Action Seen For Europe's Aerospace Cos
Story: By Rod Stone   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--What's been talked about for many years is finally a reality.   Many of Europe's leading aerospace equipment suppliers are clearly in play following General Electric Co.'s (GE) move Monday to acquire U.K.-based Smiths Group PLC's (SMIN.LN) aerospace business for $4.8 billion. The sheer scale of new airplane programs and the desire of top-level players like Boeing Co. (BA) and Airbus to have smaller supplier bases as they drive down prices and spread costs is likely to spur this trend on, say sector watchers.   Smiths Group Chief Executive Keith Butler-Wheelhouse said the evolving shape of the aerospace business is driving the need for consolidation. "The structure of the aerospace industry is changing - in particular its increased capital requirements and the growing importance of supplier scale, especially as the next generation of large programs kicks in," he said.   A banker who worked on the Smiths/GE deal and asked for anonymity said more consolidation is likely in Europe but declined to name bid targets. The massive development costs of new airplane programs and the huge amounts of capital required are key drivers, he said.   In recent years, the earnings of Smiths' aerospace unit have been hit by both the weaker dollar and rising development costs on the new plane programs it's involved with. The key ones are Airbus' delayed double-decker A380 plane, Boeing's fuel-efficient 787 and the Boeing 767 midair refueling tanker program.   To help cut their costs of developing new airplanes the likes of Boeing now typically look to involve suppliers as partners that invest in an aircraft's development in return for a future share of revenues. They increasingly prefer to deal with fewer and larger suppliers that oversee the procurement of smaller components.   For the new 787, which is due to enter into service in 2008, Boeing expects to have some 100 to 200 top-tier suppliers compared with as many as 800 to 1,000 on past programs, according to Mike Bair, chief of the 787 project. Overall, the U.S. aerospace giant has gone from over 30,000 suppliers six years ago to just over 6,000 today, according to a spokesman.    Airbus, which is owned by European Aeronautic Defence & Space Co. (5730.FR), is also making a similar drive to cut the number of suppliers as it battles the impact of a weaker dollar. Similar trends are also evident on programs to develop new military planes.   Speaking in Paris Monday, Denis Ranque, chief executive of French defense and aerospace electronics giant Thales SA (12132.FR), said the Smiths deal is a signal that the cycle of consolidation isn't over yet. He noted the desires of Boeing and Airbus to deal with fewer suppliers.                 Number Of UK Suppliers Seen In Play      Other aerospace suppliers such as Cobham PLC (COB.LN), Meggitt PLC (MGGT.LN), Ultra Electronics PLC (ULE.LN) and Chemring Group PLC (CHG.LN) of the U.K. are all now seen as clear contenders for consolidation, according to analysts. These companies have been buying up a string of smaller suppliers in recent years to bulk up.   Although Thales isn't seen currently as a potential takeover target, analysts note that it competes directly with Smiths for avionics business and could target further smaller acquisitions.   All these U.K. suppliers benefited from the strong upturn in the past two years in the commercial airplane sector and from healthy defense equipment spending in the U.S.. Last year, both Boeing and Airbus had record order books and have huge backlogs they are now looking to fill.   Underlining the attractiveness of the sector, on Jan. 4 Cobham disclosed that Barcelona-based industrialist Francesc Rubiralta Vilaseca had built around a 5% stake. Analysts said the move clearly shows the industry still has substantial growth opportunities in both commercial and aerospace.   In a research note Monday, Numis Securities said companies such as Meggitt, Cobham and Ultra could all be attractive to a large U.S. predator. The read across from the Smiths deal is that these aerospace plays are now trading at hefty discounts to the price paid by GE, it added.   Evolution Securities, which has a buy rating on Smiths, said Cobham and Meggitt are the obvious standouts but there could also be some attention on GKN PLC's (GKN.LN) aerospace unit. These global niche value-added stocks are vulnerable to consolidation, Evolution said.   GKN has sold its 50% holding in helicopter maker AgustaWestland to Italian aerospace and defense company Finmeccanica SpA (FNC.MI), leaving GKN with a smaller aerospace unit alongside its automotive operation. Finmeccanica has also been linked as a possible suitor for the U.K.'s Ultra Electronics.   The likes of U.S.-based Honeywell International Inc. (HON), Rockwell Collins Corp. (COL) and General Dynamics (GD) have long been seen as potential buyers of European aerospace suppliers. Private-equity firms such as U.S.-based Carlyle Group LP and European players like Cinven have also shown a strong appetite for European aerospace assets.   The Panmure Gordon brokerage, meanwhile, also sees consolidation potential for Cobham, Ultra and Meggitt but said there's clearly scope for others to step in with a a bid for the whole of Smiths. The brokerage has a buy rating on Smiths Group.   Hopes of more takeover action pushed Smiths' main peers higher Monday. In early afternoon trading Cobham was up 3.4%, Meggitt ahead 4.6%, Ultra Electronics up 1% and GKN up 0.9%. Smiths Group shares, meanwhile, were up over 14% on the day.     -By Rod Stone, Dow Jones Newswires; +44 207 842 9295; rod.stone@dowjones.com   (David Pearson in Paris contributed to this report.)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 10:20 ET (15:20 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Tanox, Inc. Stockholders Approve Merger With Genentech, Inc.
Story: HOUSTON, Jan. 15 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Tanox, Inc. (Nasdaq: TNOX) (the "Company") announced today that its stockholders have voted to adopt the merger agreement providing for the merger of the Company and a wholly owned subsidiary of Genentech, Inc. (NYSE: DNA), at the Company's special meeting of stockholders held today in Houston, Texas.     Approximately 34.2 million shares of common stock were voted at the special meeting in favor of the adoption of the merger agreement, representing about 75.5 percent of Tanox's total outstanding shares and 99.9 percent of the number of shares voted at the meeting.  Adoption by the affirmative vote of the holders of a majority of shares of our common stock outstanding on the record date was required.     Under the terms of the merger agreement, promptly following the closing of the merger, Tanox stockholders would receive $20.00 in cash, without interest, for each share of Tanox common stock held.  This represents a premium of approximately 47% over the last trading day before the proposed merger was announced and a 51% premium over the average share price over the 90 days before the proposed merger was announced.     The transaction is anticipated to close in the first quarter of 2007, subject to expiration of the waiting period under the Hart-Scott-Rodino Antitrust Improvements Act and the satisfaction of other customary closing conditions.  The transaction was first announced in a news release dated Nov. 9, 2006.        About Tanox, Inc.     Tanox is a biotechnology company specializing in the development of monoclonal antibodies. The company develops innovative biotherapeutics for the treatment of immune-mediated diseases, inflammation, infectious disease and cancer.  Tanox's lead investigational therapy, TNX-355, is a viral-entry inhibitor antibody to treat HIV/AIDS.  TNX-355 has shown significant antiviral activity in Phase 2 clinical testing.  Tanox's first-approved drug, Xolair(R) (omalizumab), is the first antibody approved to treat moderate-to-severe confirmed, allergic asthma.  Xolair was developed in collaboration with Genentech, Inc. and Novartis Pharma AG and is approved for marketing in the United States, Canada and major European countries.  Tanox is based in Houston and has a manufacturing facility in San Diego.  Additional corporate information is available at http://www.tanox.com .        Tanox Safe Harbor     This news release contains forward-looking statements, including, in particular, statements about Tanox's intention to close the merger with Genentech's subsidiary. These are based on Tanox's current assumptions, expectations and projections about future events. Although Tanox believes that the expectations reflected in these forward-looking statements are reasonable, Tanox can give no assurance that the expectations will prove to be correct. Numerous risks, uncertainties and other factors may cause actual results to differ materially from those expressed in any forward-looking statements. These factors include, but are not limited to, (1) the occurrence of any event, change or other circumstance that would give rise to the termination of the merger agreement, (2) the outcome of any legal proceedings that have been or may be instituted against Tanox and/or others relating to the merger agreement, (3) the inability to complete the merger due to the failure to satisfy other conditions to consummation of the merger, including the expiration of the waiting period under the Hart-Scott-Rodino Antitrust Improvements Act, and (4) the failure of the merger to close for any other reason.  There may be other events in the future that Tanox is not able to accurately predict or over which it has no control.  The risk factors listed in Tanox's Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended Dec. 31, 2005, filed with the SEC and subsequently filed Forms 10-Q and 8-K, provide examples of risks, uncertainties and events that may cause its actual results or matters relating to the merger to differ materially from the expectations described in forward-looking statements.  Tanox undertakes no obligation, other than as required by applicable law, to update publicly any forward-looking statements in light of new information or future events. Headline: : Aysin Neville Returns To BearingPoint As SAP Global Practice Leader>BE
Story: MCLEAN, Va., Jan. 15 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- BearingPoint, Inc. (NYSE: BE), one of the world's largest management and technology consulting firms, today announced Aysin Neville has re-joined the company as senior vice president, Global SAP Leader, to guide its strategic relationship with the software provider.     With more than 20 years in the software industry, Neville comes to BearingPoint from Deloitte, where she served in the high technology industry practice. Neville has extensive experience in operations, corporate finance, program management, strategic planning, business development and organizational management.     During her previous tenure with BearingPoint, she was a vice president in the software, SAP, Peoplesoft and Oracle practices, where she was responsible for all aspects of the business.     "We couldn't be more excited to have someone of Aysin's caliber return to the BearingPoint team," said Robert Hershey, practice leader, Global Enterprise Solutions. "Her strong ties and experience with SAP and the enterprise software industry will play key roles as we work with SAP to further extend their solutions into composite applications, business performance management and service-oriented architecture. She will be instrumental in defining and guiding our working relationship with SAP."        About BearingPoint, Inc.     BearingPoint, Inc. (NYSE: BE) is one of the world's largest providers of management and technology consulting services to Global 2000 companies and government organizations in 60 countries worldwide.  Based in McLean, Va., the firm has over 17,000 employees and major practice areas focusing on the Public Services, Financial Services and Commercial Services markets.  For nearly 100 years, BearingPoint professionals have built a reputation for knowing what it takes to help clients achieve their goals, and working closely with them to get the job done.  For more information, visit the Company's website at http://www.BearingPoint.com.     Some of the statements in this press release constitute "forward-looking statements" within the meaning of the United States Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995.  These statements are based on our current expectations, estimates and projections. Headline: : Brazilian Diamonds Limited: Further Microdiamonds Recovered At Regis Kimberlite Project>BDY.T
Story: VANCOUVER, BRITISH COLUMBIA--(CCNMatthews - Jan. 15, 2007) - Brazilian Diamonds Limited (TSX:BDY)(AIM:BDY) is pleased to announce that it continues to recover both micro and macro diamonds from core drilling on its large Regis kimberlite project in Brazil. These new results confirm that the Regis kimberlite is diamond-bearing and provides further support for the Company's in-house exploration model for diamond-bearing kimberlites within this region of Brazil. The ongoing validation of this model further enhances the exploration potential of the other kimberlite targets within the Company's licence portfolio.    The Company has now received the results of caustic fusion testing for micro-diamonds from the second drill hole at the Regis kimberlite. This second drill hole, RDH02, returned a total of 20 micro-diamonds from 381.3 kilograms (kg) of kimberlite core processed. RDH02 was drilled vertically to a depth of 251 metres (m), with kimberlite core sampled from the 88 m to 251 m interval. Significantly, 18 of the 20 micro-diamonds recovered were encountered from the interval between 229.6 m and 243.9 m vertical depth, which weighed 32.5 kg in total. This prolific interval is now being examined further to determine whether it represents a high grade portion of the kimberlite.    Core from RDH02 was split at the Company's Patos de Minas laboratory and shipped in 47 batches of approximately 8 kg each to the Saskatchewan Research Council (SRC) Laboratory, in Saskatoon, Canada. The kimberlite was tested for micro-diamonds using the caustic fusion method with a bottom screen size of 0.075 mm; micro-diamonds which remained on 0.075 to 0.212 mm screens were recovered (Table 1).      Table 1: Size distribution of micro-diamonds from drill hole RDH02 at  the Regis Kimberlite Pipe, in central Minas Gerais State, Brazil.    =--------------------------------------                   No. of                    micro-   Total sample  Screen size    diamonds          weight  =--------------------------------------    =--------------------------------------  0.600mm               0  =--------------------------------------  0.425mm               0  =--------------------------------------  0.300mm               0  =--------------------------------------  0.212mm               1  =--------------------------------------  0.150mm               1  =--------------------------------------  0.106mm               9  =--------------------------------------  0.075mm               9  =--------------------------------------    =--------------------------------------                       20        381.3 kg  =--------------------------------------      RDH02 was drilled vertically 112 m east of RDH01, which was previously reported in a press release dated October 17, 2006 as yielding 129 micro-diamonds from 348.75 kg of kimberlite. Drill holes RDH01 and RDH02 were completed in August 2006 to depths of 317 m and 251 m respectively, in a central, pipe-like zone of approximately 20 hectares in size within the larger Regis kimberlite body. This central pipe-like body was previously untested by previous exploration and is now demonstrated to be diamond-bearing.    Delineation of this central pipe at the Regis Kimberlite continues with drill holes RDH03 and RDH04 having been recently completed to vertical depths of 152.0 and 364.3 m respectively. Preliminary examination of core suggests RDH03 and RDH04 comprise multiple kimberlite phases including a new, previously untested mantle xenolith-rich interval in RDH03. Each kimberlite phase has the potential for carrying a different concentration of diamonds. Two additional holes (RDH05 and RDH06) are currently being completed in order to more fully delineate the central pipe. Core from each drill hole will be sent to SRC for micro-diamond testing and the results expected during the first and second quarters of 2007.    In addition to the caustic fusion tests completed on drill holes RDH01 and RDH02, selected intervals from the reference half split core from drill hole RDH01 were processed for indicator minerals at the Company's Patos de Minas laboratory, which is ISO 17025 rated for certain indicator mineral recovery processes. The intervals processed consisted of the two zones which produced high micro-diamond counts, 113.4 to 142.8 m and 301.7 to 311.5 m. The interval 301.7 to 331.5 m (start weight 10.0 kg) yielded high counts of typical kimberlitic Cr-pyrope garnets, chrome diopside, forsteritic olivine, enstatite, chromite, Mg-ilmenite and two diamond fragments. These diamond fragments are both 0.6 mm in the longest dimension and appear to be broken pieces of the same original stone. The indicator mineral samples from RDH01 were crushed until greater than 90% of material passed through a -1.0 mm screen, using a bottom screen size of 0.25 mm. The samples were concentrated for heavy minerals using water columns and then picked for indicator minerals including diamonds by hand under optical microscopes.    The Company considers that the recovery of micro-diamonds from both of the first two deep drill tests of the Regis Kimberlite to be an important advance, both for the ongoing testing of the pipe itself, and for our diamond exploration model, which will be further tested at other kimberlite targets within the region. Results from the next phase of drilling will be announced as soon as they become available.    Dr. Harrison Cookenboo, (P.Geo) and Consulting Geologist, is the Qualified Person as defined under National Instrument 43-101 responsible for the technical disclosure in this release, and has reviewed and approved the contents of this release.    Editors' Note:-    Brazilian Diamonds is a leading Brazil-based exploration company focused on the discovery of kimberlites on its extensive portfolio of properties in the States of Minas Gerais and Bahia, with the goal of becoming a significant producer of diamonds.    The Company is awaiting final approval before commencing the environmental licensing process for development of the Canastra 1 kimberlite body for which mine feasibility work has already been completed and the required Mines Department approvals are already in place. It is intended to bring Canastra 1 into production once this licensing process is completed.    The Company has recently acquired the Chapada Diamantina project in Bahia from De Beers which includes the diamondiferous Salvador 1 kimberlite. Plans are under-way to undertake a large bulk sample at Salvador 1 utilizing a 15 tonne per hour DMS treatment plant, which is currently located at the Company's Santo Antonio do Bonito property. De Beers retains a right to acquire up to 40% of any kimberlite found containing more that 200 carats of diamonds on the Chapada Diamantina properties.    The Company has a fully operational diamond separation/analysis laboratory at Patos de Minas, Minas Gerais which is strategically located near its properties in the Santo Antonio and Coromandel areas. The Company has a highly experienced team including four geologists most of whom are located at the Company's facilities in Brazil.    The Company's strategy for non-core activities on its properties is to form joint ventures. A Cdn$1,000,000 feasibility study is currently underway for a joint venture for the mining of alluvial diamonds on its properties in the Santo Antonio river drainage. The joint venture involves two important Brazilian companies: CODEMIG, the state owned mining development organization and Mineracao Rio Novo Ltda., a wholly owned subsidiary of Andrade Gutierrez SA, one of Brazil's largest civil engineering firms and an existing large scale, dredge based producer of alluvial diamonds. Headline: Smiths Group To Sell Aerospace Unit To GE, Form JV -3-
Story: Edited Press Release     Smiths said following completion of the sale of the Aerospace unit, it is expected to generate improved returns on capital and enhanced margins.   The net effect of the sale and the intended return of capital to shareholders would have been accretive to Smiths headline earnings per share for pro forma 2006.   The board said it proposes, subject to completion of the sale and shareholder approval, to return GBP2.1bn - out of the net proceeds estimated to be GBP2.25bn - by means of a B share scheme, combined with a share consolidation, shortly after the completion of the sale.   The company said it will hold an extraordinary general meeting to approve the sale during the second quarter of 2007.   For the 53 week period ended Aug. 5, Aerospace recorded operating profits of GBP156 million on a turnover of GBP1.3 billion. Total Aerospace net assets before intercompany funding and gross assets were GBP808 million and GBP1,254 million respectively as at Aug. 5, the company said.   Keith Butler-Wheelhouse has agreed to defer his retirement by four months, to July 31, 2008, in order to continue to lead Smiths Group as Chief Executive throughout the coming financial year, the company said.   Smiths has agreed to pay GE a break fee in the event that Smiths shareholders do not vote in favour of the Sale. GE has agreed to pay Smiths a break fee in the event the sale does not complete due to GE's failure to use reasonable endeavours to obtain certain regulatory approvals. In each case, the amount of the break fee has been set at $110 million.   Following the sale, Smiths three divisions, Detection, Medical and  Specialty serve markets with attractive growth prospects, offering good prospects for enhanced returns.   The Board has assessed the capital structure of the Company. Following the intended return of capital to shareholders, Smiths is expected to have debt ratings of Baa2 and BBB+.   The Board is satisfied that the Company has flexibility to execute its strategy whilst maintaining a solid investment grade rating. The Board also believes that the enhanced financial characteristics of the Company will enable  a progressive dividend policy targeting dividend cover of 1.8 times, it said.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 02:32 ET (07:32 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Capstone Mining Corp.: Record Earnings Of C$12.3 Million And Earnings Per Share Of C$0.15 In Q1-2007>CS.T
Story: VANCOUVER, BRITISH COLUMBIA--(CCNMatthews - Jan. 15, 2007) - CAPSTONE MINING (TSX:CS) reported 1st quarter results ended November 30, 2006, its first producing quarter.    Significant events are as follows:    - Net earnings after tax were $12.3 million (including future income tax asset of $5.8 million), (2006 - $Nil).    - Earnings per share were $0.15 in Q1-2007, compared to earnings per share of ($0.01) in Q1-2006.    - Total throughput was 93,055 tonnes (103% of planned throughput). Production was 2.7 million pounds of copper, 161,000 ounces of silver, 1.9 million pounds of zinc and 900,000 pounds of lead.    - 90% of copper and zinc concentrates sold during the quarter were priced when loaded on the vessel, for realized prices of US$3.10 per pound copper and US$1.90 per pound zinc.    - On-site copper cash costs net of by-product credits were US$(0.04)/lb. Cash costs (the aggregate of smelter, refinery, transportation and all site costs) were US$0.44/lb in Q1-2007.    - Total costs (the aggregate of cash costs, depletion, amortization and royalty allowance) were $0.85/lb in Q1-2007.    - Working capital was $26.7 million at November 30, 2006.    2007 Metal Production    The forecasted copper, silver, lead and zinc production for the fiscal year 2007 is estimated to be 13 - 14 million pounds of copper, 750,000 ounces of silver, 3.5 million pounds of lead and 8 million pounds of zinc.    Expansion    During the quarter, basic engineering, capital costs and construction schedule were prepared for the expansion of the mine capacity from 350,000 tonnes per year to 750,000 tonnes per year (115% increase). All of the major equipment for the plant and mine has been purchased. The cost of expansion is estimated to be US$15 million which will be funded from operating cash flow. Expansion capacity will incrementally increase throughout the year with 2,200 tpd capacity expected to be achieved by the 4th calendar quarter. The expansion will increase the 2008 production at Cozamin to 26 million pounds of copper, 1.3 million ounces of silver, 4.0 million pounds of lead and 11.0 million pounds of zinc.    Exploration    Capstone has an exploration budget of US$6 million for the fiscal year 2007. A 5,000 m Phase 4 surface exploration program and a 20,000 m Phase 5 underground infill drill program are currently underway. To date, the Company has drilled 10 holes from underground, totaling 3,300 m and 2 holes from surface, totaling 1,800 m. In this ongoing drill program, the underground holes are designed to upgrade and expand the existing inferred resources adjacent to the areas being mined. The surface holes are exploring the potential of the Mala Noche vein below the areas of known resources and will test for other types of mineralization, such as stockwork and skarn at depth.    The information in this news release should be read in conjunction with the Interim Consolidated Financial Statements and Management Discussion and Analysis for the quarter ended November 30, 2006, which will be available on the Company's web site www.capstonemining.com and at www.sedar.com.    ABOUT CAPSTONE    Capstone is a Canadian based mining company currently operating the 100% owned Cozamin copper-silver-lead-zinc mine located in Zacatecas State, Mexico. Capstone has approximately 80.8 million shares outstanding and is well financed with no bank debt. More information is available online at: www.capstonemining.com. Headline: Fastweb 4Q Rev +26%, Turns Cash Flow Positive
Story: By Giada Zampano   Of DOWJONES NEWSWIRES     MILAN (Dow Jones)--Italy's second-largest telecommunications operator Fastweb SpA (FWB.MI) Monday posted a 26% rise in fourth-quarter revenue and achieved its target of a first-time positive cash flow by the end of 2006, according to preliminary data.   The Milan-based company, which provides fixed-line telephony and broadband services, said its revenue in the fourth quarter rose to EUR362 million from EUR287.5 million a year earlier, helped by solid growth in new subscriptions.   Earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization in the fourth quarter stood at EUR127 million.   Analysts expected revenue of EUR360 million in the fourth quarter, with EBITDA at EUR126 million.   Since it expanded its network to cover most of Italy, Fastweb has aggressively competed with former telecommunication monopoly Telecom Italia SpA (TI).   Fastweb aims to add mobile phone services to the Internet, phone and on-demand media content it already provides.       Company Web site: http://www.fastweb.it      -By Giada Zampano, Dow Jones Newswires; +39-02-5821 9907; giada.zampano@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 03:10 ET (08:10 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Arrow Electronics Partners with One Network Enterprises for Global Supply Chain Service
Story: ENGLEWOOD, Colo., Jan. 15 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Arrow Global Components, a business unit of Arrow Electronics, Inc. (NYSE: ARW), today announced the worldwide release of Arrow CARES, an inventory, auto-replenishment system, developed in partnership with enterprise application and network provider One Network Enterprises. Arrow CARES now is a Web-based system that accommodates eight languages-English, Korean, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, French, German, Spanish, Italian-and more than 170 currencies.     "This updated version of Arrow CARES is a powerful, global tool that will provide tremendous value to our original equipment and contract manufacturing customers, and electronics components businesses in all regions," said Bob Martin, director, Supply Chain, Arrow Electronics.     Arrow CARES enables customers and their suppliers to implement and effectively manage lean manufacturing procurement and inventory operations without costly technology investments.  Customers can get started using Arrow CARES immediately without software installation requirements or network compatibility issues. The latest version contains many new features, such as management of multiple facilities and inventory locations, the ability to fine-tune inventory replenishment decisions, and upgraded reporting capabilities.     "We are delighted to partner with One Network Enterprises to offer our customers a flexible, Web-based system that provides stringent data security using HTTPS 128-bit encryption with our customers' confidential information securely hosted by a third party," said Martin.     "CARES is an ideal combination of Arrow's unmatched commitment to customer success and One Network's powerful Multi-Enterprise Replenishment Network," said John Keenan, chief executive officer, One Network Enterprises.  "Our advanced application functionality, delivered across a global network, represents the next-generation of systems and will enable Arrow's customers to both rapidly and easily manage critical replenishment processes." Now in its eighth version, Arrow CARES has been benefiting manufacturing customers for more than a decade. It helps them to decrease inventory and associated costs, reduce inventory shortages, and improve productivity and order management by replacing manual data entry with a more streamlined, automated ordering process. For more information about Arrow CARES, including details on additional features, please access http://www.arrownac.com/arrowcares.        About Arrow Global Components     Arrow Global Components, a business unit of Arrow Electronics, Inc., is a worldwide provider of products (including semiconductors, passives, electromechanical devices and connectors), services and supply chain solutions to original equipment manufacturers and contract manufacturers of electronic components. Headquartered in Englewood, Colo., Arrow Global Components serves customers and suppliers across North and South America, Europe, the Middle East, Africa and Asia Pacific in multiple markets, including communications, industrial, transportation, healthcare, consumer electronics and lighting.        About One Network Enterprises     One Network Enterprises is a technology innovator and pioneer of the Business Process Network market. The company delivers a network-centric, process-driven solution, including a powerful software architecture for managing multi-enterprise operation processes; robust replenishment, supply and service applications; and leading-edge mobile/RFID solutions. The solution is delivered via an on-demand network to over 1,400 customers and manages over $100 billion a year in annual trade. One Network is based in Dallas, Texas and has offices in the United States and Europe. For more information, please call +1 972-385-8630 or visit http://www.onenetwork.com.          Media Contact:      Krista McNamara      Manager, Corporate Communications      Arrow Electronics, Inc.      631-847-5454      kmcnamara@arrow.com      SOURCE  Arrow Global Components       /CONTACT: Krista McNamara, Manager, Corporate Communications for Arrow Electronics, Inc., +1-631-847-5454, kmcnamara@arrow.com      /Web site: http://www.arrow.com      /Web site: http://www.onenetwork.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 08:00 ET (13:00 GMT)

Headline: National Grid:55th LNG Cargo Berths At Isle Of Grain Mon
Story: LONDON (Dow Jones)--U.K. natural gas grid operator National Grid PLC (NGG) Monday said the Al Deebel liquefied natural gas ship berthed at its Isle of Grain regassification terminal in Kent, England, on Monday.   The Al Deebel is capable of holding about 145,000 cubic meters of gas. Headline: SmartMoney(2/1) Touch-Tone Trouble
Story: (From SMARTMONEY)     By Anne Kadet   I've been spending time calling Southwest Airlines lately, just for the novelty of it all. You dial the 1-800 reservations number, and suddenly, you're having a conversation. There's no touch-tone labyrinth prompting you to decide between English or reservations or technical support, just a bunch of ladies who sound as if they happened to pick up the phone in the middle of baking cherry pie. And they cheerfully answer just about anything: What's for dinner? "Peanuts, maybe pretzels." When do prices rise? "Two weeks before the flight date." Can I bring my hamster? "No, but Delta, Continental and United allow pets -- would you like their numbers?"   Discount brokerage Scottrade also puts you straight through to an actual human. Unfortunately, Southwest and Scottrade are exceptions. More than 90 percent of large businesses rely on phone trees to field calls. As you might guess, this is supposed to save money. Every time you get a live rep on the phone, it costs roughly $5. In comparison, an automated call costs 50 cents. That's why corporate America spent $565 million in 2005 on new ways to trap you in touch-tone hell.   Problem is, their plan isn't working very well. Consumers hate these systems, and most of us will do anything to bypass the phone tree and get a live rep. Millions visit sites like GetHuman.com, which lists the secret codes for accessing an agent. (Hint: To reach an operator at Discover, press the star key four times.) This is a big problem for business. According to a Datamonitor survey of companies that use phone trees, more than 85 percent of callers manage to hunt down a live operator. And once that happens, they burn up the line grousing about the !*&@!! system. No cost savings there.   Southwest and Scottrade are clever. So far, they've resisted the phone-tree temptation in favor of a simple business model that reduces call-center demand. Take ever-profitable Southwest. It has coach-only seating, simple fares, a clear-cut rewards program and a Web site so straightforward your cat could book a flight. Sure, folks refer to the no-frills airline as The Flying Bus, but if you find Southwest confusing, you probably have more problems than a reservations agent can solve. As a result, calls to Southwest are typically shorter and easier to resolve than calls fielded by other airlines, says Rick Rappe of VocaLabs, a survey firm that monitors call centers. The simplicity also enables each of Southwest's 3,000 agents to efficiently field questions on any topic, says Ellen Torbert, Southwest's VP of reservations. Compare that with American Airlines, which segments its call-center force into endless divisions: There are more than 20 different numbers to call for everything from refunds to reservations to lost baggage.   You might call fast-growing Scottrade the Southwest of brokerages. It's cheap (trades cost $7) and straightforward. Other discount brokerages offer complicated products like mortgages and retirement plans. Scottrade offers trades, and when you're tired of that, more trades. What's more, customer calls are usually routed to a local Scottrade branch and answered by whoever's free to pick up -- typically a peppy fellow who sounds like the town's youngest stockbroker. Scottrade's cost per call isn't cheap; the company says it's above the $5 industry average. But by keeping things simple and decentralized, the company keeps call volume relatively low. Scottrade needs just 65 brokers at its call center -- one for every 23,000 accounts. (Fidelity, another brokerage with fine service and a branch system, employs one call-center broker for every 3,500 accounts -- and still uses a simple phone tree.)   Perhaps the success of Southwest and Scottrade will convince their phone-tree-hugging competitors to follow suit. Meanwhile, consumers will keep tracking down agents. My new favorite weapon: NoPhoneTrees.com, a site that does the impossible -- it navigates the phone tree for you and rings you when it gets an agent on the line. Now that's more like it!   ---   Senior writer Anne Kadet can be reached by e-mail at akadet@smartmoney.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 06:04 ET (11:04 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Argos Direct Powers Supply Chain with Manhattan Associates
Story: Leading Multi-channel Retailer Reaches Key Milestone in   Company-wide Rollout of Manhattan Associates Supply Chain Solution  LONDON & ATLANTA--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   Leading supply chain solutions provider, Manhattan Associates, Inc. (NASDAQ: MANH), today announced that Argos Direct, the delivery to home operation of Home Retail Group, has completed its implementation of Manhattan Associates' Warehouse Management solution at its 650,000 ft(2) Marsh Leys distribution centre in Buckinghamshire, which serves the whole of the south of England. Manhattan Associates' Warehouse Management for Open Systems is now running in two of Argos Direct's three distribution centres. The first full implementation took place in the company's purpose-built Faverdale distribution centre near Darlington, which serves northern England and Scotland. The company intends to implement Manhattan Associates' technology in its third warehouse, at Acton Gate, Staffordshire, in May 2007.     The implementation of the solution, complemented by radio frequency (RF) technology from Psion Teklogix, is already bringing benefits in terms of reduced clerical work, enhanced operational efficiency, improved order accuracy levels and higher levels of customer service. The smoothness of the implementation has been remarkable because the Manhattan Associates Warehouse Management solution replaced an existing legacy system, a transition process which can be disruptive if not managed effectively.     "We decided to avoid a 'big bang' approach," explained Pete Connor, IS director for Home Retail Group. "Instead we meticulously planned and sequentially executed a progressive handover to the new system, supported by Manhattan Associates' consultants. This deployment methodology along with a clearly defined approach to data migration enabled us to transition to the new application extremely smoothly. Because of this approach, we were able to hand the support function back to our operational team within two weeks of completing the implementation. No deliveries were affected during the process - we did not miss a beat. This is testimony to the great planning, execution and commitment of the team and sets a very high standard."     "We are very proud of the success we have achieved with Argos Direct at both Marsh Leys and Faverdale, and look forward to working closely with the Argos Direct team on their third implementation at Acton Gate next year," commented Allen Scott, UK managing director at Manhattan Associates. "Home Retail Group is one example amongst a rapidly expanding list of companies in the UK and around the world that are deploying Manhattan Associates supply chain solutions to support their multi-channel retail initiatives as they look to exploit the opportunities presented by a retail revolution that is gathering pace."       About Argos     Founded in 1973, Argos is a unique catalogue retailer recognised for choice, value and convenience. It sells general merchandise and products for the home from over 680 stores throughout the UK and Republic of Ireland, online and over the telephone. In the last financial year, Argos sales topped GBP 3.8 billion.     Argos serves over 130 million customers a year through its stores and takes four million customer orders either online or over the phone. On average, 17 million UK households, or around two thirds of the population, have an Argos catalogue at home at any time. Argos expects to add around 30 stores per annum with the chain expected to exceed 800 over time. Its Internet site is the second most visited Internet retail site in the UK. Argos is Retail Week's 2006 Online Retailer of the Year and winner of the Customer Service Initiative Award.       More information on Argos can be found on www.homeretailgroup.com.       About Manhattan Associates, Inc.     Manhattan Associates(R) is a leading supply chain solutions provider. The company's supply chain planning, supply chain execution, business intelligence and business process platform capabilities enable its more than 1200 customers worldwide to enhance profitability, performance and competitive advantage. For more information, please visit www.manh.com.        CONTACT: Fourth Day Public Relations               Xanthe Vaughan Williams               Nikki Scrivener, +44 0 20 7403 4411               xanthe@fourthday.co.uk               nikki@fourthday.co.uk               or               Manhattan Associates               John Bird, +44 0 1344 318071               EMEA Marketing Communications Manager               jbird@manh.com        SOURCE: Manhattan Associates, Inc.  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 08:31 ET (13:31 GMT)

Headline: Smiths Group To Sell Aerospace Unit To GE, Form JV -2-
Story: Edited Press Release   The new joint venture with General Electric will combine Smiths Detection with GE Homeland Protection to create a global business serving the fast-growing detection and homeland protection markets, the companies said.   Smiths GE Detection will offer a broad range of technologies to deliver integrated solutions to meet the rapidly evolving requirements of governments and other customers globally.   The board of the JV will be chaired by Keith Butler-Wheelhouse, the Chief Executive of Smiths, and will consist of four Smiths and two GE representatives. The JV brings together two management teams and will be led by Stephen Phipson, currently Group Managing Director of Smiths Detection, as its first President.   The parties view this as a long-term commitment, with no voluntary exit rights for the first five years.   It should be noted that the provisions of the Letter of Intent do not allow for GE to call Smiths interest in the JV at any time during the life of the JV, except in the event of a change of control of Smiths within 30 months of completion of the transaction. Following this 30 month period, a change of control event at Smiths will entitle GE to put its interest in the JV to Smiths.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 02:25 ET (07:25 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.
