Headline: : Union Pacific Boosts SPRB Coal Shipments to Nation's Utilities During 2006 - Setting New One Year Record
Story: The Nation's Largest Railroad Moves 15 Million Additional Tons of                           SPRB Coal in 2006  OMAHA, Neb.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   To help meet the nation's ongoing reliance on coal, Union Pacific moved 194 million tons of coal from Wyoming's Southern Powder River Basin (SPRB) during 2006 - a new record for the railroad.     Compared with 2005, Union Pacific moved an additional 895 trainloads of SPRB coal during the past year - an increase of 15 million tons of coal, or enough to generate a year's worth of electricity for nearly 2.5 million homes.     As train numbers increased during 2006, so did train size. UP trains transporting coal out of the SPRB averaged just over 15,000 tons each in the fourth quarter--an increase of 200 tons over last year's average. Investment in capacity improvements and new processes helped UP achieve the increased tonnage.     "Our employees are stepping up to the challenge to help meet our nation's crucial energy needs," said Jim Young, president and CEO. "Their ideas and dedication helped fuel the increases we experienced in 2006, and together we are continuing to develop new ways to handle rising demand."     Additional rail line improvements in Wyoming are expected to help boost capacity on the Joint Line owned by UP and BNSF. Future improvements - a fourth main line on Logan Hill and a third main line north of Reno Junction - coupled with the addition of 14 landing spots at the mines for trains, also are expected to increase Joint Line capacity.     According to data released late last year by the Energy Information Administration (EIA) of the U.S. Department of Energy, coal inventories at the nation's electric utilities were expected to end 2006 at their highest levels in four years. On Dec. 21, 2006, the EIA reported coal inventories at the nation's utilities stood at 125.6 million tons, up 27.9 percent over a year ago. In its Short-Term Energy Outlook released on Dec. 12, 2006, EIA said it expects inventory levels to rise again in 2007, reaching 138.9 million tons by the end of the year.     Also in December 2006, the North American Electric Reliability Council (NERC) reported that utilities have ample supplies of coal on hand for the winter season, and that NERC had removed the SPRB from its reliability watch list.       About Union Pacific     Union Pacific Corporation owns one of America's leading transportation companies. Its principal operating company, Union Pacific Railroad, is the largest railroad in North America, covering 23 states across the western two-thirds of the United States. A strong focus on quality and a strategically advantageous route structure enable the company to serve customers in critical and fast growing markets. It is a leading carrier of low-sulfur coal used in electrical power generation and has broad coverage of the large chemical-producing areas along the Gulf Coast. With competitive long-haul routes between all major West Coast ports and eastern gateways, and as the only railroad to serve all six major gateways to Mexico, Union Pacific has the premier rail franchise in North America.        CONTACT: Union Pacific Corporation               Gene Hinkle, 402-514-9406        SOURCE: Union Pacific Corporation  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 11:39 ET (16:39 GMT)

Input PPI                  !Consensus: +0.2% on month!            on mo +0.1%  +0.6%r !           +1.4% on year !            on yr +1.9%  +3.3%r !Actual:    +0.1% on month!                                !           +1.9% on year !  =========================================================     By Natasha Brereton   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--U.K. factory gate prices rose more than expected in December leading to a higher annual inflation rate, data from the Office of National Statistics showed Monday.   The output price index for home sales and manufactured products lifted 2.2% on the year in December, compared with a rise of 1.8% in November, the ONS said. Output PPI rose 0.2% on the month, following an unchanged reading in November.   Economists polled by Dow Jones Newswires last week had forecast the output PPI would increase 0.1% on the month and 2.2% on the year.   The ONS said the month-on-month increase mainly reflected rises in petroleum and food product prices, which gained 1.2% and 0.4% from November respectively.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 04:40 ET (09:40 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Avaya Appoints New Chief Information Officer
Story: BASKING RIDGE, N.J., Jan. 15 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Avaya (NYSE: AV) today announced the appointment of Lorie Buckingham as Avaya senior vice president and Chief Information Officer.  In her new role, Buckingham will lead overall information technology (IT) infrastructure and applications development and deployment across the organization to support Avaya's strategy and enhance productivity.     Buckingham joins Avaya from Visteon Corporation, where she served as Chief Information Officer and senior vice president of the Global Services Group.     "Lorie brings a wealth of talent and expertise to her new role at Avaya," said Mike Thurk, chief operating officer, Avaya.  "We are delighted to have the benefit of Lorie's deep experience in IT, global software solutions, e-commerce and business leadership. Her successful track record in helping a wide variety of enterprises derive maximum value from their technology investments make her an excellent fit for Avaya and our customers."     Before joining Visteon, Buckingham served as CIO at ZoneTrader.com and, previously, senior director of Enterprise Information Technology Solutions at Union Carbide Corporation.  Prior to that, she was director of Application Development at Continental Bank.     Buckingham earned a B.A. in chemistry and mathematics from the State University of New York.        About Avaya     Avaya Inc. designs, builds and manages communications networks for more than one million businesses worldwide, including over 90 percent of the FORTUNE 500(R). Focused on businesses large to small, Avaya is a world leader in secure and reliable Internet protocol (IP) telephony systems and communications software applications and services.     Driving the convergence of voice and data communications with business applications -- and distinguished by comprehensive worldwide services -- Avaya helps customers leverage existing and new networks to achieve superior business results.  For more information visit the Avaya website: www.avaya.com. Headline: Bush Declares Federal Disaster In Oklahoma
Story: OKLAHOMA CITY (AP)--President Bush declared a federal disaster in Oklahoma in the wake of an ice storm that has killed at least 15 people and knocked out power to more than 122,000 homes and businesses.   Residents in southeastern Oklahoma and other hard-hit areas of the state were without power for a third straight day Monday amid subfreezing temperatures, and authorities said it could be up to a week before power is fully restored.   "Very, very few people have electricity," said Undersheriff Richard Sexton of Pittsburg County, where almost 16,000 homes and businesses were without power in McAlester and surrounding areas late Sunday.   Sexton said the devastation following three days of freezing rain that coated tree limbs and power lines with thick coats of ice was reminiscent of a devastating ice storm in December 2000 that knocked out power to more than 170,000 electrical customers statewide.   "Tree limbs and power lines are snapping. We've run into situations where the roads have been blocked," Sexton said. "It's kind of caused people to go into panic. They're struggling to try to get heat, to get electricity to their houses."   He said the county jail is operating on emergency generator power and that many other public facilities are relying on generators to stay open. Emergency workers are finding shelters for elderly residents and others with medical conditions who are without power, Sexton said.   The Oklahoma Department of Emergency Management said utility crews worked throughout the night to restore power.   Late Sunday, President Bush approved Oklahoma's request for a federal emergency disaster declaration. Gov. Brad Henry requested federal aid after it became clear the state would need federal support to recover from the statewide storm.   The disaster declaration covers direct federal assistance as well as 75% reimbursement for emergency protective measures by local and state personnel.   Authorities said 12 people have died due to collisions on slick highways since the storm struck on Friday, and three others apparently died of hypothermia following prolonged exposure to bitterly cold temperatures.   Seven people were killed before dawn Sunday near Elk City when the minivan they were riding in hit a slick spot along Interstate 40, crossed the median and slammed into an oncoming tractor-trailer, the Oklahoma Highway Patrol reported.   A wind chill advisory is in effect for parts of Oklahoma through Monday. Forecasters said gusty winds will drop wind chill indices to the teens and single digits.   Statewide, 122,338 electric customers were without power Sunday night, mostly in eastern sections of the state, OEM said.   Public Service Company, which provides power to 514,000 customers in eastern and southwestern Oklahoma, said 44,801 customers were without power. Oklahoma Gas and Electric Co. reported 19,000 customers without power, including about 10,000 in Muskogee in eastern Oklahoma.   The Oklahoma Association of Electric Cooperatives said 58,550 coop customers were without power as up to four inches of freezing rain and brisk winds in eastern Oklahoma took a heavy toll on power lines and utility poles.   Electric coops said the storm had destroyed more than 700 utility poles statewide.   The storm caused flight delays and cancellations at airports in Oklahoma City and Tulsa. Amtrak canceled passenger rail service Sunday between Oklahoma City and Fort Worth, Texas, because of a Burlington Northern-Santa Fe (BNI) freight train that blocked the tracks.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 02:07 ET (07:07 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Digital Dispatch Strengthens Sales With Existing Customers>DD.T
Story: RICHMOND, BRITISH COLUMBIA--(CCNMatthews - Jan. 15, 2007) - Digital Dispatch (TSX:DD), a leading global provider of mobile data solutions, is pleased to announce additional sales for mobile data terminals, computers and related services of approximately $1.6 Million to the Company's existing customers, MinuteMen of New York and a customer located in Australia. A portion of these sales were delivered in 2006.    MinuteMen, which was Digital Dispatch's first New York customer, has chosen to install Digital Dispatch's iPilot 8000(TM), complete with mapping and Digital Dispatch's SmartPrint mobile printer. It is installing the system as an upgrade to its current system which includes KST 260(TM) mobile data terminals. MinuteMen bought 300 units to accommodate its large fleet of black cars.    "We chose to upgrade our Digital Dispatch equipment to take advantage of the advanced technology," stated Tom Cappiello, President for MinuteMen. "The touchscreen mobile data computer with mapping solution will enhance our operation's efficiency by providing real-time location information. This will ensure effective dispatching with a faster response time to calls; greatly improving customer satisfaction."    Digital Dispatch's Australian customer has ordered several products, including the iPilot 8000(TM) and a variety of miscellaneous items, as an add-on order to their current system that was purchased in September 2006. The Company, which is growing daily, purchased the equipment in response to the rapid expansion of its existing fleet.    "We are very happy that Digital Dispatch is able to provide a technologically-advanced solution for our customers," commented Cliff Snelling, Vice President of Marketing. "Digital Dispatch is especially pleased to see that our products are aiding the development and growth of the Company's current customers. We look forward to helping them achieve their business goals for years to come."    The two orders not only fortify sales for Digital Dispatch, but further validate the Company's position in both the North American and Australian taxi markets.    About MinuteMen    MinuteMen is one of the oldest Black Car companies in New York. It was established in 1974 and bought by its drivers in 1986 when it joined a family of other well established and successful business-oriented co-operatives. Visit www.minutemenlimo.com for more information.    About Digital Dispatch Systems Inc.    Digital Dispatch Systems Inc. is a worldwide provider of mobile data solutions for fleet and mobile workforce management. Founded in 1987, we have an installed base of 70,000 wireless mobile data devices and nearly 200 wireless data systems on four continents. We offer products and services to manage vehicle fleets and mobile workforces, including dispatch software, wireless communication infrastructure and a range of in-vehicle mobile devices. Visit www.digital-dispatch.com for more information.                     FOR FURTHER INFORMATION PLEASE CONTACT:             Digital Dispatch Systems Inc.           George Reznik           CFO           (604) 241-1441           Email: investors@digital-dispatch.com           Website: www.digital-dispatch.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 08:03 ET (13:03 GMT)

Headline: India TCS 3Q Net INR11.05 Bln, +47.3% On Year -2-
Story: The company had announced an interim dividend of INR3 a share in the same period a year earlier as well.   "TCS has become the first Indian IT company to clock $1 billion in revenues in a single quarter and has crossed the $3 billion mark in the first three quarters alone," S. Ramadorai, chief executive and managing director at TCS, said in a statement.   The higher profits are the result of more orders at higher billing rates, the company said.   In the third quarter, the company said it signed new deals at rates 5%-10% higher than its average of $23 per hour per person.   The company also renewed existing deals at 3% to 5% higher than the average rates in the third quarter.   The company's quarterly operating income rose to INR12.67 billion from INR9.03 billion in the year-earlier period, with operating profit margins coming in at 26.07%, a 3% increase from the preceding quarter.   Chief Financial Officer S. Mahalingam said that the company has managed to improve quarterly margins by controlling costs, despite a rising Indian rupee. He didn't specify the year-earlier margins.   "TCS...has closed five deals of over $50 million in quarter three," N. Chandrasekaran, global head of sales and operations, said.   In the quarter just ended, the company won a five-year order from an unnamed bank worth $140 million and another $140 million five-year order from a bank in China, TCS said without elaborating.   The company said that it has 10 deals in the pipeline, each worth $50 million to $100 million.   The company hired 7,835 staff during the fiscal third quarter, taking its employee base to 83,500 as of the end of December. Net staff additions for the quarter was at 5,562.   -By Romit Guha and Raghavendra Upadhyaya, Dow Jones Newswires; 91-9900181471; romit.guha@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 09:24 ET (14:24 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : American Bonanza Increases Interest In Northway To 100%>BZA.T
Story: VANCOUVER, BRITISH COLUMBIA -- (MARKET WIRE) -- 01/15/07 --    American Bonanza Gold Corp. (TSX: BZA)(FWB: AB2) ("Bonanza") is pleased to announce that it has acquired a further 25% interest in the Northway Project, increasing its interest from 75% to 100%. The current acquisition of the final 25% interest in the Northway project is a result of Bonanza's strategy to acquire advanced stage gold properties in mining friendly areas of Canada and the western United States. Bonanza continues to drill its portfolio of high grade gold properties. The current acquisition complements Bonanza's gold assets and increases the Corporation's total gold resources by over 215,000 ounces. These ounces are historical in nature and are not National Instrument 43-101 compliant.   The Northway property is located in Quebec, 25 kilometers south of Matagami and covers 3,600 hectares. The Northway property lies one kilometer along strike to the east of Agnico Eagle's Vezza deposit and may be a continuation of the same gold zone. As previously reported by Agnico-Eagle Mines Ltd., the Vezza deposit is estimated to contain a historical resource of 2.76 million tons grading 0.136 ounces of gold per ton (375,000 contained ounces of gold).   On the basis of the current acquisition Bonanza controls 100% of the Northway property, which contains a historic resource of 18.2 million tonnes grading 1.48 grams per tonne gold, containing 866,000 ounces of gold. Within this resource, significant higher grade zones are present. The resource remains open to expansion along strike and down dip in several areas.   Bonanza plans an estimated 5,000 meters of Phase I drilling in 25 drill holes along the Northway gold zone planned to commence in first half of this year. The Phase I drilling program will focus on resource expansion and confirmation of the high grade zones. Following completion of Phase I drilling, a Phase II drilling program will support development of a National Instrument 43-101 compliant resource estimate.   Brian Kirwin, Chief Executive Officer stated, "This acquisition and resulting addition to the Bonanza's total gold resources is a further step in accomplishing the Corporation's Mission of becoming a high grade gold producer based in stable areas of Canada and the United States."   The following is an updated summary of gold resources controlled by the Company which reflects the additional historical ounces acquired at Northway.  Table 1. Please refer to our website at www.americanbonanza.com or to Bonanza's filings on www.sedar.com.   The qualified person who is responsible for the preparation of the technical information in this press release is Robert Hawkins, a Qualified Person as defined in Canadian National Instrument 43-101. Headline: : Isotechnika's Partner, Lux Biosciences, Receives Orphan Drug Designation For Ophthalmic Indications Of ISA247>ISA.T
Story: EDMONTON, Jan. 15 /CNW/ - Isotechnika Inc. (TSX:ISA) announced today that its partner, Lux Biosciences, has been granted orphan drug designation from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for ISA247, referred to as LX211 by Lux, for the treatment of non-infectious posterior, intermediate and panuveitis.    Orphan drug designation is a special status for diseases or conditions affecting fewer than 200,000 patients in the United States, granted by the FDA upon request by a sponsor. Orphan drug designation qualifies the sponsor for exclusive marketing rights in the United States for seven years if the Company is first to receive marketing approval. The designation also positions Lux Biosciences to benefit from certain tax credits and waives the company's obligation to pay FDA application user fees for these products as required by the Prescription Drug User Fee Act (PDUFA).    "We are pleased to receive Orphan Drug designation from the FDA for LX211 (ISA247), a late-stage product in our pipeline," said Ulrich Grau, President and CEO of Lux Biosciences. "LX211 has the potential of establishing new treatment paradigms in these an indication of high medical need. The only drugs currently approved in uveitis are steroids."    Dr. Randall Yatscoff, Isotechnika's President & CEO stated, "The receipt of Orphan Drug designation for non-infectious uveitis may facilitate the introduction of ISA247 (LX211) for treatment of these serious disorders."    About Uveitis    =------------    Uveitis is an autoimmune disease characterized by chronic inflammation of the eye. There is substantial evidence implicating T-lymphocytes, key cells involved in inflammatory processes, in the development of the disease. Uveitis is an under-diagnosed and under-recognized medical condition that causes vision impairment, ocular pain, and loss of vision. Experts estimate that 10% of new U.S. cases of blindness result from this disease. Approximately 300,000 people suffer from uveitis in the United States alone, the majority of whom are affected by anterior uveitis. The only therapeutic class approved by the FDA for treatment of uveitis is corticosteroids, which are burdened with multiple side effects, such as hypertension, hyperglycemia, hypercholesterolemia, and in the eye, cataract formation and glaucoma.    About Isotechnika Inc.    =---------------------    Isotechnika Inc. is an international biopharmaceutical company headquartered in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. Drawing upon its expertise in medicinal chemistry and immunology, the Company is focused on the discovery and development of novel immunosuppressive therapeutics that are safer than currently available treatments. Its entrepreneurial management and world-class team of scientists are building a pipeline of immunosuppressive drug candidates for treatment of autoimmune diseases and for use in the prevention of organ rejection in transplantation. Isotechnika looks to become the leader in development of immunosuppressant therapies.    Isotechnika's lead compound, ISA247 has successfully completed a Phase III Canadian trial for the treatment of moderate to severe psoriasis. ISA247 is currently being investigated in a combined Phase III European/Canadian psoriasis trial and a Phase IIb North American trial for the prevention of kidney graft rejection. The Company also has an additional immunosuppressive compound in its drug pipeline, TAFA93 which successfully completed Phase I clinical trials.    Isotechnika Inc. is a publicly traded company on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol ISA. More information on Isotechnika can be found at www.isotechnika.com.    Partnerships with Isotechnika Inc.    =---------------------------------    Isotechnika Inc. signed a collaboration agreement with Hoffman La Roche on April 9, 2002, which licensed the worldwide rights to develop and commercialize ISA247 for all transplant indications.    On September 30, 2005, Isotechnika Inc. entered into an exclusive worldwide licensing agreement with Atrium Medical Corporation for the use of ISA247 and TAFA93 specifically with drug eluting devices for the non-systemic treatment of vascular, cardiovascular, target vessel and tissue disorders.    Isotechnika Inc. and Cellgate Inc. signed an option agreement on April 25, 2006, granting Isotechnika the option to obtain an exclusive license to develop and commercialize conjugates consisting of Cellgate's patented transporter technology for the topical delivery of ISA247 in patients suffering from mild to moderate psoriasis.    On May 25, 2006, Isotechnika Inc. signed an agreement with Lux Biosciences, Inc. of Jersey City, New Jersey granting Lux Biosciences worldwide rights to develop and commercialize Isotechnika's lead drug, ISA247 for the treatment and prophylaxis of all ophthalmic diseases.    Forward-Looking Statements    =-------------------------    This press release may contain forward-looking statements. Forward looking statements, including the Company's belief as to the potential of its products, the Company's expectations regarding the issuance of additional patents and the Company's ability to protect its intellectual property, involve known and unknown risks and uncertainties, which could cause the Company's actual results to differ materially from those in the forward looking statements. Such risks and uncertainties include, among others, the availability of funds and resources to pursue research and development projects, the ability to economically manufacture its products, the potential of its products, the success and timely completion of clinical studies and trials, the Company's ability to successfully commercialize its products, the ability of the Company to defend its patents from infringement by third parties, and the risk that the Company's patents may be subsequently shown to be invalid or infringe the patents of others. Investors should consult the Company's quarterly and annual filings with the Canadian commissions for additional information on risks and uncertainties relating to the forward- looking statements. Investors are cautioned against placing undue reliance on forward-looking statements.    %SEDAR: 00010508E         /CONTACT: Dr. Randall Yatscoff, President & CEO, Isotechnika Inc., (780) 909-5042, (780) 484-4105, ryatscoff@isotechnika.com; Stephanie Gillis-Paulgaard, Director, Corporate Communications, Isotechnika Inc., (780) 909-4661, (780) 484-4105 (fax), sgillis-paulgaard@isotechnika.com; Lux Biosciences, Inc. Contact Information: Ulrich Grau, Ph.D., (201) 946-0221, ulrich.grau@luxbio.com; Kureczka/Martin Associates (media), Joan Kureczka, (415) 821-2413 jkureczka@comcast.net     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 08:40 ET (13:40 GMT)

Headline: SmartMoney(2/1) Street Smart: Face-Off: Southwest Airlines
Story: (From SMARTMONEY)     By Russell Pearlman   Can Southwest's Stock Soar?     YES: "We believe Southwest can achieve its aggressive growth targets. The company has a great reputation, strong history and big demand for its services."   -- Ray Neidl, airline analyst, Calyon Securities     YES: Southwest did a great job of hedging fuel prices several years ago, which kept its fuel costs down even as oil prices went up. Those high energy prices have kept rivals at bay, while Southwest's earnings have grown.     YES: Southwest is the only airline that has made money every quarter since Sept. 11. It has a strong balance sheet in an industry where bankruptcies are common. And the firm just announced a $400 million stock buyback plan.     YES: The airline has 283 planes on order, so it can fly more often to cities it already serves profitably. It plans to increase its service to Philadelphia by 40 percent, which gives it further reach into the profitable East Coast market. Canada and Mexico are potential new forays as well. The airline can grow profits 15 percent a year for several years.     YES: Southwest's culture of low cost and friendly service is unmatched in the industry. Other airlines can sometimes match Southwest on price, but its service wins the customer's loyalty.   ---   NO: "This has been one of the best environments Southwest could possibly see -- full of planes and falling energy prices -- and yet it is losing pricing power."   -- Tom Stringfellow, chief investment officer, Frost Bank     NO: Southwest's hedging strategy has been great, but now it's being punished for its smart behavior. Those hedging contracts are expiring, and Southwest's fuel costs will go up. Meanwhile, all other carriers are seeing their unhedged fuel prices fall. That will have an impact on earnings and make this year's profits look bad compared with last year's.     NO: Sept. 11 issues aside, this is an industry not exactly known for rational behavior. An overly aggressive airline, say, a US Air-Delta combination, can go into any of Southwest's markets and initiate a profit-killing price war that lasts for months.     NO: Southwest has thrived as a smaller airline, but now it's the Big Kahuna. That brings about a whole set of issues. It can't just move into one new market and have its profits skyrocket. There's a lot of headwind keeping it from growing profits 15 percent a year.     NO: I love flying it, but Southwest is a mature company in a tough industry. And the stock is not cheap enough to justify those questionable growth prospects.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 06:01 ET (11:01 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Arris To Acquire Tandberg Television In $1.21B Deal
Story: Edited Press Release     STOCKHOLM (Dow Jones)--U.S. technology company Arris Group Inc. (ARRS) and Norwegian Tandberg Television ASA (TAT.OS) Monday said they have reached an agreement to combine the two companies through an acquisition of all outstanding Tandberg shares by Arris.   The companies said the aggregate purchase is expected to be $1.21 billion at current exchange rates, and that the transaction is expected to be completed in the second quarter 2007.   The companies said the offer price of NOK96 consists of NOK80 cash and NOK16 shares in Arris, although Arris can increase the cash portion of the offer at its discretion.   "The combination of Arris and Tandberg Television is positive for the digital media industry and a truly exceptional opportunity for both companies. By bringing together these two market leaders we are able to expand on our vision to be the global leader in the provision of digital IP infrastructure and to enable voice, video and data to be delivered over integrated broadband networks from the content provider to the head-end to the home," said Bob Stanzione, chairman and chief executive of Arris.   "With this merger we are creating a new force, with best in class technologies and an outstanding team of people with a unique understanding of all service provider networks, the technologies that enable them and the content that travels through them," he said.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 03:30 ET (08:30 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: W Europe Dec New Car Registrations Flat On Yr - VDA
Story: FRANKFURT (Dow Jones)--German auto industry association VDA said Monday new car registrations in Western Europe were flat on the year in December. VDA didn't provide an absolute figure for new car registrations last month.   However, helped by gains in Germany and Italy, new registrations were up "nearly 1%" on the year in full-year 2006 at 14.6 million passenger cars, VDA said in a statement.   The European Automobile Manufacturers Association, known as ACEA, is due to release detailed figures on European new car registrations Tuesday.     Association Web site: http://www.vda.de     -By Frankfurt Bureau; Dow Jones Newswires; +49 69 29 725 500; djnews.frankfurt@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 12:37 ET (17:37 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: INTERVIEW: DSV CEO Sees Further Possible Buys In Late 07
Story: By Malin Rising   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   COPENHAGEN (Dow Jones)--The chief executive of Danish logistics firm DSV A/S (DSV.KO), Kurt Larsen, Monday said it would be possible for the company to make further acquisitions in late 2007.   In an interview with Dow Jones Newswires, Larsen said DSV would have the cash flow and debt capacity to make further acquisitions in late 2007, assuming that things go well with its integration of Dutch firm Frans Maas and that the market is stable.   DSV's track record for integrating acquired companies and making them profitable has made it a hot stock for investors looking to capitalize on the consolidation in the transportation industry.   Last week, the company was listed the fourth most attractive investment in Europe by ratings agency Standard & Poor's, which pointed to both strong internal growth and merger benefits as a reason to buy the stock.   Larsen said DSV is taking part in the global consolidation among transport companies, and will look at whatever comes up, whether it is a small or large takeover.   He said the company's road division already covers all of Europe, but that it could be better in Germany and in France. And DSV has previously said that, in terms of air and sea logistics, it wants its operations to cover the U.S. and European markets, as well as large parts of Asia, within the next few years.   In January 2006, the company bought Dutch rival Frans Maas for 3.15 billion Danish kroner ($547.3 million). The company has estimated annual synergies from the acquisition at DKK450 million, starting in 2008, but many analysts expect the synergies to be even higher.   Larsen said he still feels comfortable with this guidance and that a realistic target for DSV's operating margin in Germany would be 2% in the short term.   While having been an aggressive buyer, some analysts have also argued that DSV is a potential takeover target itself, as the fragmented logistics industry continues to consolidate.   However, Larsen refrained from commenting on whether DSV has received any takeover approaches from other logistics companies.   Company Web site: http://www.dsv.com   -By Malin Rising, Dow Jones Newswires; +45 33 111 524; malin.rising@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 06:38 ET (11:38 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Northstar Aero Rtg Upped On Rev Growth Seen In '07: Versant
Story: TORONTO (Dow Jones)--Versant Partners increased Northstar Aeropsace Inc. (NAS.T) to buy from hold and boosted its price target to C$5.95 from C$5.35 on anticipated revenue and margin growth in 2007.   Northstar is trading at C$4.99 in Toronto, up 2.9%.   In a research report Monday, analyst Cameron Doerksen said he believes better results will drive positive momentum for the stock.   He anticipates stronger 2007 revenue and higher margins based on the company's growing backlog, which increased to C$230 million in the third quarter of 2006 from C$142 million at the end of 2004. He sees the CH-47 helicopter program as the key driver of revenue growth and margin expansion in 2007 as new manufacturing capacity added in mid-to-late 2006 fully comes on line and as deliveries for both new-build and aftermarket parts ramp up. Order flow for the CH-47 program will also continue very strong.   He cited growing revenue from Rolls Royce Group plc (RR.LN) resulting from a new deal to supply various components that will be worth C$8 million a year starting in 2008. He also noted Northstar will be the supplier of a new transmission used on the U.S. Army's fleet of Apache attack helicopters.   He also said the recent weakening of the Canadian dollar is positive for Northstar, which generates almost all of its sales in U.S. dollars.   Versant doesn't have an investment-banking relationship with Northstar and Doerksen doesn't own shares of the company.   Northstar, Chicago, is a manufacturer of gears, transmissions and rotor hubs primarily for use on helicopters.   Company Web site: http://www.nsaero.com     -Tara Zachariah, Dow Jones Newswires; 416-306-2100     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 13:31 ET (18:31 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: French Court Approves Eurotunnel's Safeguard Plan -3-
Story: After the accounts are published, Eurotunnel's shares, which have been suspended since May 2006, will begin trading again.   The court gave Eurotunnel 37 months to implement its plan fully. After the publication of its results, Eurotunnel plans to then issue a prospectus for an exchange offer into shares of its new company, Groupe Eurotunnel SA, and the offer is expected to be launched in early March. The offer is expected to remain open for three to four weeks, until the end of March.   The new Groupe Eurotunnel is then expected to start trading in France and the U.K.   Through this process, existing shareholders could see their holdings diluted by 87%. As part of its restructuring, Eurotunnel will issue a GBP1.275 billion convertible bond given to creditors in exchange for their debt claims, and convertible into new shares.   Eurotunnel is still considering using the proceeds of a possible rights issue post-restructuring to limit dilution to 50% during the next three years, but Gounon said it would depend on the performance of the company post-restructuring whether they would raise new capital for this purpose.   Eurotunnel needs to get at least 60% of its shareholders tendering their shares for the restructuring to be successful.   In a press conference following the court's decision, Gounon appealed to shareholders to support the plan. "The court has made its decision, the Safeguard plan has been validated, it is the best solution for Eurotunnel," he said, reminding shareholders, some of whom spoke out during the public session, that they would lose everything if the company went bankrupt.   Gounon said that any opposition or delay to the implementation of the plan would cost the company dearly and that shareholders contesting the plan were only shooting themselves in the foot.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 06:10 ET (11:10 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Marubeni Targets US Mkt By Buying Paper Distributor-Nikkei
Story: TOKYO (Nikkei)--Marubeni Corp. (8002.TO) has acquired the parent of the largest distributor of lightweight coated paper in the U.S. in a deal estimated at roughly 8 billion yen, The Nikkei reported in its Tuesday edition.   The trading company has bought all the shares of Integrated Resources Holdings Inc., which owns A.T. Clayton & Co., a distributor of lightweight coated paper used in magazines and other printed materials.   The move, the first acquisition of a U.S. paper distributor by a Japanese firm, is aimed at establishing a distribution network in the U.S.   With papermakers planning to expand production in Japan, domestic capacity for manufacturing lightweight coated paper is expected to rise from 3 million tons currently to 4 million tons by the end of 2008.   Marubeni's pulp division is the largest among trading houses, boasting 510 billion yen in annual sales. By gaining a foothold in the U.S., Marubeni aims to secure its dominance in the sector ahead of an expected paper glut, a factor that prompted Oji Paper Co.'s (3861.TO) unsuccessful takeover attempt of rival Hokuetsu Paper Mills Ltd. (3865.TO) last year.   A.T. Clayton lists major retailers and printing companies among its clients. The firm handles 550,000 tons annually and holds a 7% share of the U.S. market. It is also involved in consulting services in the printing industry, including strategies to cut costs and reduce lead times.   Marubeni plans to double A.T. Clayton's business in five years to approximately 1 million tons, procuring 300,000 tons from Japanese suppliers.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 11:16 ET (16:16 GMT)

Headline: : Vermilion Energy Trust Announces C$0.17 Cash Distribution For February 15, 2007 Payment Date
Story: CALGARY, Jan. 15 /CNW/ - Vermilion Energy Trust (VET.UN-TSX) is pleased to announce the cash distribution of $0.17 per trust unit payable on February 15, 2007 to all unitholders of record on January 31, 2007. The ex-distribution date for this payment is January 29, 2007. This will be the Trust's 48th consecutive distribution payment of $0.17 since Vermilion was formed as a Trust in January 2003.    Exchangeable Share Ratio Information     -----------------------------------    Upon conversion to a Trust in January 2003, some holders of shares in the predecessor company, Vermilion Resources Ltd., opted to hold exchangeable shares in place of Vermilion Energy Trust units. The following information applies only to those exchangeable shareholders and does not affect Vermilion Energy Trust unitholders.    The increase to the Exchange Ratio of the Exchangeable Shares of Vermilion Resources Ltd. will be from 1.46741 to 1.47523. The increase will be effective on January 15, 2007. A "Notice of Retraction" must be received by Computershare by January 22, 2007 to receive this exchange ratio. All notices received after this date will receive the exchange ratio to be determined on February 15, 2007.    The following are the details used in the calculation of the Exchange ratio:          <<      Record Date of Vermilion Energy Trust Distribution     December 29, 2006      Opening Exchange Ratio                                 1.46741        Vermilion Energy Trust Distribution per Unit           $0.17        10-day Weighted Average Trading Price       ("Current Market Price")                              $31.90621      (Including the Last Business Day Prior to the        Distribution Payment Date)        Increase in the Exchange Ratio                         0.00782      Effective Date of the Increase in the Exchange Ratio   January 15, 2007      Exchange Ratio as of the Effective Date                1.47523      >>      The increase in the exchange ratio is calculated by multiplying the Vermilion Energy Trust Distribution per Unit by the previous month's exchange ratio and dividing by the Current Market Price of VET.UN. A holder of Vermilion Resources Ltd. Exchangeable Shares can exchange all or a portion of their holdings at any time for Vermilion Trust Units by completing a Retraction Request form. You can obtain a copy by contacting Computershare Trust Company of Canada at (403) 267-6894.    %SEDAR: 00018945E         /CONTACT: Paul Beique, Director Investor Relations, 2800, 400 - 4th Avenue S.W., Calgary, Alberta, T2P 0J4, Phone: (403) 269-4884, Fax: (403) 264-6306, IR Toll Free: 1-866-895-8101, www.vermilionenergy.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 14:28 ET (19:28 GMT)

Headline: INSINGER DE BEAUFORT: Gilts Signal Inflation Concerns
Story: By Stephen Lewis   Of Insinger de Beaufort     LONDON (Dow Jones)--Since our last review of UK capital market yields, on 4 July last year (No 2541), economic sentiment has strengthened.  Worries that soaring oil prices would derail global economic growth have faded as energy costs have subsided.  Though the US economy has slowed down, largely as a result of weakness in the housing market, the risks of a US recession now appear remote.  Six months ago, fears of inflation for the most part reflected anxieties about rising raw materials prices.  Currently, inflation concerns are broadening as pay settlements in the UK, the USA and the euro zone are threatening to exceed rates acceptable to the respective central banks.  The capital markets have reflected these shifts in economic expectations in a rational way, as our table below shows.       UK YIELD HISTORIES   End-period %   I-L 2035   T 4.25 32   Diff   FTSE   Diff   2004  March      1.64      4.63       2.99   3.13   1.49         June       1.76      4.83       3.07   3.16   1.40         September  1.64      4.57       2.93   3.16   1.52         December   1.46      4.43       2.97   3.00   1.54   2005  March      1.68      4.70       3.02   3.13   1.45         June       1.43      4.24       2.81   3.10   1.67         September  1.28      4.25       2.97   2.98   1.70         December   1.00      4.00       3.00   2.96   1.96   2006  March      1.04      4.14       3.10   2.89   1.85         June       1.25      4.39       3.14   3.11   1.86         September  1.02      4.16       3.14   3.12   2.10   2007  Current    1.12      4.40       3.28   2.86   1.74   Source: ONS and Insinger de Beaufort     In the table, we take representative yields for long-dated index-linked and fixed coupon gilts and for the FTSE All-Share index and compare how they have performed over the past three years.  The third column of figures tracks the yield-differential between the index-linked and fixed coupon gilt, while the final column shows the yield spread between the index-linked and the All-Share.   The index-linked yield is a proxy for the risk-free real yield demanded by investors.  With global economic growth sustained amidst ample liquidity, it is not surprising that the trend in this yield has been downwards since the beginning of 2004, as investors have competed aggressively to take advantage of investment opportunities.  There was a minor spike in the middle of last year, reflecting temporary anxieties over growth and the supply of liquidity, but these worries soon passed.  By contrast, the fixed coupon yield is now marginally above its level at the end of June last year.  In 2006Q3, the fall in the fixed coupon yield matched that in the index-linked but, in 2006Q4, the fixed coupon yield began to rise independently of the index-linked.  This divergence has resulted in a rise in the differential to a level well above the range that prevailed in 2004-05.  Whereas institutional factors relating to asset/liability matching have probably been favouring index-linked investment, as we pointed out last July, it seems even less plausible than it did then that the whole rise in the fixed coupon/index-linked yield-gap is to be attributed to this factor.  It does seem that the widening spread reflects investors' demand that increased compensation for future inflation be incorporated in the fixed coupon yield. A part of the differential reflects a premium to counter-balance the risk that a fixed coupon gilt will not give the expected real return.  But the gap is now so wide, it no longer seems consistent with a belief on investors' part that the Bank of England will, over the long run, keep inflation down in line with its target.  Even though RPI inflation, on which the inflation indexing of gilts is based, generally runs about 0.5 of a percentage point higher than inflation on the CPI target-measure, the fixed coupon/index-linked yield differential is now too wide to allow any interpretation other than a decline of confidence in the Bank of England's ability to deliver inflation on target.   The equity market was slow to respond to the fall in real yields, as signalled by index-linked gilts, in 2006Q3.  The equity/index-linked differential, which was already above the 2004-05 average in the middle of last year, rose further to exceed 2%.  Institutional factors were probably acting more powerfully on this spread than on the fixed coupon/index-linked gap. Subsequently, the equity yield has caught up with the fall in the index-linked yield.  This suggests these factors are less significant than they were, as long-term investing institutions complete their fund reallocations.     -By Stephen Lewis: (+44) 20 7190 7193; sjlewis@insinger.com   (Stephen Lewis is chief economist at Insinger de Beaufort Ltd., London, independent brokers specializing in institutional business.)   Opinions expressed are those of the author, and not of Dow Jones Newswires.   This column is published for information only, and it neither constitutes, nor is to be construed as, an offer to buy or sell investments. The information and opinions expressed herein are based on sources the author believes to be reliable, but he cannot represent that they are accurate or complete. Any information herein is given in good faith, but is subject to change without notice. No liability is accepted whatsoever by Insinger de Beaufort Ltd., employees and associated companies for any direct or consequential loss arising from this article.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 09:18 ET (14:18 GMT)

Headline: Airbus Gets Order For 20 A330 Freighters -2-
Story: The value of the contract wasn't disclosed, but on the basis of a catalog price of $165.2 million a plane, the Intrepid order is potentially worth $3.3 billion to Airbus, a wholly-owned unit of European Aeronautic Defence and Space Co NV (5730.FR).   However, Airbus traditionally offers cash discounts or has extras included such as training to airlines that make bulk orders.   The A330-200F is the newest addition to the Airbus fleet. And Airbus is likely to have offered generous terms to Intrepid as a launch customer for the aircraft.   New York-based Reservoir Capital Group (REO.P.V) is the primary shareholder in Intrepid Aviation.     -By David Pearson, Dow Jones Newswires; +331 4017 1740, david.pearson@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 12:24 ET (17:24 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : UAP Expands in Kansas and Nebraska Through Acquisition of Boettcher Enterprises' Retail Distribution Business
Story: GREELEY, Colo., Jan. 15 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- UAP Holding Corp. (Nasdaq: UAPH) announced that its subsidiary, UAP Distribution, Inc., has entered into a definitive agreement with Boettcher Enterprises to acquire certain assets of its retail distribution business including real property, retail locations, equipment and storage tanks.  This agreement is subject to customary closing conditions.        (Logo:  http://www.newscom.com/cgi-bin/prnh/20060420/UAPLOGO)     Boettcher Enterprises is a leading retailer of agricultural inputs with multiple locations in Kansas and Nebraska.  In this two state region, the acquisition of this business should further UAP's strategy to expand retail market share.  Boettcher has had a long standing wholesale relationship with UAP and has been one of our largest wholesale customers in this geography. The acquisition is expected to close in this fourth fiscal quarter.     "The acquisition of Boettcher Enterprises' distribution business greatly enhances UAP's presence in this key mid-western market," said Kenny Cordell, UAP Holding Corp.'s chairman, president, and CEO.  "The expansion of our retail distribution through a quality organization such as Boettcher Enterprises is truly a great opportunity."        About UAP Holding Corp.     UAP Holding Corp. is the holding company of United Agri Products, Inc., the largest independent distributor of agricultural and non-crop inputs in the United States and Canada.  United Agri Products, Inc. markets a comprehensive line of products, including crop protection chemicals, seeds and fertilizers, to growers and regional dealers.  United Agri Products also provides a broad array of value-added services, including crop management, biotechnology advisory services, custom blending, inventory management and custom applications of crop inputs.  United Agri Products maintains a comprehensive network of approximately 340 distribution and storage facilities and three formulation and blending plants, strategically located throughout the United States and Canada.  Additional information can be found on the company's website, located at www.uap.com.     Safe Harbor Statement under the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995     This press release may contain statements that are forward-looking, as that term is defined by the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 or by the Securities and Exchange Commission in its rules, regulations and releases. These forward- looking statements are based on management's beliefs, as well as assumptions made by, and information currently available to, management.  When used in this release, the words "believe," "anticipate," "estimate," "expect," "intend" and similar expressions are intended to identify forward-looking statements.  Although management believes that the expectations reflected in these forward-looking statements are reasonable, it can give no assurance that these expectations will prove to have been correct. Headline: Huber + Suhner '06 Sales Up 15% To CHF654M >HUBN.EB
Story: ZURICH (Dow Jones)--Swiss electrical component maker Huber + Suhner AG (HUBN.EB) said Monday 2006 sales rose about 15% to 654 million Swiss francs ($525 million) compared with CHF567 million in 2005, driven by strength in both its business units, and confirmed its forecast for record results in '06.   Order intake was up 19% to CHF688 million from CHF577 million in 2005.   The company is scheduled to give an earnings update in March.   Company Web Site: http://www.hubersuhner.com     -By Hans Schoemaker, Dow Jones Newswires; +41-43-4438045; hans.schoemaker@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 01:20 ET (06:20 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Emergency Crews Respond to Fire in Richmond, California
Story: RICHMOND, Calif., Jan. 15 /PRNewswire/ -- Chevron Richmond Refinery emergency response personnel are responding to a fire which occurred at approximately 5:15 a.m. PT today.     Chevron has contacted the appropriate local emergency response organizations, including the Refinery's own fire department, which has responded to the incident.     One minor injury has been reported at this time, and there have been no serious injuries.  Information concerning the extent of the incident and the amount of damage will be made public as it becomes available.     Dean O'Hair, Chevron Richmond Refinery External Affairs Manager, said, "We are responding as part of a comprehensive plan to protect our employees and the community."        The cause of the incident has not been determined.    SOURCE  Chevron       /CONTACT: Richmond Refinery Public Affairs, +1-510-242-4507      /Web site: http://www.chevron.com/     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 11:04 ET (16:04 GMT)

Headline: : Nortel Wins Role In BT's 21 Century Network>NT
Story: LONDON, UNITED KINGDOM--(CCNMatthews - Jan. 15, 2007) - BT has selected Nortel(1) (TSX:NT)(NYSE:NT) to play an important role in its 21st Century Network (21CN) programme. Nortel will be one of two suppliers of a carrier-scale Ethernet solution for 21CN that exploits Ethernet in a fundamentally new way and is expected to drive a radical change in the economics of carrier networks.    BT aims to use the new Ethernet solution to transport high-bandwidth services - from mission critical business applications to full-streaming video - with new levels of simplicity, quality and cost-savings.    "Today's announcement marks a significant industry turning point," said Mike Zafirovski, president and chief executive officer, Nortel. "BT is using Ethernet technology in a completely new way to provide an answer to the challenge of simplifying network management, redefining service quality and reducing costs," Zafirovski said.    "We have been anticipating the widespread deployment of Ethernet in our 21CN architecture for a while but have been waiting for development to help make the technology viable for deployment in carrier grade networks," said Matt Beal, director core convergence, BT Wholesale. "The implementation of Ethernet also complements fully BT's well established MPLS strategy within 21CN."    PBB-TE (Provider Backbone Bridging Traffic Engineering) is an emerging IEEE standard that incorporates a set of enhancements to Ethernet known as Provider Backbone Transport (PBT) that allows the use of Ethernet for a carrier class transport network.    "As one of the early pioneers of PBT we have already witnessed significant movement in the market for metro transport networks as it splits between an evolution of a router-based approach and a movement towards Ethernet," said Philippe Morin, president, Metro Ethernet Networks, Nortel.    "Nortel believes that BT's thought leadership and the pre-eminence of its 21CN strategy will speed wider-scale adoption of Ethernet-based solutions. It will also help continue the momentum to standardize the technology through the recognized standards bodies," added Morin.    BT has selected Nortel's Metro Ethernet Routing Switch 8600 and Metro Ethernet Services Unit 1850 for the Ethernet component of its 21CN. PBB-TE promises to bring control to data paths within very large carrier networks, enabling true quality of service, meaningful service level agreements and the ability to set aside specific paths for communications, increasing network performance while providing carrier-grade resiliency.    PBB-TE is currently progressing through industry standardization within the IEEE (Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers) 802.1 Working Group.    A number of service providers including The Chinese Academy of Sciences, COLT Telecom, MTC Kuwait, Pride, Shanghai Telecom, SURFNet and Versatel have already adopted various elements of Nortel's Metro Ethernet Networking solutions including the Metro Ethernet Routing Switch 8600, the Optical Multiservice Edge 6500 and Provider Backbone Bridges - which enable millions of services to be provisioned via the network, versus the thousands available in competing solutions.    About Nortel    Nortel is a recognized leader in delivering communications capabilities that enhance the human experience, ignite and power global commerce, and secure and protect the world's most critical information. Our next-generation technologies, for both service providers and enterprises, span access and core networks, support multimedia and business-critical applications, and help eliminate today's barriers to efficiency, speed and performance by simplifying networks and connecting people with information. Nortel does business in more than 150 countries. Headline: : VMETRO offers Dual Channel 105MHz ADC based on Xilinx Virtex-5 FPGA
Story: HOUSTON--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   VMETRO today announced the PMC-FPGA05-ADC1, a Xilinx, Inc. (NASDAQ:XLNX) Virtex(TM)-5 LX110 FPGA based PMC module with integrated dual analog input channels. By closely coupling the high-performance FPGA processing and the analog I/O, the PMC-FPGA05-ADC1 is ideal for applications requiring maximum performance with minimal latencies such as Software Defined Radio (SDR), Signal Intelligence (SigInt) and data recording. The analog input front end incorporates dual channel analog input with a full power input bandwidth of between 100 kHz and 110 MHz with a Signal to Noise Ratio (SNR) of 68dB and a Spurious Free Dynamic Range (SFDR) of 82dB. The full scale analog input is +10dBm (2V pk-pk). Front panel clock and trigger inputs are also available.     The PMC-FPGA05-ADC1's high performance dual analog interfaces combined with the processing power and PCI-X bus interface enable this PMC module to provide front-end processing. Processing on the PMC-FPGA05-ADC1 is provided by a Xilinx XC5VLX110 Virtex-5 FPGA. Supported by three banks of QDRII SRAM (8Mbytes per bank) and two banks of DDR2 SDRAM (128Mbytes per banks), the Virtex-5 FPGA is capable of performing sophisticated, high-speed DSP tasks in a small footprint. The PMC module supports a 133MHz PCI-X interface as well as PMC digital user I/O via the Pn4 connector. Both of these interfaces are provided by the FPGA.     "Our customers need more than just analog input, they need processing too, where it counts - at the front end. The PMC-FPGA05-ADC1 gives them that. For example, the Virtex-5 FPGA can be used for digital down conversion, FFTs, AES encryption for secure applications or even custom algorithm development. The PMC-FPGA05-ADC1 enables leading performance and flexibility in a single product," says Dave Barker, Vice President at VMETRO, Inc.     The PMC-FPGA05-ADC1 is just one member of VMETRO's Virtex-5 based FPGA family of products which include variants for Camera Link, analog output, LVDS, L-band receivers, FPDP/FPDP-II, and RS422/485 to address applications such as imaging and telecommunications.     "VMETRO has taken advantage of the parallel signal processing capabilities of the high-performance Xilinx Virtex-5 devices to deliver a leading-edge ADC offering," said Per Holmberg, director of Programmable Digital Solutions Marketing at Xilinx. "Our low-power Virtex-5 devices combine this capability with integrated flexible signaling to enable an efficient high-speed DSP implementation in a small footprint."     Software support for the PMC-FPGA05-ADC1 includes host drivers for Windows and VxWorks. Linux support is scheduled for the second half of 2007. The drivers support high-speed DMA to minimize potential bottlenecks between the analog input, the FPGA and the host processor. Utilities and example VHDL are provided to support customers' development of FPGA firmware as well as providing diagnostic support.       PMC-FPGA05-ADC1 features:       --  Dual 14-bit analog input       --  Xilinx XC5VLX110 Virtex-5 FPGA       --  Multiple banks of QDRII SRAM and DDR2 SDRAM       --  PMC format module with PCI-X interface       --  Windows and VxWorks support     Pricing for the PMC-FPGA05-ADC1 is $7.995. Availability is 4 to 6 weeks, ARO.       About VMETRO     VMETRO (OSE:VME) provides integrators of high-end embedded computer systems with products and services, from development through deployment, with the highest levels of performance, innovation and reliability. The main product areas include 1) Embedded Computing - high-performance I/O and Digital Signal Processing boards and systems based on FPGAs and PowerPCs, 2) Data Recording and Storage - high-performance long endurance Recording / Playback systems and Rugged Storage solutions, and 3) Bus and Protocol Analyzers - advanced tools used to debug, optimize, validate and test computer based systems. All products are based on open standards like VME/VXS and PCI/cPCI/PMC/XMC, with a strong focus on high-speed serial interconnects such as Fibre Channel, Serial FPDP, Aurora and PCI Express. For more information, please visit www.vmetro.com. Headline: Compagnie Generale de Geophysique Closes Veritas Merger
Story: Edited Press Release   PARIS--Compagnie Generale de Geophysique-Veritas today announced the completion of the merger between Veritas DGC Inc. and a subsidiary of Compagnie Generale de Geophysique (12016.FR) on January 12, 2007, upon satisfaction of the closing conditions of the merger agreement.   The combined company has been renamed "Compagnie Generale de Geophysique-Veritas," abbreviated as "CGGVeritas", and is listed on both Euronext Paris and the New York Stock Exchange (in ADS form).   The trading symbol of the combined company's ADS on the New York Stock Exchange is "CGV". Based on merger closing date, and according to the formula set out in the merger agreement, the per share cash consideration to holders of Veritas stock is $85.50 and the per share stock consideration is 2.0097 CGGVeritas ADSs.   As disclosed previously, Veritas stockholders who elected cash will receive a mix of cash consideration and stock consideration, and the stockholders who elected stock and all stockholders who failed to make a valid election will receive stock consideration.   The exact allocation of merger consideration to stockholders who elected cash will not be known until final results of the election process are determined, at the end of the guaranteed delivery period at 5:00 p.m., New York City time, on January 17, 2007.   During the CGG shareholders meeting held on January 9, 2007, CGG shareholders voted, conditioned upon completion of the merger, to elect four new board members, all of whom were previous board members of Veritas, namely: Loren K. Carroll, Thierry Pilenko, David F. Work and Terence Young. The board of directors of CGGVeritas is composed of 12 members.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 02:53 ET (07:53 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.
