Headline: : Alexis Nihon REIT Announces Adoption Of Unitholder Rights Plan>AN.UN.T
Story: MONTREAL, QUEBEC--(CCNMatthews - Jan. 15, 2007) - Alexis Nihon Real Estate Investment Trust (the "REIT" or "Alexis Nihon REIT") (TSX:AN.UN) announced today it has enacted a unitholder rights plan on January 14, 2007, effective as of that date.    The plan is designed to prevent a creeping takeover of the REIT, which is the acquisition of control through a progressive increase in ownership without an offer to all unitholders. The Board of Trustees believes a creeping takeover would be detrimental to the best interests of the unitholders and the REIT, and the plan gives the Board an effective tool in responding to such an initiative. The plan also enables the REIT to obtain the best value for all unitholders and provides the unit ownership stability to protect the opportunity for all unitholders to participate in the existing transaction with Cominar Real Estate Investment Trust ("Cominar") or any other future transaction involving the REIT.    The rights plan will not prevent an offer made to all unitholders for all of their units, and will not have any impact on the takeover bid of Cominar forming part of the combination previously announced on December 4, 2006.    The rights issued under the rights plan will become exercisable when a person, together with any parties related to it, acquires or announces its intention to acquire 20% or more of the REIT's outstanding units without complying with the "Permitted Bid" provisions of the rights plan or without approval of the Board of the REIT. Should such an acquisition occur, rights holders (other than the acquiring person and related persons) can purchase units of the REIT at half the prevailing market price at the time the rights become exercisable.    Under the rights plan, a Permitted Bid is a bid made to all holders of the REIT's units for all of their units which provide that the offeror may take up and pay for the units only if at least 50% of the outstanding units, other than those owned by the offeror and certain related parties, have been tendered.    The rights have been issued on January 14, 2007 to holders of record at 6:00 p.m. on Friday, January 12, 2007. The issuance of the units upon exercise of the rights is subject to receipt of certain regulatory approvals. The rights plan will terminate on July 13, 2007.    Advisory Support    The REIT has retained the services of CIBC World Markets Inc. as financial advisors and Fasken Martineau DuMoulin LLP as legal advisors.    About Alexis Nihon REIT    The REIT currently owns interests in 65 office, retail, and industrial properties, including a 426-unit multi-family residential property, located in the greater Montreal area and the National Capital Region. The REIT's portfolio has an aggregate of 9.1 million square feet of leasable area, of which 0.4 million square feet is co-owned.                   FOR FURTHER INFORMATION PLEASE CONTACT:             Alexis Nihon Real Estate Investment Trust           Guy Charron           Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer           (514) 931-2591           Email: guy.charron@alexisnihon.com           Website: www.alexisnihon.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 06:32 ET (11:32 GMT)

Headline: : Hurricane Zone Business Looks to Hosted Solution From UCN to Support Customer Service Operation
Story: inContact Selected for Flexibility, Scalability and Inherent Disaster Recovery of ACD/IVR System       SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 15 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- If your business is based in the "hurricane zone", you've probably asked yourself this question: What is my plan for continued customer service if our building is damaged and our systems go down?  That's exactly the question a national telecommunications service provider to government facilities, based in a coastal city on the Gulf Coast, asked itself when it started evaluating an upgrade to its on-site, call distribution (ACD) and voice interaction (IVR) system.  After reviewing a number of different proposals from both on-premises and off-premises vendors, the company narrowed the field down to six competitors and eventually selected inContact(TM) from UCN, Inc. (OTC Bulletin Board: UCNN).  This new UCN customer supports over 50,000 daily users of its specialized telephone products.        The Challenge     On a fast track growth curve, the company's billing inquiry and customer service group was rapidly out growing its allotted space at headquarters.  "We had maxed out our older phone system, which wasn't very flexible and was expensive to maintain and support," said M. Phillips, Director of Billing Management.  "That old system could handle maybe six more stations before we had to go through a major, expensive upgrade.  We knew over the next six months our team was going to expand well beyond six stations."  Compounding the problem, the organization had to retain an external technical contractor to handle all changes that needed to be made to the call handling system.     With hold times hitting 15 to 20 minutes during peak periods, the company's abandonment rate would spike up as high as 26 percent.  The target was 5 percent.  Prior to inContact, said Phillips, "our only solution was to throw people at the problem."          The Solution      Among Phillips' key vendor selection criteria were:      *  Ability to easily expand and contract the workforce as needed      *  Support for at-home workers      *  Flexible programming environment; ability to start out basic and modify         call flows and skill groups over time      *  Ease of integration with an existing database      *  Ability to train an internal person to handle simple adds, moves and         changes as needed      *  Reliability and availability; get key equipment and software off-site       Currently, 42 customer service and tech support reps are on inContact. Over the next two months, the company plans to expand into another location, adding 20 to 30 more agent seats.     The inContact Call Back feature is helping the company reduce hold times and improve its abandonment rate during peak periods.  Instead of remaining on hold, the system enables the caller to drop off the line, while holding the caller's place in queue.  When that call comes to the front of the queue, the system automatically calls back the customer and connects the call to the first available agent.     Prior to inContact, whenever Phillips wanted to create a new outbound campaign to support a new correctional facility, "We had to wait for a developer to do that for us.  After seeing our new system, I feel like several of us have the expertise to handle this ourselves," said Phillips.        Business Benefits     Among the benefits of doing business with UCN, Phillips found the company's expertise in call center best practices and deep knowledge of telecom long distance services help the company put a program together that reduced overall telecom spend.  "What we will save in telecom costs should cover the costs of our inContact agent seats," estimates Phillips.  Equally important, when hurricane season hits again next, "we have removed all ACD/IVR equipment from this building, plus we've removed the need for a technical contractor to support the equipment and software," observed Phillips.  With the company's continued eye on growth, the need to accommodate future rep stations shows no sign of slowing down.        About UCN, Inc.     UCN (OTC Bulletin Board: UCNN) is the leading provider of all-in-one, off-premises contact handling services that improve the customer contact experience and the productivity of those handling the contacts.  InContact(TM) includes an integrated suite of advanced contact handling applications and reporting, monitoring, recording, administration and workforce management application.  InControl(TM) is a unique, rapid application development tool that enables inContact customers to develop highly flexible, customized business contact handling processes in record time.  To learn more about UCN visit www.ucn.net.     Safe Harbor Statement: The Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 provides a safe harbor for forward-looking information made on the Company's behalf.  All statements, other than statements of historical facts which address the Company's expectations of sources of capital or which express the Company's expectation for the future with respect to financial performance or operating strategies, can be identified as forward-looking statements.  Such statements made by the Company are based on knowledge of the environment in which it operates, but because of the factors previously listed, as well as other factors beyond the control of the Company, actual results may differ materially from the expectations expressed in the forward-looking statements.  (For the complete statement please click to: www.ucn.net/safeharbor)    SOURCE  UCN, Inc.       /CONTACT: Jan Johnson, VP of Marketing of UCN, +1-801-320-3263, jan.johnson@ucn.net; or Media, Rod Anderson of Snapp Norris Group, +1-801-208-1100, rod.anderson@sng.com, for UCN, Inc.; or Investors, Scott Liolios, scott@liolios.com, or Ron Both, both of Liolios Group Inc., +1-949-574-3860, for UCN, Inc.; or Jackie Funk of Apptix, +1-703-890-2825, jackie.funk@apptix.com      /Web site: http://www.ucn.net     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 07:00 ET (12:00 GMT)

Headline: : Collins Industries Announces Appointment of Chief Financial Officer
Story: HUTCHINSON, Kan., Jan. 15 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Collins Industries, Inc. (OTC: CNSI) announced today that Hans Heinsen will be joining the Company as Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, effective January 16, 2007. Mr. Heinsen will report directly to the President/CEO of the Company and will be responsible for all accounting and finance functions.     "We are certainly pleased to announce that Hans has joined the Collins Industries organization.  He brings a wealth of knowledge to the Company and will be instrumental to the continued progress of all our new corporate initiatives going forward.  Hans brings over 30 years of experience in corporate finance and financial management," stated Randall Swift, President and Chief Executive Officer.     Mr. Heinsen, 54, most recently served as Executive Vice President -  International of Solo Cup Company, Inc. in Highland Park, IL.   In this role he was responsible for the $400 million international operation.  Prior to Solo Cup, he was Senior Vice President & Chief Financial Officer of SF Holdings Group Inc. in New York, NY.  Mr. Heinsen holds a B.S.F.S. from Georgetown University, and a MBA in Finance from New York University.     Collins Industries, Inc., a subsidiary of BNS Holding, Inc., is a leading manufacturer of ambulances (including medical attack vehicles, rescue vehicles and fire emergency vehicles), North America's largest producer of Type "A" small school buses, the nation's second largest manufacturer of terminal trucks and a leader in the road construction and industrial sweeper markets. Since 1971, the Company has grown to approximately 1000 employees in six plants comprising over one million combined square feet of manufacturing space. The Company sells its products throughout the United States and abroad.     This press release contains forward-looking statements, as defined in the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Headline: Toronto Stks Higher At Midday; March Networks Shrs Tumble
Story: By Stuart Weinberg       OF DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     TORONTO (Dow Jones)--The stock market was higher at midday on a quiet Monday with modest gains across most groups.   However, March Networks was down sharply after the company issued a fiscal 2007 earnings warning due to a decline in orders from the firm's largest customer.   At 11:4 5 a.m. EST (1645 GMT), the S&P/TSX Composite Index was up 65.34 points, or 0.52%, at 12744.15. Advances led declines 786 to 493. Trading volume was 110.2 million shares.   The S&P/TSX 60 Index was up 3.10 points, or 0.42%, at 732/20.   U.S. markets are closed for Martin Luther King Jr. Day.  - -   (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 11:50 ET (16:50 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: INTERVIEW: Rabobank Possible Merger Candidate In 3-5 Yrs
Story: (This story was originally published Friday)     By Nicolas Parasie     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     UTRECHT, the Netherlands (Dow Jones)--Rabobank (RBK.YY), the world's leading lender to the food and agricultural business, would be willing to consider a tie-up with another major institution to create a European champion, but only after the consolidation process is completed in individual countries.   Chief Executive Bert Heemskerk told Dow Jones Newswires that "if we, as a Dutch bank, could set something up with possibly the Belgians, the French or the Germans, preferably a bank with a cooperative character and on the basis of equals, then we're talking about a serious scenario."   Heemskerk said that large-scale, cross-border consolidation within Europe would likely take place over the next three to five years. The process will be driven by how the global banking industry evolves, especially in countries like Italy and Germany, he said.   "Germany, France, Italy are important merger countries," he added. "That process is currently still taking place. The catalyst for cross-border consolidation (would be) that the consolidation process in those countries comes to an end."   "If a German bank, for instance, now had to chose between a German partner and Rabo, it will directly come to a conclusion that a German partner offers more cost synergies than Rabo."   He added: "It strikes me that European banks used to be far more European (in thinking) ... Every large bank belonged in some way or another to another European bank's network. There was really an idea to create European champions."   Now, he said, chairmen usually have a domestic mentality and "have no or barely any plans to merge on a European level."   Heemskerk recalled from the period between 1969 and 1972, when he worked for Amro - a predecessor of domestic rival ABN Amro Holding NV (ABN) - that there were serious plans of a merger with Deutsche Bank (DB), Midland Bank (now part of HSBC Group) and Societe Generale (13080.FR).                          Agricultural Roots     The roots of Rabobank, which boasts a Triple-A rating from the major credit rating agencies, lie in the late 19th century, when two cooperative banks offered farmers access to the capital market.   Since then, the Utrecht-based bank has evolved into an all-finance international group that offers, besides retail services, Internet banking, insurance through its participation in Eureko, investment and corporate banking, leasing and real estate investing.   Heemskerk said that in the event of a merger, preference would go to other banks that have the same agricultural origins.   Similar financial groups "with which we see ourselves eventually doing business with" include France's Credit Agricole SA (4507.FR) and Austria's Raiffeisen, although Heemskerk didn't exclude a partnership with other types of banks, "as long as we can preserve our identity."   If 2006 was the "year of truth" for Rabobank, then 2007 will be the year of consolidating recently acquired businesses, Heemskerk said. The bank was the most active Dutch player in the past year, spending $851 million on California's Mid-State Bank & Trust and EUR845 million for Bouwfonds, a Dutch real estate developer.   But Rabo also bought participation in banks in Indonesia, Zambia, Tanzania and raised its stake in Swiss Bank Sarasin & Cie AG (BSAN.EB). For 2007, Rabobank expects to take some smaller steps, Heemskerk said.   "At that time (of buying Mid-State bank), we chose between expanding on the West Coast or in the Midwest. We chose (the West Coast). We likely won't take any further step in the U.S. for now, although we keep looking for good opportunities," Heemskerk said.   In Internet banking, however, Rabobank plans to launch in Australia, adding a fourth market to Ireland, Belgium and New Zealand.   Rabobank thus follows in the footsteps of its domestic competitor, bank and insurance giant ING Groep NV (ING), to offer online banking services.   "Eventually we will launch in more countries that we're already active, like the U.S. and Poland. Within five years, we expect to be active in Poland and the U.S," he said.   Rabobank also holds a 37% stake in insurance group Eureko, after the merger of Rabo's insurance arm Interpolis with the Dutch arm of Eureko, Achmea.   Heemskerk, who said he was pleased with the cooperation, said that eventually Rabobank will consider another step to strengthen ties with Achmea's parent Eureko, but he declined to elaborate.   "Let's say we're engaged now and if things really go well, why not consider a marriage?" Heemskerk said.   Rabobank will present its full-year figures in March. Heemskerk indicated that it "would be very strange if we don't meet our group net-profit growth target of 10-12%" and also said that Rabobank currently has a 25.9% market share of the Dutch mortgage market.   Heemskerk is equally optimistic about the Dutch economy, which economists at the Utrecht-based lender have forecast to grow by 3.25% in gross domestic product. Rabobank also expects costs related to the implementation of several regulatory directives to be lower than in 2006. "We think we're past the worst now," he said.   Heemskerk, 63, and former chief executive of Dutch private bank Van Lanschot (30263.AE), took the helm of Rabobank in December 2002. Heemskerk, who earned a degree in theology under the current Pope, Joseph Ratzinger, will stay with Rabobank for at least another year-and-a-half, he said.   "I'm still in good health, I have no plans to stop yet."   Company Web site: http://www.rabobank.com   -By Nicolas Parasie, Dow Jones Newswires; nicolas.parasie@dowjones.com; 31 20 6260770     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 01:45 ET (06:45 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Creation of CGGVeritas
Story: PARIS, January 15 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Compagnie Generale de Geophysique-Veritas (NYSE: CGV ; formerly GGY) today announced the completion of the merger between Veritas DGC Inc. (NYSE: formerly VTS) and a subsidiary of Compagnie Generale de Geophysique on January 12, 2007, upon satisfaction of the closing conditions of the merger agreement.     The combined company has been renamed "Compagnie Generale de Geophysique-Veritas," abbreviated as "CGGVeritas", and is listed on both Euronext Paris and the New York Stock Exchange (in ADS form). The trading symbol of the combined company's ADS on the New York Stock Exchange is "CGV".     Based on merger closing date, and according to the formula set out in the merger agreement, the per share cash consideration to holders of Veritas stock is $85.50 and the per share stock consideration is 2.0097 CGGVeritas ADSs. As disclosed previously, Veritas stockholders who elected cash will receive a mix of cash consideration and stock consideration, and the stockholders who elected stock and all stockholders who failed to make a valid election will receive stock consideration. The exact allocation of merger consideration to stockholders who elected cash will not be known until final results of the election process are determined, at the end of the guaranteed delivery period at 5:00 p.m., New York City time, on January 17, 2007.     During the CGG shareholders meeting held on January 9, 2007, CGG shareholders voted, conditioned upon completion of the merger, to elect four new board members, all of whom were previous board members of Veritas, namely: Loren K. Carroll, Thierry Pilenko, David F. Work and Terence Young. The board of directors of CGGVeritas is composed of 12 members.     Robert Brunck stated, "As Chairman and CEO, I am very pleased to present to our shareholders the leading pure-play geophysical company, CGGVeritas. We provide our shareholders and customers with an unrivaled asset base and the industry reference in advanced technology supported by the deep expertise of our employees worldwide.     With our leading equipment manufacturing activities, state of the art vessels and land crews, extremely well positioned multi-client library, cutting-edge imaging technologies and the unique knowledge and client-focused mindset of our people, CGGVeritas is a choice of value for our customers and shareholders, especially considering the favorable upstream oil and gas services market environment.     Our unmatched capabilities provide our customers with the right tools to better explore, better develop and better produce reservoirs as they look to address reserve replacement challenges. In full partnership with our clients, we will leverage our unique positioning into sustainable value creation for our shareholders and a highly motivating work environment for our personnel".     The company will officially launch its new corporate identity on January 23rd 2007, to celebrate the creation of CGGVeritas.        About CGGVeritas:     CGGVeritas (www.cggveritas.com) is the world's leading international pure-play geophysical company delivering a wide range of technologies, services and equipment through Sercel, to its broad base of customers mainly throughout the global oil and gas industry.     CGGVeritas is listed on the Eurolist of Euronext Paris SA (ISIN: 0000120164) and the New York Stock Exchange (under the form of American Depositary Shares, NYSE: CGV).        Contact Relations Investisseurs:        Christophe Barnini Tel.: +33-1-64-47-38-10 e-mail : Invrel@cgg.com     This news release may include projections and other "forward-looking statements" within the meaning of the federal securities laws. Any such projections or statements reflect the current views of CGG or Veritas about future events and financial performance. No assurances can be given that such events or performance will occur as projected and actual results may differ materially from those projected.    SOURCE  CGGVeritas       /CONTACT: Christophe Barnini Tel.: +33-1-64-47-38-10 e-mail : Invrel@cgg.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 01:00 ET (06:00 GMT)

Headline: Vodafone Group Launches 3 New Handsets >VOD
Story: Edited Press Release     LONDON (Dow Jones)--Vodafone Monday announces a range of three new exclusive special edition consumer handsets to support the official launch of the new Vodafone McLaren Mercedes team in Valencia on Jan. 15.   The range of Vodafone McLaren Mercedes handsets comprises the Vodafone McLaren Mercedes 770SH (3G) and Vodafone McLaren Mercedes GX29 (2G), two clam shells from Sharp and the 3G broadband slider Vodafone McLaren Mercedes - SGH-Z720M from the Samsung Ultra Edition.   The handset range will be available from Jan. 16 in some Vodafone operating Companies, it said.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 07:37 ET (12:37 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Altera Names Timothy Morse As Sr VP, Fincl Chief >ALTR
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   Timothy R. Morse, a 15-year veteran of General Electric Co. (GE), has joined Altera Corp. (ALTR) as senior vice-president and chief financial officer.   Most recently, Morse served as chief financial officer and general manager of business development, GE Plastics.   As reported in October, Nathan Sarkisian retired as senior vice-president and chief financial officer and James Callas was named acting chief financial officer.   Altera, San Jose, is a semiconductor-technology company.   -Wendy Tsau; 416-306-2100; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 13:08 ET (18:08 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Sunrise REIT Agrees to be Acquired by Ventas for a Price Equivalent to Cdn$15.00 Per Unit
Story: Transaction Valued at Cdn$2.14 Billion       TORONTO, Jan. 15, 2007 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ - Sunrise Senior Living Real Estate Investment Trust ("Sunrise REIT") (TSX:SZR.UN) announced today that Ventas, Inc. ("Ventas") (NYSE:VTR) has agreed to a transaction in which it will acquire all of Sunrise REIT's assets and assume all of its liabilities. Following the acquisition of Sunrise REIT's assets, all of the issued and outstanding units of Sunrise REIT will be redeemed at a redemption price of Cdn$15.00 per unit. The consideration payable to unitholders represents a 35.7% premium over the closing price of the units on Friday, January 12, 2007. The transaction values the equity of Sunrise REIT at approximately Cdn$1.14 billion and the total enterprise at approximately Cdn$2.14 billion.     A Special Committee of independent trustees of Sunrise REIT has reviewed the transaction, in consultation with its independent legal and financial advisors. In that regard, the Special Committee received an opinion from TD Securities Inc. that the consideration to be received by unitholders in connection with the transaction is fair, from a financial point of view, to such unitholders. The Special Committee and the board of trustees of Sunrise REIT recommend that unitholders vote in favour of the transaction.     "We are proud of the outstanding premium that we have been able to deliver to our unitholders through this transaction. This is due in large part to the quality of the portfolio that Sunrise REIT has assembled over the last two years, and the recognition by Ventas of the future potential of these assets," said Douglas J. MacLatchy, President and CEO of Sunrise REIT.     "Over the past year, the Board, together with its financial advisors, reached the conclusion that our units were undervalued in the market and that there was an opportunity to unlock significant value for unitholders. We initiated a process to achieve value maximization for our unitholders. We have clearly achieved that," said Michael Warren, Chairman of the Board of Trustees of Sunrise REIT and its Special Committee.     "We are delighted that we were able to complete this agreement with the Sunrise REIT management team and board, who have done a great job assembling one of the premier private pay senior housing portfolios in North America. We are also excited to begin working with Sunrise Senior Living and enter the Canadian market with this acquisition," Ventas Chairman, President and CEO Debra A. Cafaro said.     Sunrise Senior Living, Inc. (NYSE:SRZ) is the manager of Sunrise REIT's communities and was Sunrise REIT's promoter on its initial public offering. Mr. Thomas Newell, President of Sunrise Senior Living, Inc., said, "We are extremely pleased with the transaction. We are moving from one excellent capital partner with Sunrise REIT to another with Ventas and we look forward to working with Ventas as a new capital partner. This transaction clearly demonstrates the value that was created for Sunrise REIT shareholders in just two years, which we believe reflects the value of the Sunrise brand and our high-quality development and management performance."     A special meeting of unitholders ("Special Meeting") is expected to be held on or before March 31, 2007 and closing is expected to occur shortly thereafter. A management information circular containing the terms of the transaction will be mailed to unitholders in advance of the Special Meeting. Pursuant to Sunrise REIT's Declaration of Trust, the transaction is subject to the approval of unitholders holding more than 66 2/3% of the units represented at the Special Meeting.     Sunrise REIT and Ventas have entered into a mutually beneficial Purchase Agreement which provides that the board of trustees of Sunrise REIT will recommend that its unitholders vote in favour of the transaction at the Special Meeting. The Purchase Agreement also provides for, among other things, a non-solicitation covenant on the part of Sunrise REIT, a right in favour of Ventas to amend the terms of the transaction if Sunrise REIT is presented with a superior offer, and a payment to Ventas of a break fee of Cdn$39.8 million in certain circumstances. In connection with the transaction, the distribution reinvestment plan of Sunrise REIT has been suspended, effective following the distribution payable on January 15, 2007 to unitholders of record as at December 31, 2006. The Purchase Agreement will be available on the SEDAR website at www.sedar.com.        About Sunrise REIT (TSZ:SZR.UN)     Sunrise REIT was formed to indirectly acquire, own and invest in income-producing senior living communities in major metropolitan markets and their surrounding suburban areas in Canada and the United States. Sunrise REIT owns 74 senior living communities, 11 in Canada and 63 in the United States. All of Sunrise REIT's senior living communities are managed by Sunrise Senior Living, Inc. one of the largest providers of senior living services in North America. Sunrise REIT also directly acquires interests in newly developed senior living communities through development and financing arrangements with Sunrise Senior Living, Inc.        Forward-Looking Statements     Certain statements contained in this news release may include forward-looking information with respect to Sunrise REIT's operations and future financial results. Such statements are based on current expectations, are subject to a number of uncertainties and risks, and actual results may differ materially from those contained in such statements. These uncertainties and risks include, but are not limited to, availability of resources, competitive pressures, changes in market activity and regulatory requirements. Further information can be found in disclosure documents filed by Sunrise REIT with regulatory authorities, available at www.sedar.com.    SOURCE  Sunrise Senior Living Real Estate Investment Trust       /CONTACT: Douglas J. MacLatchy, President & Chief Executive Officer, Sunrise REIT, doug.maclatchy@sunrisereit.com, Toll-free investor relations phone: 1-866-734-8797, www.sunrisereit.ca     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 08:45 ET (13:45 GMT)

Headline: Oce 4Q 06 Net Pft -48.7%, EBIT Met Full Year Guidance
Story: By Mathijs Schiffers   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     AMSTERDAM (Dow Jones)--Oce NV (OCENY), the Dutch producer of copying and printing machines,  Monday reported a 48.7% fall in fourth quarter net profit from the previous year but the company met its full year guidance for operating income.   The previous year's figure was boosted by a pension gain.   Oce's net profit in the three months to Nov. 30 was EUR26.7 million from EUR52.1 million. Sales were up 8.8% to EUR832.1 million from EUR764.4 million, boosted by the contribution of U.S.-based peer Imagistics, which Oce acquired in Nov. 2005.   The figures are provisional and unaudited, Oce said.   Analysts had expected net profit to come in at EUR20.8 million on sales of EUR838 million.   Oce's fourth-quarter operating income before interest and taxes, or EBIT, came in at EUR43.8 million, from EUR70.6 million a year ago. That brings Oce's full year EBIT at EUR102.2 million, while the company guided for a full year EBIT of around EUR90 million.   The Venlo, Netherlands-based company, whose main competitors are U.S.-based Xerox Corp. (XRX) and Japan-based Canon Inc. (CAJ), proposes a dividend of EUR0.58 per ordinary share for 2006.   Oce shares closed at EUR12.64 on Friday.   Company Website: http://www.oce.com   By Mathijs Schiffers; Dow Jones Newswires; +31-20-5890270; mathijs.schiffers@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 02:04 ET (07:04 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Pacific Biometrics' Chief Medical Officer Dr. Mario Ehlers to Present at the Partnering with Central Labs, ECG, and Imaging Labs Conference, January 17-19 in Anaheim, CA
Story: SEATTLE--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   Mario Ehlers, M.D., Ph.D., the Chief Medical Officer of Pacific Biometrics, Inc. (OTCBB:PBME) ("PBI"), will present at the 5th annual Partnering with Central Labs, ECG, and Imaging Labs conference. The conference takes place January 17-19 and will be held at the Disneyland Hotel in Anaheim, CA. Dr. Ehlers will talk on "Use of Biochemical and Imaging Biomarkers in the Clinical Development of Lipid-modifying Drugs" in a workshop entitled "Overcoming Operational Challenges in Implementing Biomarkers in Clinical Trials." His co-presenter will be David S. Lester, Ph.D., New York Site Head, Human Health Technologies, Pfizer Global Research and Development.     The Partnering with Central Labs, ECG, and Imaging Labs conference is the only conference focused on aligning sponsors and labs globally, and brings small and large sponsors and lab partners together to build more efficient processes from the initial selection process through final database lock.     "Outsourcing is a critical component of pharmaceutical and biotech R&D activities. At PBI we have provided laboratory testing in support of clinical drug development for many of the world's largest pharma companies for the past 17 years. We have built a strong reputation in our focus areas, including cardiovascular, metabolic, and lipid disorders," commented Dr. Ehlers. "More and more emphasis is being placed on the use of biomarkers to facilitate drug development, and we are honored to present on the use of biomarkers in the field of lipid drugs at this key industry conference. Expertise in biomarkers is increasingly required in the evolving drug-development paradigm."     For more information about the conference, please visit www.partneringwithlabs.com.       About Pacific Biometrics, Inc.     Established in 1989, PBI provides specialized central laboratory and contract research services to support pharmaceutical and diagnostic manufacturers conducting human clinical trial research. The company provides expert services in the areas of cardiovascular disease, diabetes, osteoporosis, arthritis, and nutrition. The PBI laboratory is accredited by the College of American Pathologists, and through its non-profit affiliate Pacific Biometrics Research Foundation, is one of only three U.S.-based members of the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) Cholesterol Reference Method Laboratory Network. PBI's clients include many of the world's largest pharmaceutical, biotech, and diagnostic companies.     Pacific Biometrics also owns several patented and patent-pending technologies, including monitoring devices for glucose and changes in bone turnover, an advanced, proprietary, isothermal DNA amplification technology, and a gene-based cell viability technology to distinguish live from dead cells in a broad range of diagnostic applications.     For more information, visit the Company Web site at www.pacbio.com. Headline: FRENCH PRESS: Airbus To Move All A320 Assembly To Hamburg
Story: PARIS (Dow Jones)--Airbus plans to consolidate assembly of its next generation of A320 jets at its site in Hamburg, La Tribune reports Monday, citing information given to unions by Airbus chief Louis Gallois.   Assembly of the A320 is currently split between Toulouse and Hamburg, and French employees fear the move will lead to drop in workload at the Toulouse site, the newspaper reports.     Newspaper Web site: http://www.latribune.fr     -By Paris Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; 33-1-4017 1740     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 02:29 ET (07:29 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : CSR To Bring Lowest Cost High-Performance GPS To Handsets and Other Portable Devices - Target Price of Under $1
Story: CSR To Bring Lowest Cost High-Performance GPS To Handsets and Other Portable Devices - Target Price of Under $1    CAMBRIDGE, England--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--     CSR plc (LSE:CSR):       -- Ref: EME9965       -- Photo Ref: PEM4745       -- To download: http://www.csr.com/images/hires/pem4745.jpg       -- Details of CSR's acquisitions are available in the financial  announcement at:       http://ir.csr.com/csr/news/releases/pr2007/2007-01-15/     CSR plc today announced the company is to provide the most competitive Global Positioning System (GPS) technology for mobile handsets and network operators. CSR has acquired NordNav Technologies AB and Cambridge Positioning Systems Ltd that, combined, will allow the company to provide software-based low cost GPS suitable for mass-market mobile phones and PNDs (Personal Navigation Devices). CSR will apply its own experience in embedding radio technologies into the mobile platform and expects its first Autonomous and Assisted GPS product offerings that support satellite navigation and other location-based services to be available during H1 2007, with cost expected to subsequently reduce to less than $1.       CSR's GPS technology will be demonstrated at 3GSM Congress, 12-15  February, Barcelona.     The two acquisitions enable CSR to offer a GPS solution to handset, PND and other portable device manufacturers, offering an important added-value technology. CSR's acquired patented GPS solution is a software-based architecture that allows an incremental price that falls to less than $1 of the overall BoM when used with CSR's Bluetooth technology. CSR's patented methods to reduce both the number of processor cycles and the time to first fix, give an extremely power efficient overall solution with less than half the processing requirements of alternative solutions, whilst remaining flexible enough to perform highly dynamic and accurate tracking. With availability during H107, the software GPS technology acquired from NordNav will also take up 80 percent less area than competing hardware solutions and is the lowest cost solution on the market, with a price that is set to fall to less than $1. This means that CSR's GPS technology is practical for mass-market mobile applications including low-medium end feature cellular handsets, Smartphones, PNDs, and other portable devices.       CSR saw that GPS solutions needed to be much smaller, lower cost,  and less power - and processor - hungry to enable a dramatic increase  in mobile handset attach rates for personal positioning and location  based services. To ensure the technology is usable, it is also  essential that it works in harmony with GSM/3G radios, that the  satellite signal acquisition time is reduced, and that location fixes  can be maintained in all environments - even indoors. CSR acquired  NordNav Technologies AB and Cambridge Positioning Systems Ltd to bring  together the solutions to all these hurdles, and combined the  technology with its own expertise in embedding wireless technologies  into small and power sensitive mobile applications.     CSR has acquired Cambridge Positioning Systems Ltd for its Extended GPS (EGPSTM) software algorithms for mobile handsets and network server software. These algorithms allow users to achieve a faster location fix (less than 3 seconds), and also provide GPS coverage in dense urban areas and even indoors where there is no access to GPS satellite signals. In addition to improved user experience, the faster fix means that in comparison to conventional Assisted GPS, power can be reduced by a factor of 10 or more.       With a combined GPS and EGPS software for handsets, CSR will be  able to offer the most competitive, complete and technically advanced  mobile GPS solution available to mobile handset, PND, and other  portable device makers and operators. CSR's GPS technology will  support the Galileo global standard.     Matthew Phillips, SVP of CSR's Mobile Handset Connectivity strategic business unit, commented, "At $5-$10, current GPS solutions are too expensive and just not practical for mainstream cellphone applications" Phillips continued, "There are also performance restrictions in terms of both handset and network that have meant that the technology is not appropriate for the mobile platform. The two acquisitions mean that CSR has removed the barriers for mobile handset makers and operators to provide location based services for the mass market."       About CSR       CSR is the leading global provider of personal wireless technology  and its product portfolio covers Bluetooth, FM receivers and WiFi  (IEEE802.11). CSR offers developed hardware/software solutions, based  around its silicon platforms, that incorporate, fully integrated  radio, baseband and microcontroller elements.       CSR's customers include industry leaders such as Apple, Dell, LG,  Motorola, NEC, Nokia, Panasonic, RIM, Samsung, Sharp, Sony, TomTom and  Toshiba.       CSR has its headquarters and offices in Cambridge, UK, and offices  in Japan, Korea, Taiwan, China, India, France, Denmark, Sweden and  both Dallas and Detroit in the USA.       More information can be found at www.csr.com        CONTACT: CSR               Alan Woolhouse, +44 1223 692 689               aw@csr.com               or               EML               David Marsden/Richard Parker, +44 208 408 8000               csr@eml.com          SOURCE: CSR plc  Copyright Business Wire 2007       (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 03:02 ET (08:02 GMT)

Headline: : Mediacom Again Offers Binding Arbitration To Sinclair Pursuant To Strong Recommendation Of FCC>MCCC
Story: MIDDLETOWN, N.Y.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   MEDIACOM COMMUNICATIONS CORPORATION (NASDAQ: MCCC) announced that it again offered to submit to binding arbitration as a means of settling its ongoing retransmission consent dispute with Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc. (NASDAQ: SBGI). In its latest proposal to Sinclair, Mediacom would accept final binding arbitration before the FCC Media Bureau under established procedures for arbitrating retransmission consent disputes previously adopted by the FCC in the News Corp./DirecTV order published on January 14, 2004.     Mediacom's offer is consistent with the strong recommendation made by the Media Bureau in its recent order dated January 12, 2007, which stated:     Although the Commission does not have the authority to require the parties to submit to binding arbitration, we continue to strongly encourage them to submit to binding arbitration. Both parties could agree to final binding arbitration by the Media Bureau. If both parties agree to final binding arbitration by the Media Bureau, we would require Sinclair to authorize Mediacom's continued carriage of its stations' signals during the pendency of arbitration pursuant to the terms of the November 30, 2006 agreement between the parties, or, if so directed by the parties, pursuant to the per subscriber daily rate as proposed by Sinclair to Mediacom on January 11, 2007.     "Despite our disagreement with all the Media Bureau decisions on the Sinclair matter, including whether the FCC already has the authority to order binding arbitration and continued carriage, we are heeding the FCC's strong recommendation so that it orders Sinclair to reinstate the stations immediately, with or without agreement on procedural matters," said John Pascarelli, Mediacom EVP of Operations. "It is readily apparent to Mediacom, the Commission and federal lawmakers that binding arbitration is a realistic solution to this stalemate. We are hopeful that Sinclair will quickly accept this recommendation and not try to undermine the government's clear direction or stall this process by imposing unreasonable conditions on arbitration" concluded Pascarelli.     Mediacom Communications is the nation's 8th largest cable television company and one of the leading cable operators focused on serving the smaller cities and towns in the United States. Mediacom Communications offers a wide array of broadband products and services, including traditional video services, digital television, video-on-demand, digital video recorders, high-definition television, high-speed Internet access and phone service.        CONTACT: Mediacom Communications Corporation               Media Relations               Thomas Larsen, Vice President, Legal Affairs               845-695-2754               or               Investor Relations               Matt Derdeyn, Group Vice President,               Corporate Finance and Treasurer               845-695-2612        SOURCE: Mediacom Communications Corporation  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 16:48 ET (21:48 GMT)

Headline: Isotechnika Partner Gets Orphan Drug Status For ISA247
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   Isotechnika Inc. (ISA.T) partner Lux Biosciences has been granted orphan drug designation from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for ISA247, referred to as LX211 by Lux, for the treatment of non-infectious posterior, intermediate and panuveitis.   Uveitis is an autoimmune disease characterized by chronic inflammation of the eye.   Orphan drug designation is a special status for diseases or conditions affecting fewer than 200,000 patients in the U.S., Isotechnika said. The designation qualifies the sponsor for exclusive marketing rights in the U.S. for seven years if the company is first to receive marketing approval.   The designation also positions Lux Biosciences to benefit from certain tax credits and waives the company's obligation to pay FDA application user fees for these products as required by the Prescription Drug User Fee Act.   Isotechnika is a biopharmaceutical company.   -Carolyn King; 416-306-2100; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 08:54 ET (13:54 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: 2nd UPDATE:Ky Communities Evacuated After Train Collision
Story: (Adds details from state authorities, CSX official)     IRVINE, Ky. (AP)--Four runaway rail cars struck a parked locomotive in east-central Kentucky Monday, causing a fire and chemical release that prompted a limited evacuation and orders that others stay indoors.   The crash released butyl acetate, a flammable liquid, from a burning tanker car, authorities said. The fire produced a huge column of black smoke, and a section of the Kentucky River caught fire from the chemical release. No injuries were reported, authorities said.   "Emergency crews are attempting to extinguish that flame," said Kentucky State Police Maj. Lisa Rudzinksi. "That is a toxic cloud as a result of that butyl acetate."   Butyl acetate is commonly used as a solvent or as a synthetic fruit flavoring.   Police ordered people in the immediate area to evacuate, and people in others part of Estill County were told to stay indoors and keep their windows closed and to put towels under doors.   Preliminary information indicated that the four CSX rail cars left their track shortly before noon and went onto a main rail line, traveling several miles before hitting the parked CSX locomotive, said CSX spokesman Gary Sease.   Both the locomotive and rail cars were unmanned, Rudzinski said.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 14:25 ET (19:25 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: HK Hutchison Telecommunications Launches Vietnam Mobile Svc
Story: HONG KONG (Dow Jones)--Hutchison Telecommunications International Ltd. (HTX) said Monday it has launched a nationwide second-generation mobile phone service in Vietnam.   Its Vietnam operation, HT Mobile, also has the capability to provide third-generation mobile services using the Code Division Multiple Access 2000 standard. It has already launched a mobile broadband service in some key Vietnamese cities, company spokeswoman Mickey Shiu said.   HTIL, a telecom operator that focuses on emerging markets, is a unit of Hong Kong tycoon Li Ka-shing's Hutchison Whampoa Ltd. (0013.HK).   HTIL has second-generation mobile-phone operations in Hong Kong, India, Thailand, Israel, Macau, Sri Lanka and Ghana, and 3G operations in Israel and Hong Kong. It also has a fixed-line business in Hong Kong.     -By Ernest Kong, Dow Jones Newswires; 852-2802-7002; ernest.kong@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 04:38 ET (09:38 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: CORRECT: Oger To Sign $4.3B Loan In Several Weeks - CEO
Story: (In an item published at 0911 GMT titled 'Oger To Sign In 2Wks $4.3B Loan For Turk Telecom Buy -CEO', the correct timeframe is "in several weeks", not in "two weeks".)     DUBAI (Zawya Dow Jones)--U.A.E-based Oger Telecom's chief executive confirmed Monday the company will "ink in several weeks" a $4.3-billion loan to finance its 55% acquisition of Turk Telecom.   Paul Doany told Zawya Dow Jones in a phone interview that the loan will be "inked within the coming weeks" and the telecom firm is working on finalizing the loan details.   Oger Telecom in partnership with Telecom Italia in 2005 won a $6.55-billion bid for 55% stake in Turkey's only landline operator.   Reports said Friday Oger, part of the Saudi Oger group that is controlled by the family of the late Lebanese Prime Minister Rafiq Hariri, has mandated ABN Amro, Citigroup, BNP Paribas, Caylon Bank and Fortis Bank as leader arrangers of the debt facility.   But Doany said the list of mandated banks could still change.   "We are still working on the deal and many things may change," he said.   But he added the loan will come through. "It will definitely be used to finance the Turk Telecom acquisition," he said.   Oger's payment for its stake in Turkish operator was agreed over a five-year period in equal installments.   The company paid 20% of the total in cash in 2005, and is due to pay the rest in five equal installments with an interest rate of Libor plus 2.5% points. But the loan would speed up the payment process.   Saudi Oger Group owns 60% of Oger Telecom, while Telecom Italia has a 10% stake in the company. Other investors include Arab Bank and Bank of Sharjah.   Oger Telecom canceled its initial public offering via lead managers ABN Amro and Citigroup in November 2006 as regional stock markets had plummeted in the weeks leading up to pricing.   -By Majdoline Hatoum, Dow Jones Newswires; +9714-223-1134; majdoline.hatoum@dowjones.com   Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 08:17 ET (13:17 GMT)

Headline: Taiwan Bourse Launches Div Index,Non-Fincl/Non-Tech Index
Story: TAIPEI (Dow Jones)--The Taiwan Stock Exchange launched two new indexes Monday, including one that tracks high dividend-paying Taiwan-listed companies and another that tracks Taiwan-listed stocks outside the electronics and financial sectors.   The exchange, the 21th largest in the world by market capitalization, and index provider FTSE Group jointly compiled the Taiwan Dividend Index and the Taiwan Eight Industries Index.   "Of the two indexes, the Taiwan Dividend Index is expected to attract more investors, as they have increasingly focused on steady long-term dividend returns," said Chen Chien-hung, an assistant manager with the exchange's research and development department.   Barro Liao, who manages NT$2.5 billion worth of funds for Prudential Securities Investment Trust Co., said the dividend index will provide a benchmark for conservative investors.   "I am positive...because steady dividend returns are important for investors in Taiwan where interest rates are low," he said.   The Taiwan Dividend Index comprises 30 firms the exchange expects to generate the highest cash dividend yields over the coming year, said Chen.   The exchange will review the 30 index components, selected from the Taiwan Mid-Cap 100 Index and the Taiwan 50 Index, every January and July.   Tung Ho Steel Enterprises Corp. (2006.TW) is the index's biggest stock with a weighting of 6.33%. The index also includes China Steel Corp. (2002.TW) and Chunghwa Telecom Co. (CHT).   Most of the index's components are non-electronics firms, as chip and panel makers typically distribute more share dividends than cash dividends, said Chen.   The Taiwan Eight Industries Index comprises non-electronics and non-financial firms in the Taiwan Mid-Cap 100 Index and the Taiwan 50 Index, the exchange said in a statement.   The eight industries include consumer goods, the service sector, household consumables, telecommunications, oil and natural gas, base materials, the industrial sector, public health and utilities, the statement said.   The index will allow investors to track the performance of non-mainstream sectors to diversify their risks, Chen said.     -By Perris Lee, Dow Jones Newswires; 8862-2502-2557; perris.lee@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 05:41 ET (10:41 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Mexico's Pemex To Invest $276M In Two Natural Gas Plants
Story: MEXICO CITY (Dow Jones)--Mexican state oil monopoly Petroleos Mexicanos, or Pemex, said it will invest $276 million in two new natural gas processing plants to handle production from the Burgos fields of northeastern Mexico.   In a press release Sunday, Pemex said the plants will be built by ICA Fluor, a joint venture of Mexico's Empresas ICA (ICA) and Fluor Corp. (FLR).   The first is expected to go into operation in June 2008 and the other in October 2008. Each will be able to process 200 million cubic feet a day of natural gas, raising the output capacity at the complex near Reynosa to 1.2 billion cubic feet a day.   Increased output at Burgos helped Pemex to raise its natural gas production to record levels in 2006. Pemex produces close to 5.6 billion cubic feet a day of natural gas, with Burgos contributing around 1.35 Bcf/d.   -By Anthony Harrup, Dow Jones Newswires; (5255) 5080 3450, anthony.harrup@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 09:40 ET (14:40 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: FOCUS: UK's Brown Plays Catch-Up On First Visit To India
Story: By Andrew Peaple   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   LONDON (Dow Jones)-Gordon Brown, U.K. chancellor of the exchequer and prime minister-presumptive, makes his first visit to India this week to learn why Britain is missing out on the subcontinent's economic boom.   A recent report by the Department of Trade Industry (DTI) Select Committee, a group of U.K. lawmakers, found that India accounts for only 1.3% of British exports. While E.U. countries are increasing their exports to India by 14% annually, those from the U.K. are growing by just 2% per year.   The committee also found the U.K. has already fallen behind the U.S., Germany, Japan and the Netherlands in the ranks of global investors in India.   Given the close historic and cultural ties between the two countries, dating back to the sixteenth century, many feel the U.K. should be doing better.   "The amount of trade and investment from the U.K. into India should be much higher," says Andy Scott, director of international operations at the Confederation of British Industry. "There should be a natural trading link there giving us as good a chance as any country."   By contrast, Indian companies are investing rapidly in the U.K., exemplified by steel giant Tata's near-GBP6 billion bid for Corus Group PLC (CS.LN) last year, potentially the largest ever overseas acquisition by an Indian company. India became the third largest investor into Britain worldwide in 2005, after the U.S. and Japan.   The U.K.'s trade balance with Indiain both goods and services have swung into deficit in 2005 from surpluses in the early 1990s, with Britain now India's fifth biggest export market. The DTI committee concluded the deficits are likely to widen further, with the bulk of U.K. exports to India now in areas it termed "unsustainable", such as scrap metal and precious stones.    Brown's political opponents say the government has missed an important opportunity, despite the chancellor's constant references to the Indian economic challenge in recent speeches.   "We are behind in the game," says Matthew Hancock, economic adviser to Conservative party shadow chancellor George Osborne. "While Brown has visited China three times in the last two years, this is his first visit to India."   The DTI committee found the lack of a co-ordinated approach between government agencies promoting British business in India was one reason for the deteriorating picture.   But it also criticized the complacentapproach of British businesses to the Indian market, which to date has focused on the cost savings available from outsourcing labor-intensive work.   "Despite our long history of commerce with India, U.K. companies are falling behind their major competitors, perhaps because they tend to see India as a source of low-cost labor rather than an emerging market in its own right," the report concluded   The reportalso found evidence of frustration among Indian companies that British firms often send junior staff to discuss possible joint ventures, in an apparent sign of disrespect and ignorance of the opportunities in India.   "There's been an arrogance in the U.K. approach, yet you underestimate the Indian business community at your peril," says Tim Sleep, director of retail at business services firm Ernst  Young, who visits India for one week in every two months.   Protected Indian business sectors haven't helped.    Financial and professional services companies in particular have been frustrated in their expansion plans. Nowhere is this clearer than in the insurance industry, where Indian law currently restricts foreign companies to operating via a limited 26% stake in domestic firms.   "We believe that limit is anachronistic, and we'll be pressing the chancellor to raise that with the Indian government," says Jonathan French, a spokesman for the Association of British Insurers.   British retailers have also suffered from the Indian requirement for them to work with domestic companies as franchise partners, with even single-brand companies prevented from setting up their own operations.   But Gerard Lyons, economist at Standard Chartered, the U.K. bank with a major Indian operation, says that British companies have been unadventurous in their geographic focus, suffering from 'own-back-yard' syndrome.   In the five years to 2005, 80% of U.K. corporate acquisitions abroad were in Western Europe. U.K. PLC acquisitions in emerging markets such as India, Brazil, Russia and China fell to 2% from 8% of the total over the same period. By contrast, European company acquisitions in these markets rose to 10%  from 7% over 2000-5.   Lack of international perspective is not a problem shared by major Indian companies.   Vineet Nayar, president of business process outsourcing giant HCL Technologies, says U.K. firms have blamed Indian restrictions on business, while failing to position themselves for the opening up of its markets.   "It seems people are finding reasons not to go into India, rather than just going," he says. "You have to be early in the game in India, as it has no choice but to deregulate. Look at the retail sector - (U.S. giant) Walmart is there, so why no British companies?"   By Andrew Peaple, Dow Jones Newswires;+44 207 842 9270;andrew.peaple@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 07:44 ET (12:44 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Did Cost-Cutting Cause BP Blast? Report Not Expected To Say
Story: By John M. Biers     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     HOUSTON (Dow Jones)--As BP PLC (BP) girds for the public  release of an independent probe critical of its U.S. refining network, one open question is how the commission will address the debate on the role of cost-cutting in the fatal March 2005 Texas City refinery accident.   In an Oct. 31 news conference, the U.S. Chemical Safety and Hazard Investigations Board blamed the calamity on BP budget cuts, a finding that endorsed what plaintiffs' attorneys had been saying for months. But BP rejected the CSB finding, echoing outgoing Chief Executive John Browne, who said on Oct. 24 of Texas City that "this is not do with costs."   Though ordered to assess the "effectiveness" of BP's "corporate oversight of safety management," the Baker charter urges the panel to "avoid duplicating" the CSB's work and said the panel "should not seek to affix blame or apportion responsibility for any past event."    But even if the report doesn't directly address cost-cutting in Texas City, Baker and his fellow commissioners could be queried on the broader issue of corporate policy on spending during a news conference Tuesday in Houston. The report follows a series of problems at BP's U.S. division that include major oil spills in Alaska and a federal crackdown on its energy trading practices as anti-competitive. BP has generally resisted suggestions that it suffers from systemic corporate problems.   The report focuses on "systemic" problems within BP's refining network, concluding that an over-emphasis on recordable safety incidents, such as fatalties, distracted from looming process safety challenges, according to a person who has received the report. While the report praises changes at BP's refinery since Texas City, it says a more substantial commitment is still needed.   The report follows the committee's charter and does not focus on cost-cutting, this person said.   BP America Chairman and President Bob Malone scheduled a a news conference in Houston Tuesday to respond to the report. Outgoing CEO Browne will appear via video link from London, according a BP advisory.   Besides the costs issue, other key issues that could be raised include the panel's views of personnel changes and safety improvements at BP since the March 2005 accident; whether BP's problems are company-specific or industry-wide; whether the flaws uncovered have significance in some of BP's other well-publicized travails in Alaska and its U.S. trading unit; and how vulnerable BP's refinery network is to further accidents.       Limited Scope In Prior Review     BP appointed Baker in October 2005 to lead the commission in response to an urgent CSB recommendation for a high-level assessment after the Texas City disaster, which killed 15 workers and injured over 170. Since that time, BP has been fined by federal or state occupational safety agencies in Washington, Ohio and Indiana after violations at refineries in those states.   BP's December 2005 report on Texas City cited a confluence of management and worker errors in the blast, which occurred after gases spewed from an overfilled refinery unit and ignited, killing workers who were stationed in and around a temporary trailer. The report said Texas City's budget had "steadily increased" for the prior 10 years. But the report faulted anemic worker training and poor commitment to process safety.   "A workplace environment characterized by poor motivation, unclear expectations around supervisory/management behaviors, no clear system of reward and consequences, and high distrust between leadership and the workforce, had developed over a number of years within the site," BP said.   The report, a technical analysis of the calamity, didn' address London's responsibility for the accident. BP has undertaken a separate accountability review of senior management responsibility, but that is not expected to be made public.    The Baker report, an appraisal of BP safety culture at five U.S. refineries, comes on the heels of Friday's surprise announcement that global exploration and production chief Tony Hayward would succeed Browne this summer, more than a year ahead of schedule.   BP shares soared on news of the transition, a move that analysts attributed to the benefits of removing a lame-duck CEO during a difficult time for the company. Given that the market has been primed for weeks about the report, analysts said they don't expect shares to be dramatically affected by even a harsh Baker analysis.   "Although this is anticipated to be a very damning report into the way BP operated its refining operations, we believe that many of the recommendations of the report have been adopted by BP," said London-based analysts at Teather and Greenwood.   The report could add momentum to litigation and various government probes into BP's operations. Brent Coon, a plaintiffs attorney who has led the Texas City litigation against BP, plans to meet with staff from the Justice Department and the Environmental Protection Agency Tuesday to discuss an ongoing criminal probe into the accident, Coon said.   "We've been talking to them on a regular basis," Coon said of his dealings with government investigators. Bad weather postponed a Galveston hearing on the Texas City civil litigation that had also been scheduled for Tuesday morning. BP has allotted $1.6 billion in reserves for Texas City litigation.   Coon, who still has more than 150 Texas City cases pending, said the Baker report would have a limited impact at this stage of the litigation.       'The Company Is Going To Pay Up.'     Harlan Platt, a business professor at Northeastern University who has written extensively on corporate turnarounds, said the transition atop the company sets the stage for BP to move quickly to resolve outstanding litigation and government probes. "The company is going to pay up," he said. "This thing simply plays out with BP making payments in the hundreds of millions, if not billions, to put the problems behind them."   Platt described the move to speed the Browne-Hayward transition as a "watershed" event for the company, given Browne's dominating hand with the company and its Board of Directors. Pointing to stock market data over the last six months, Platt said BP has underperformed peers like Chevron Corp (CVX) and Exxon Mobil Corp. (XOM) by more than 20%. Given that discount, Platt, who owns no shares of BP, said he expects BP to be a hot stock in the coming months.   "BP has been cleansed by the public exposure of its problems," Platt said. "There are no more skeletons."     -By John M. Biers, Dow Jones Newswires; 713-547-9214; john.biers@dowjones.com     (Jessica Resnick-Ault in Houston and James Herron in London contributed to this report.)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 16:14 ET (21:14 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : China Netcom Disposes of Telecommunications Assets in Guangdong and Shanghai
Story: BEIJING--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   China Netcom Group Corporation (Hong Kong) Limited ("China Netcom" or the "Company") (HKSE: 0906; NYSE: CN) announced that China Netcom (Group) Company Limited ('CNC China'), a direct wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company, entered into a conditional Asset Transfer Agreement (the 'Transfer Agreement') on January 15, 2007, pursuant to which CNC China agreed to dispose of its telecommunications assets, liabilities and business operations in Guangdong Province and Shanghai Municipality of the PRC (the 'Target Assets') to China Network Communications Group Corporation (the 'Parent Company'). The completion of the disposal is expected to take place before the end of February 2007.     According to the Transfer Agreement, the cash consideration of the disposal is RMB3,500 million. The Parent Company will pay an initial amount of RMB1,050 million (equivalent to 30% of the consideration) in cash the first business day following the completion of the disposal and will pay the remaining RMB2,450 million (equivalent to 70% of the consideration) in cash within 30 days after completion of the disposal. In addition, the Parent Company will assume the debt of CNC China in the aggregate principal amount of RMB3,000 million upon completion of the disposal. Furthermore, the Parent Company has granted CNC China a first right under the Transfer Agreement to acquire the abovementioned assets, liabilities and business operations if the Parent Company decides to dispose of them in the future at terms equal to or no less favourable than those offered by the Parent Company to other parties.     Completion of the disposal is conditional on the passing of an ordinary resolution by independent shareholders and the receipt of approvals or consents from the relevant PRC authorities.     Regarding the consideration of the disposal of the Target Assets, Mr. Zuo Xunsheng, China Netcom's CEO, commented, "The consideration of the disposal of the Target Assets was determined on various factors, including the quality of the assets being sold, their growth prospects, earnings potential and competitive advantages in their respective markets, as well as by reference to other financial and operational indicators. As a result, the management believes that the terms of the Asset Transfer Agreement are fair and reasonable and in the interests of the Company and its shareholders."     Mr. Zhang Chunjiang, Chairman of China Netcom, concluded, "China Netcom has extensive network resources and higher profitability in the northern service region. After the sale of the Guangdong and Shanghai assets, we will be well-positioned to concentrate our resources in the northern service region. The Board believes that the disposal will enable us to take better advantage of the growth opportunities and reinforce our competitiveness in terms of operations and services in our northern service region. We are confident that this will result in better financial results in the future."       About China Netcom:     China Netcom is a leading fixed-line telecommunications operator in China. Its northern service region in China consists of Beijing Municipality, Tianjin Municipality, Hebei Province, Henan Province, Shandong Province, Liaoning Province, Heilongjiang Province, Jilin Province, Neimenggu Autonomous Region and Shanxi Province. In these regions, the Company is a dominant provider of fixed-line telephone services, broadband and other Internet-related services, as well as business and data communications services. Its southern service region in China consists of Shanghai Municipality and Guangdong Province in which it focuses on providing telecommunications services to enterprises and high usage residential customers in selected densely populated areas. After this disposal, Shanghai Municipality and Guangdong Province will not be included in the Company's service region.       Disclaimer     This press release includes "forward-looking statements". All statements, other than statements of historical facts, that address activities, events or developments that China Netcom expects or anticipates will or may occur in the future (including but not limited to projections, targets, estimates and business plans) are forward-looking statements. China Netcom's actual results or developments may differ materially from those indicated by these forward-looking statements as a result of various factors and uncertainties, including but not limited to the level of demand for telecommunications services; competitive forces in more liberalised markets; the effects of tariff reduction initiatives; changes in the regulatory policies and other risks and factors beyond China Netcom's control. In addition, China Netcom makes the forward-looking statements referred to herein as of today and undertakes no obligation to update these statements. Headline: UPDATE: ASOS Xmas Sales +80%, FY Pft Inline With Views
Story: By Lilly Vitorovich   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--Online clothing and accessories retailer ASOS PLC (ASC.LN) Monday reported an 80% jump in Christmas sales over the four weeks to Dec. 10 and, with trading in line with internal forecasts, expects annual profit before tax to match market expectations.   Over November and December, ASOS said it sold 710,000 items via 285,000 orders.   Chief Executive Nick Robertson said the company "had a great Christmas."   "The fact that we continue to outperform the online market in general is testament to our buyers, our proposition, and the enduring appeal of ASOS amongst our core customer base," he said in a statement.   Comparative figures for Dec. 11 to Jan. 15 don't exist due to the complete closure of operations following the Buncefield fuel depot explosion on Dec. 11, 2005, according to ASOS.   ASOS is an internet retail and market services company, which was established in June 2000 and admitted to London's Alternative Investment Market or AIM in October 2001. Its principal business is ASOS.com, an online fashion and beauty retailer.   The company had more than 1.2 million registered users as at Jan. 12, and offers more 4,000 products across womenswear, menswear, footwear, accessories, jewelry and beauty.   ASOS share closed at 122 pence Friday.     Company Web site: http://www.asos.com     -By Lilly Vitorovich, Dow Jones Newswires; 44-0-207 842 9290; lilly.vitorovich@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 02:22 ET (07:22 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : U.S. Navy Awards General Dynamics $10 Million for Alteration Work on USS Texas
Story: GROTON, Conn., Jan. 15 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- The U.S. Navy has awarded General Dynamics Electric Boat a $9.7 million contract modification to incorporate ship alterations on USS Texas (SSN-775), the second Virginia-class attack submarine.  Electric Boat is a wholly owned subsidiary of General Dynamics (NYSE: GD).     The work will be performed at Electric Boat's shipyard here during the post-shakedown availability for Texas and is scheduled to be completed by February 2008.     General Dynamics, headquartered in Falls Church, Va., employs approximately 81,100 people worldwide and expects 2006 revenues of approximately $24 billion.  The company is a market leader in mission-critical information systems and technologies; land and expeditionary combat systems, armaments and munitions; shipbuilding and marine systems; and business aviation. More information about the company is available online at http://www.generaldynamics.com.    SOURCE  General Dynamics Electric Boat       /CONTACT: Robert A. Headline: : Hartco Declares Monthly Distribution>HCI.UN.T
Story: MONTREAL, QUEBEC--(CCNMatthews - Jan. 15, 2007) - Hartco Income Fund (TSX:HCI.UN) (the "Fund") announced a cash distribution for the month of January of $0.05 per unit. The distribution will be payable on February 15, 2007 to unitholders of record at the close of business on January 31, 2007.    Hartco Income Fund's policy is to pay monthly distributions on or about the fifteenth day of each month to unitholders of record on the last day of the preceding month.    Holders of units who are non-residents of Canada will be subject to withholding taxes in respect of any distributions made by Hartco Income Fund.    Fund Profile    Hartco Income Fund has been a leader in the Canadian information technology business for more than thirty years. Through its operating divisions, which together include more than 90 commercial and retail locations across Canada, Montreal-based Hartco delivers digital technology products and services to consumers of every age and to private and public sector organizations of every size.    Forward-Looking Statements    This news release contains forward-looking information. Except for historical information contained herein, the statements in this document are forward-looking. Forward-looking statements involve known and unknown risks and uncertainties, which may cause actual results in future periods to differ materially from forecasted results. Those risks include, among others, changes in customer demand for information technology products or services, changes in supplier pricing actions or terms, customer orders, pricing actions by competitors, changes in laws and regulations and general changes in economic conditions. Headline: : Chartwell REIT Announces January 2007 Distribution>CSH.UN.T
Story: MISSISSAUGA, ONTARIO--(CCNMatthews - Jan. 15, 2007) - Chartwell Seniors Housing Real Estate Investment Trust (TSX:CSH.UN) ("Chartwell REIT") announced today a cash distribution of $0.08875 per Trust Unit for the month of January, 2007. The cash distribution will be payable on February 15, 2007 to Unitholders of record on January 31, 2007.    Unitholders can participate in Chartwell's Unitholder Distribution Reinvestment Plan (DRIP). Eligible investors registered in the DRIP will have their monthly cash distributions used to purchase Trust Units, and will also receive bonus Units equal to 3% of their monthly cash distributions. The Plan offers Unitholders the opportunity to steadily increase their ownership in Chartwell REIT without incurring any commissions or brokerage fees. Complete details of the DRIP are available on Chartwell REIT's website at www.chartwellreit.ca or from a Unitholder's investment advisor.    Chartwell REIT is a growth-oriented investment trust owning and managing a complete spectrum of seniors housing properties. It is currently the largest participant in the Canadian seniors housing business with a growing presence in the United States. Chartwell will capitalize on the strong demographic trends present in its markets to grow internally and through accretive acquisitions. Chartwell REIT also has an exclusive option to purchase stabilized facilities from Spectrum Seniors Housing Development LP, Canada's largest and fastest growing seniors housing development company.    Certain statements contained in this news release may include forward-looking information with respect to Chartwell Seniors Housing Real Estate Investment Trust's operations and future financial results. Such statements are based on current expectations, are subject to a number of uncertainties and risks, and actual results may differ materially from those contained in such statements. These uncertainties and risks include, but are not limited to, availability of resources, competitive pressures, changes in market activity and regulatory requirements. Further information can be found in the disclosure documents filed by Chartwell Seniors Housing Real Estate Investment Trust with the securities regulatory authorities, available at www.sedar.com.
