Headline: : Exclusive Agreement Offers Manulife Group Pension Clients Insights From Renowned UCLA Behavioural Finance Expert>MFC
Story: WATERLOO, ON, Jan. 15 /CNW/ - Manulife Financial has secured an exclusive agreement with behavioural finance expert Dr. Shlomo Benartzi, a professor at University of California, Los Angeles, to provide Manulife Canadian group pension clients with custom newsletters and quarterly advice on retirement savings trends.    A leader in this emerging field, Dr. Benartzi and his academic associates conduct research on behaviour of retirement savings plan participants. Study results are already being used to help U.S.-based plan sponsors.    Dr. Benartzi serves as Co-Chair of the Interdisciplinary Group on Behavioral Decision Making at UCLA. He is a pioneer in studying participant behaviour in retirement savings plans, including development of Save More Tomorrow(TM) - a behavioural model designed to help participants increase their savings rates gradually over time.    "I'm pleased to bring this innovative service to our Canadian group pension customers," says Paul Lorentz, Senior Vice President of Manulife's Group Savings and Retirements Solutions business. "Dr. Benartzi's research offers plan sponsors a perspective that may help them better understand member behaviour, and then apply that knowledge to the management of their plans."    Manulife's group retirement clients will receive custom newsletters featuring Dr. Benartzi's research findings on participant activity. In addition, they can participate in discussions with Dr. Benartzi during quarterly webinars.    The exclusive agreement with Dr. Benartzi delivers another innovative resource to Manulife customers.    "We are always looking for opportunities to provide expertise and resources that help our clients manage their retirement savings plans with increasing confidence," says Mr. Lorentz. "Dr. Benartzi's work is breaking important new ground and we're very pleased to deliver this to our clients so they can capitalize on findings of Dr. Benartzi and his associates."    About Manulife Financial    Manulife Financial is a leading Canadian-based financial services group serving millions of customers in 19 countries and territories worldwide. Operating as Manulife Financial in Canada and Asia, and primarily through John Hancock in the United States, the Company offers clients a diverse range of financial protection products and wealth management services through its extensive network of employees, agents and distribution partners. Funds under management by Manulife Financial and its subsidiaries were Cdn$381 billion (US$341 billion) as at September 30, 2006.    Manulife Financial Corporation trades as 'MFC' on the TSX, NYSE and PSE, and under '0945' on the SEHK. Manulife Financial can be found on the Internet at www.manulife.com.             /CONTACT: Media Contact: Tom Nunn, Manulife Financial, (519) 594-8578, tom_nunn@manulife.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 10:03 ET (15:03 GMT)

Headline: Vedanta Resources 3Q Rev $1.76B, Up 80.6%
Story: Unaudited Results for the Third Quarter and Nine Months Ended Dec. 31, 2006    Revenues and EBITDA of $1,760m and $724m, up 81% and 174%, respectively    Record EBITDA of over $2bn in the nine months ended Dec. 31, 2006    New BALCO smelter achieves production at full capacity levels       Aluminium, zinc and copper production in India significantly higher than in preceding quarter and in the corresponding period last year   Edited Press Release     LONDON (Dow Jones)--Vedanta Resources said Monday that third quarter revenues were $1,760.4 million, up 80.6% compared to the corresponding quarter last year, driven by higher volumes and better price realisations.   EBITDA achieved a record high of $724.3 million in Q3 and $2,014.8 million in the nine months ended Dec. 31, 2006, representing an increase of 173.7% quarter-on-quarter and 235.2% year-to date, the company said.   Production across all metals in India was significantly higher than the preceding quarter and in the corresponding prior quarter mainly because of contribution from newly commissioned projects.   Production at the new Korba II smelter has fully stabilised and reached its full capacity, after the temporary disruption of pots in May last year due to the tripping of the power plant.   The plant produced over 61,000 tonnes of cast metal this quarter compared to 44,000 tonnes in the immediately preceding quarter, equivalent to an annual capacity of 245,000tpa.   The existing smelters at BALCO and MALCO produced about 37,000 tonnes this quarter, in line with their rated capacity.   The captive power plant at Korba continues to operate satisfactorily and has achieved its highest level of generation in the current quarter, which had a positive impact on costs, the company said.   Q3 revenues were $279.7 million as compared with $117.0 million in the corresponding period last year on account of higher volumes and better price realisations. The company said it continues to develop the export market, mainly in South East Asia and the Middle East, supported by additional volumes from the new smelter.   Q3 EBITDA was $128.8 million, an increase of 301.2% over the corresponding prior quarter.   Unit cash costs in both plants of BALCO have improved over the immediately preceding quarter mainly due to higher production volumes and reduced power costs, which offset increases in other input costs. The decline in global alumina prices has started having a positive impact on costs.   Vedanta has obtained the LME registration for the aluminium ingots of the new Korba smelter under the brand "BHARATAL".   Copper cathode production in India and Australia during the quarter was the highest ever at 86,000 tonnes an increase of 6,000 tonnes from the immediately preceding quarter mainly due to the debottlenecking initiatives at the Tuticorin smelter, which has increased capacity to 400,000 tpa.   Production is being steadily ramped up and the company expects to realise rated capacity volumes in the fourth quarter. Mined metal production at its Australian mines of about 7,000 tonnes is almost at the same level as the corresponding prior period.   Q3 revenues were $717.5 million as compared with $448.0 million in the corresponding prior period, primarily due to higher volumes and higher metal prices.   Q3 EBITDA was $92.4 million as compared with $56.9 million in the corresponding prior quarter, an increase of 62.4% due to higher volumes, improved TCRC realisation and higher LME prices.   As reported earlier, the reduction in TCRC realisations has started having a negative impact on EBITDA due to global softening and the company expects further reduction in TCRCs in the fourth quarter   The Indian copper operations have been awarded the "Best performance award in non-ferrous metals" by the Indian Institute of Metals. It has also won the Corporate Silver Award for Manufacturing Excellence in the Metals Category (Large Facilities) at the India Manufacturing Excellence Awards 2006 awarded by Frost & Sullivan.   In Zambia, KCM produced 35,000 tonnes of copper cathode in the quarter as compared with 31,000 tonnes in the immediately preceding quarter but lower than our expectations.   Cathode production at the leaching plant and mining production from Nchanga were affected by unforeseen environmental issues.   While these issues have now been satisfactorily resolved, steady and cautious steps are now being taken to bring the leaching plant back to its normal levels of production.   Several debottlenecking measures at the Nkana smelter have enabled us to achieve a record anode production of about 12,000 tonnes in December last year, the company said.   Q3 revenues were $211.4 million as compared with $188.1 million in the corresponding prior quarter primarily due to higher prices. Q3 EBITDA was $79.4 million as compared with $56.8 million, an increase of 39.8%.   Operating costs are still high primarily due to lower mine output and its consequent impact on production volumes, together with higher maintenance costs incurred due to the unforeseen shutdown.   The production of mined metal of 128,000 tonnes in Q3 was maintained at the levels achieved in the corresponding prior period and higher than that of the immediately preceding quarter by 4,000 tonnes.   Production of refined zinc at 93,000 tonnes was up from 79,000 tonnes in the preceding quarter an increase of 17.7% and was significantly higher than the corresponding prior quarter by 24,000 tonnes an increase of 34.8%.   Volumes have increased mainly from the ramping up of the new hydro smelter and going forward in the fourth quarter, Vedanta expects to produce close to its rated capacity of 400,000 tpa.   While production levels have improved significantly over the immediately preceding quarter, sales of refined zinc have remained at similar levels compared with Q2, primarily due to a liquidation of Q1 inventories in Q2, the company said.   In view of better metal production during the current quarter, sale of zinc concentrate was restricted to 38,000 dry metric tonnes. Vedanta sold 29,000 dry metric tonnes of lead concentrate.   Revenue was $549.6 million as compared with $202.5 million in the corresponding quarter last year, primarily due to higher volumes from the new plant and higher metal prices.   EBITDA was $425.2 million as compared with $117.7 million, an increase of 261.3% over the corresponding quarter last year primarily due to higher volumes and higher prices.   The National Energy Conservation Award, awarded by the Ministry of Power, Government of India, in the mineral sector has been awarded to one of the zinc mines.   The alumina refinery at Lanjigarh is in the final commissioning stage and is expected to be commissioned by March 2007.   The Central Ministry of Environment and Forests have received reports from its various sub-committees and is expected to give its recommendations shortly to the Supreme Court on the issue of environmental clearances for developing the Lanjigarh bauxite deposits.   The company is hopeful of a positive resolution of this matter in the near future.   The debottlenecking project of the Tuticorin smelter to increase its capacity from 300,000 tpa to 400,000 tpa has been completed and the smelter is steadily ramping up. The company expects to realise full volumes from the smelter in the fourth quarter.   Progress on both the Konkola Deep Mining Project and the 250,000 tpa Nchanga smelter project is satisfactory and are on course for completion as scheduled. All major orders have been placed, basic engineering has been completed and site work is progressing in full swing.   Work on the new 170,000 tpa zinc smelter at Chanderiya is progressing well with orders for all major lead items placed and construction activity is in full swing.   The project is on track and is expected to be completed by early 2008.   Vedanta has also initiated a debottlenecking project at the Chanderiya and Debari zinc smelters to enhance their capacity by an additional 88,000 tpa. This project is estimated to cost $169 million and is scheduled for completion by mid 2008.   The greenfield 500,000 tpa smelter at Jharsuguda is progressing well with all major orders placed and is on schedule for completion as announced.   Preliminary work on the new $1.9bn greenfield 2400 MW integrated power project at Jharsuguda has recently commenced. The progress on the project is satisfactory and a major EPC order for the construction of the power plant has been placed.  Hindustan Zinc Limited is investing in a Wind Power project with a capacity of 75 MW at a cost of $87 million. Orders have been placed for major equipment. The project will be progressively commissioned towards end of this calendar year.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 02:20 ET (07:20 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: SmartMoney(2/1) Street Smart: Beverage Bottlers Lose Fizz
Story: (From SMARTMONEY)     By Evelyn Ellison Twitchell   THERE'S A saying on Wall Street: "Buy the rumor; sell the news." But not all rumors are worth paying for. Shares of beverage bottlers have gotten support from talk that Coca-Cola Co. might acquire its largest bottler, Coca-Cola Enterprises (CCE, $21). Yet takeover speculation might not be enough to sustain a group that is facing strong headwinds this year.   High commodity prices are likely to be a double whammy for bottlers in 2007. Aluminum prices have been rising as demand has increased globally. Bottlers, which use the metal in soda cans, hedge against price swings but still could face double-digit cost increases as hedging  contracts expire. At the same time, the cost of high-fructose corn syrup, which is used to sweeten beverages, could be up 15 percent or more as corn is increasingly used to make ethanol.   Bottlers buy the high-fructose corn syrup and add it to the concentrate they purchase from the soda makers. "There's a risk of commodity inflation hurting the bottom line," says Christine Farkas, an analyst at Merrill Lynch.   What's more, U.S. consumers just aren't bubbling over for soda anymore, as bottled water and sports drinks have gained popularity. The number of carbonated beverages sold in North America will likely fall 1 to 2 percent in the next year, estimates Goldman Sachs.   All this could take a bite out of earnings at Coca-Cola Enterprises, Pepsi Bottling Group (PBG, $32), PepsiAmericas (PAS, $21) and private-label bottler Cott Corp. (COT, $14). Most bottlers' shares trade at about 15 times expected 2007 earnings -- in line with the Standard & Poor's 500 index. But the stocks have traded at a 10 to 15 percent discount to the S&P during uncertain times in the past.   True, Coca-Cola Enterprises would fetch a premium if Coca-Cola Co. decided to buy it. But a deal is iffy at best; historically, both Coca-Cola Co. and PepsiCo have avoided the capital-intensive bottling business because it's much less profitable than simply making the concentrate syrup used in soft drinks. "It would be a burden on a company that's trying to accelerate growth," says Mark Swartzberg, an analyst at Stifel Nicolaus. Short of a merger, bottling stocks could leave investors, well, flat.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 06:00 ET (11:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Ollie's Bargain Outlet Implements NOVA's Electronic Check Service>USB
Story: ATLANTA--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   NOVA Information Systems (NOVA), a wholly owned subsidiary of U.S. Bancorp (NYSE:USB), today announced that Ollie's Bargain Outlet, Inc. ("Ollie's"), Harrisburg, PA., has implemented NOVA's Electronic Check Service in its 48 stores. ECS combines the benefits of real-time check authorization and risk mitigation services with back-office image uploads, resulting in improved cash flow and reduced risk.     Ollie's is able to take advantage of direct DDA access for check processing utilizing existing MICR technology at their point of sale, and upload the check images at the end of the day via a high-speed check imaging device located in their backroom cash office.     "NOVA's ECS service has helped streamline our check handling and reconciliation process," said John Swygert, chief financial officer, Ollie's. "The implementation went smoothly, and we are already seeing the benefits of electronic check processing."     "Our ECS solution eliminates the need to install expensive check-imaging devices in every lane," said Stuart C. Harvey, Jr., president, NOVA. "Our unique combination of point-of-purchase processing and risk decisioning with back-office image uploads provides a strong return on investment for retailers like Ollie's."     NOVA's ECS solution is available in a choice of service levels, including guarantee, verification, verification with collections, and conversion only. NOVA automatically routes checks through the appropriate processing rail: Direct DDA, the ACH or the Check 21 processing network. NOVA's solution employs cash office imaging (COI) technology designed to efficiently manage the high speed delivery of check images without the need for monetary back office reconciliation to point-of-sale activity. Retailers use existing in-lane MICR technology to perform real-time financial authorizations, mitigating check acceptance risk and improving cash flow; a high-speed imaging device uploads batches of checks at the end of the day, joining the check image with the original transaction detail. Most retailers will experience same-day settlement and next-day availability of funds.       About Ollie's     Ollie's Bargain Outlet is the Mid-Atlantic's largest retailer of closeout, surplus and salvage merchandise. The privately-held company was founded in 1982 and currently operates 48 stores in Pennsylvania, Maryland, Delaware, Ohio, Virginia, and West Virginia. For more information, visit www.olliesbargainoutlet.com.       About NOVA     NOVA Information Systems, a leader in the payment processing industry is a wholly owned subsidiary of U.S. Bancorp (NYSE:USB). Combined, NOVA and its affiliates First Horizon Merchant Services, euroConex and Elan provide global merchant processing services to financial institutions and clients in the United States, Canada, and Europe. NOVA offers integrated payment processing services to more than 1,000,000 merchants worldwide. For more information, visit www.novainfo.com.        CONTACT: NOVA Information Systems               Michelle Graff, 678-731-5064               michelle.graff@novainfo.com        SOURCE: NOVA Information Systems  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 08:09 ET (13:09 GMT)

Headline: BNP Paribas Expands Credit Research Team
Story: LONDON (Dow Jones)--BNP Paribas has appointed Roger Appleyard as a senior analyst to its credit research team, covering telecommunications, media and technology, effective immediately, the bank said Monday.   Appleyard joins BNP Paribas from ABN AMRO, where he spent six years, most recently as global head of credit research, since June 2004.   In his new role Appleyard will cover companies within the TMT sector in the investment-grade and high-yield arena.   Appleyard is based in London and reports to Marc Watton, head of credit research.     -By Peppi Kiviniemi, Dow Jones Newswires; 44 20 7842 9496; peppi.kiviniemi@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 05:16 ET (10:16 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UK PRESS: EMI Considering Debt Restructure
Story: LONDON (Dow Jones)--EMI Group PLC (EMI.LN) is considering restructuring its debt, loading more borrowings on to its music publishing division, in a move that could make the U.K. music company less vulnerable to a takeover by private equity, the Financial Times reports Monday.   The new financial structure, which follows last week's management shake-up and profit warning, would also make it easier to separate the music publishing and recorded music divisions in any future merger with Warner Music of the U.S., says the report citing a person close to EMI.   EMI's shares have been supported by hopes that bidders could renew their interest, but the restructuring, coming a month after talks with private equity group Permira collapsed, was in part a "put up or shut up to private equity", the reports says, quoting one person close to EMI.   Newspaper Web site: http://www.ft.com   -London Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; +44 (0)20 7842 9320     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 01:39 ET (06:39 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Scania's 3 Largest Owners Plan Talks On Friendly Deal
Story: STOCKHOLM (Dow Jones)--The chairmen of Swedish truck maker Scania AB's (SCV-A.SK) three largest shareholders are planning to start talks to thrash out a new deal that would be mutually beneficial to all three, Scania board member and head of Scania's metal workers union, IF Metal, Kjell Wallin told Dow Jones Newswires Monday.   "This was decided at a board meeting before Christmas that they should have a meeting and that they should talk," Kjell Wallin told Dow Jones Newswires.   He said he couldn't confirm if the meeting would take place Monday, but said the gathering of MAN AG's (MAN.XE) Ekkehard Schulz, Volkswagen AG's (VLKAY) Ferdinand Piech, and Investor AB's (INVE-B.SK) Jacob Wallenberg, was to work on a new plan that could be implemented after MAN's current hostile EUR10.3 billion bid for Scania expires Jan. 31.   Both Scania itself and Investor, the second-largest shareholder in Scania after VW, have repeatedly rejected the offer, although Investor has said it remains open to the idea of a combination of some type.   VW last week likewise rejected MAN's hostile approach, saying it wanted all parties to work towards a friendly deal.   "I won't comment on reports (of Investor meeting with MAN and VW), but we have said we are open to discuss ways of achieving a combination that is beneficial to all, and that we have established contacts with all parties," said Fredrik Lindgren, Investor's spokesman.   Scania wasn't immediately available for comment. VW declined to comment.   Company Web site: http://www.scania.com   -By Adam Ewing, Dow Jones Newswires; +46 8 545 130 95; adam.ewing@dowjones.com   (Michael Brendel in Hamburg contributed to this article.)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 03:54 ET (08:54 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Allied Waste Announces Hiring of James P. Zeumer to Lead Its Expanded Corporate Communications Efforts
Story: PHOENIX, Jan. 15 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Allied Waste Industries, Inc. (NYSE: AW), a leading waste services company, announced today the hiring of James P. Zeumer, as Senior Vice President, Public Affairs, Communications & Investor Relations.  Mike Burnett, who had previously overseen these activities, continues with the company in his primary role as Senior Vice President, Treasurer.     Mr. Zeumer brings more than 20 years of broad financial and corporate communications experience, most recently serving for the past nine years as Vice President of Investor and Corporate Communications for Pulte Homes, Inc. Prior to Pulte Homes, Mr. Zeumer held roles of increasing responsibility with Ply Gem Industries, ICF Kaiser Engineers and Alcide Corporation.     "Jim brings important skills in support of our goal to increase visibility and positive awareness among key stakeholders including our customers, our investors and our employees," said Pete Hathaway, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer.  "This addition to our senior management team will allow Mike Burnett to focus his full time efforts on our treasury and risk management functions."     Mr. Zeumer earned his Bachelor of Science in Marketing from the University of Connecticut and his MBA in Finance from George Washington University.  Mr. Zeumer will office out of the new Allied Waste headquarters and Operations Support Center in Phoenix, AZ.     Ed Evans, Executive Vice President and Chief Personnel Officer added, "Jim will have a significant impact on increasing Allied's brand recognition and support the Company's efforts as a responsible corporate leader in the communities we serve across the nation."        About Allied Waste Industries     Allied Waste Industries, Inc., a leading waste services company, provides collection, recycling and disposal services to residential, commercial and industrial customers in the United States.  As of September 30, 2006, the Company operated a network of 299 collection companies, 161 transfer stations, 169 active landfills and 56 recycling facilities in 37 states and Puerto Rico.    SOURCE  Allied Waste Industries, Inc.       /CONTACT: James P. Zeumer, Senior Vice President, Public Affairs, Communications & Investor Relations of Allied Waste Industries, Inc., +1-480-627-2785     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 14:51 ET (19:51 GMT)

Headline: Lundin Mining At Sector Perform: Natl Bk Confident In Co.
Story: TORONTO (Dow Jones)--National Bank Financial has started coverage of Lundin Mining Corp. (LUN.T) at sector perform with a C$43.50 target price, noting that it has "confidence in the management team and their ability to grow the company and create shareholder value."   Lundin, a base-metals company, is trading down 55 Canadian cents at C$39.25 in Toronto.   Analyst Ian Howat said in a research report he estimates 2007 share earnings of US$6.75, 2008 share earnings of US$4.60 and 2009 share earnings of US$3.65.   Howat said the Zinkgruvan Mine in Sweden, Glamoy Mine in Ireland, Neves-Corvo in Portugal, the Aljustreal Mine being developed in Portugal and the 49%-owned Ozernoe development in Russia all provide excellent current zinc exposure and growing exposure in the future.   Company zinc production should increase to 270,000 tons a year in 2009 from 185,000 tons in 2006 on a pro forma basis, and that's before any contribution from Ozernoe's potential production of 200,000 tons a year in 2011, Howat said, adding that Lundin's share would be 147,000 tons.   Howat doesn't own any Lundin shares and National Bank hasn't had an investment-banking relationship with Lundin within the past 12 months.   Company Web Site: http://www.lundinmining.com     -Wendy Tsau; 416-306-2100; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 14:48 ET (19:48 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Countrywide Adjourns EGM On 3i Buyout Vote - 2
Story: The success of 3i's buyout has hung in the balance for several weeks as maneuvering by numerous hedge funds has created uncertainty over the value of the deal.   The 3i offer for the U.K.'s largest real estate agency is valued at around GBP960 million and consists of 490 pence cash and 0.16518 shares in Rightmove PLC (RMV.LN) for every Countrywide share. Countrywide, a property agency and financial services group, holds a 21.5% stake in Rightmove, a property Web site operator.   The price is seen as too low by some of the hedge funds who say that it fails to take account of the booming property market. San Francisco-based Artisan Partners and Europe's Boussard & Gavaudan Asset Management have said they will vote against the deal as has Standard Life PLC (SL.LN).   Other hedge funds continued taking positions late into Friday. In a regulatory filing Monday U.S. Seneca Capital Management disclosed a 1.39% holding which it bought Friday while Polygon Investment Partners LLP, one of Countrywide's largest shareholders, on Thursday cut its stake to 5.88% of the company's capital.   Also Friday activist U.S. hedge fund JANA Partners LLC revealed it more than doubled its holding in Countrywide on holding 9.4 million shares, or 5.5% of Countrywide's equity.   It is unclear how these funds intend to vote on the takeover.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 06:14 ET (11:14 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Brasil Telecom, TIM Shares Rise On Merger Proposal Report
Story: SAO PAULO (Dow Jones)--Shares in Brazilian telecom companies TIM Participacoes (TSU) and Brasil Telecom Participacoes (BRTP4.BR) rose sharply Monday amid reports of a merger deal.   Preferred shares in Brasil Telecom rose 5.0% to 17.95 Brazilian reals ($8.35) in early afternoon trade, while shares in TIM, Brazil's No. 2 wireless company owned by Telecom Italia (TI), rose 0.9% to BRL6.85 following a report in the local Folha de S. Paulo newspaper that the Italian firm was proposing a merger.   Both stocks outshot the local Ibovespa stock index, which rose 0.4% on the Sao Paulo stock exchange.   The report is just the latest in a string of stories about a possible change in control at TIM ever since Telecom Italia had reported it had received offers last year.   According to the Folha de S. Paulo, the Italiancompany proposed the purchase of Brasil Telecom, which would then be integrated into TIM.   Telecom Italia has a 38% stake in Solpart, which is the holding company for Brasil Telecom. The controllers of the company, Citigroup (C) and a group of Brazilian pension funds have both expressed an interest in selling out.   Neither TIM nor Brasil Telecom would comment on the report.   Any such deal would break existing telecom regulations and would need to be negotiated with Brazilian telecom regulators.     -By Alastair Stewart; Dow Jones Newswires; 5511 3145-1479; alastair.stewart@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 12:25 ET (17:25 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Sino-Forest Says Macquarie Won't Submit Proposal >TRE.T
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   Sino-Forest Corp. (TRE.T) said Macquarie (Hong Kong) Ltd. has informed Sino-Forest that it doesn't intend to submit a proposal to Sino-Forest.   Sino-Forest said it believes the Macquarie letter also represents the intention of CVC Asia Pacific Ltd.   As reported, on Friday Sino-Forest said it had been approached by various parties with respect to the possible investment in, or acquisition of, Sino-Forest. One of those parties was a consortium comprising CVC Asia Pacific and Macquarie Bank Ltd.   Sino-Forest operates commercial forestry plantations in China.   -Carolyn King; 416-306-2100; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 09:23 ET (14:23 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE: Microsoft Announces Payment Systems For Retailers
Story: (Updates with Ballmer quote)     NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--Microsoft Corp. (MSFT) announced Monday at the National Retail Federation Annual Convention & Expo the release of Microsoft Dynamics-Point of Sale 2.0 and of Microsoft Dynamics Retail Management System 2.0, which were created for payment structure in the retail market.   The software maker also announced a complete PC-based point-of-sale and integrated payments system with First Data Corp. (FDC) and Hewlett-Packard Co. (HPQ). The new system can replace payment terminals and dial-up connections with personal computer based point-of-sale products and high-speed Internet connections. It will combine First Data's credit, debit and gift card payment processing capabilities; Microsoft Dynamics-Point of Sale 2.0; and HP's rp5000 retail industry-standard PC. This new integrated package will be offered by First Data, along with its participating alliance partners and independent sales organizations. Purchase and lease options will be available.   Microsoft said in a press release that this will "offer greater value to retailers and their customers."   Microsoft chief executive Steve Ballmer is scheduled to speak at the convention Monday.   Microsoft Dynamics-Point of Sale pricing starts at $799 and is available in the U.S. only. Microsoft Dynamics Retail Management System starts at $1,190 and is available worldwide in English.   Ballmer spoke at the convention about how technology has changed the retailing industry and his view on what is ahead.   He noted that consumers have more information, which gives them more power.   "Changes will accelerate," he said.   He does see smaller retailers taking part more in the technology shift as they can utilize web hosted sites and other capabilities.     -By Carmen Fleetwood, Dow Jones Newswires; 201-938-5216, carmen.fleetwood@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 10:10 ET (15:10 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: GERMAN PRESS:Airbus To Report Market Share Loss
Story: FRANKFURT (Dow Jones)--Airbus is set to unveil figures showing a fall in market share, reports Financial Times Deutschland Monday, without citing its sources.   Airbus' market share, as measured by airplane value, decreased to 40% in 2006 from the 45% reported for 2005, FTD said.   The list value of Airbus planes sold last year stands at $75.1 billion, the paper says, adding that the total number of airplanes ordered decreased to 800 from 1055 in 2006.   Airbus, part of European Aeronautic Defence and Space Co. (5730.FR) is due to announce these figurs Tuesday, FTD reports.   Newspaper Web site: http://www.ftd.de   -Frankfurt Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; 49-69-29725-500.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 02:21 ET (07:21 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Canada New Vehicle Sales Up 3% In Nov. From Oct.
Story: OTTAWA (Dow Jones)--Canada's monthly new motor vehicle sales rose 3.0% in November, reflecting strong demand for passenger cars built in North America, Statistics Canada said.   Vehicle sales are expected to have risen about 5% in December, based on preliminary figures from the auto industry, the agency added.   The market had expected a 2.0% decline in November's sales, which were a seasonally adjusted 140,012, up from a revised 135,958 in October. Sales were 2.2% higher than a year earlier.   Truck sales rose 1.0% in November, to 68,476. This category includes mini-vans, sport-utility vehicles, light and heavy trucks, vans and buses.   Sales of passenger cars rose 5.0% month-on-month to 71,536, as sales North American-made cars were up 8.9%. But sales of overseas-made cars fell 1.8%.   Seasonally adjusted sales for November included:   -Passenger cars, 71,536, up from 68,139 in October;   -Trucks, vans and buses, 68,476, up from 67,819.   Of the passenger cars sold, North American-made models accounted for 47,200, up from 43,349.   Sales of cars imported from overseas totaled 24,336, down from 24,790.   Unadjusted new motor vehicle sales in November were 127,732, up 2.9% from 124,111 a year earlier.   Web Site: http://www.statcan.ca     -John Moritsugu, Dow Jones Newswires; 416-306-2100     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 08:41 ET (13:41 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : E4X Launches Multicurrency Services For Deckers
Story: Supports UK sales of popular Teva products       NEW YORK, Jan. 15 /PRNewswire/ -- E4X, Inc., the leading provider of online multicurrency services, today announced that Teva (a division of Deckers Outdoor Corporation), the premier outdoor footwear manufacturer, has added E4X Local Currency Pricing to its global sales and service capability.        (Logo:  http://www.newscom.com/cgi-bin/prnh/20040614/NYM002LOGO )     Deckers is now able to let international shoppers shop and pay in their own currency and local credit cards without dealing in foreign exchange conversion. E4X will initially provide support for British Pound conversions at Teva's www.teva.co.uk site, with more international sites and currencies to follow in the near future.     "We are very pleased to be part of Deckers' expansion into global markets," said Jody Rochwarger, executive vice president of E4X.  "By providing a choice of currencies for international customers, Deckers can convert more shoppers into buyers without the costs and complexities typically associated with international sales," she said.     Mr. John Kalinich, Deckers' vice president of consumer direct, noted that, "With a significant percentage of customers residing outside of the United States, the ability to offer pricing in local currencies is extremely important. Launching the E4X service enhances the international shopping experience by effectively creating a local storefront on the desktop of each individual international shopper."     Ms. Rochwarger went on to note, "E4X is committed to helping businesses maximize the possibilities of the internet. As we continue to improve and expand our international ecommerce services, we are focused on helping U.S. merchants reach global markets more easily."        About E4X     E4X, Inc. is a leading provider of services that facilitate global business by reducing cross border sales and payments complexities. E4X's unique, patented ecommerce application and comprehensive foreign exchange solutions help companies expand globally in what becomes a foreign exchange risk-free environment for global shoppers and merchants alike. This results in simplified accounting, reconciliation and reporting complexities.  Founded in 1999, the privately held E4X is based in New York and operates a research and development facility in Tel Aviv, Israel. For further information visit www.e4x.com.        About Deckers     Deckers Outdoor Corporation (Nasdaq: DECK) builds niche products into global lifestyle brands by designing and marketing innovative, functional and fashion-oriented footwear, developed for both high-performance outdoor activities and everyday casual lifestyle use. The Company's products are offered under the Teva, Simple and UGG brand names.    SOURCE  E4X, Inc.       /CONTACT: Iris Shechter, Marketing Director, E4X Inc., +1-212-299-3579, iris@e4x.com; Jaime Eschette, Teva Public Relations, Deckers Outdoor Corporation, +1-805-967-7611 ext. 178, jeschette@deckers.com      /Web site: http://www.e4x.com      /Web site: http://www.teva.co.uk     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 11:00 ET (16:00 GMT)

Headline: : Gemcom Names Robert Selzler Vice President Of Marketing>GCM.T
Story: VANCOUVER, BRITISH COLUMBIA--(CCNMatthews - Jan. 15, 2007) - Gemcom Software International Inc. (TSX:GCM), the largest global supplier of specialised mining productivity solutions, today announced that Robert W. Selzler has joined the company as Vice President of marketing, responsible for worldwide marketing. Most recently the vice president of marketing for Mediabolic, Inc. (acquired by Macrovision), Selzler brings more than 23 years of success in developing marketing strategies and go-to-market initiatives at several Silicon Valley high-technology companies.    "Gemcom has rounded out its management team to ensure that we capitalise on the investments we have made in expanding our global presence, solutions offering and our delivery capabilities," said Rick Moignard, President and CEO of Gemcom. "Bob is a key addition to our team, with his exceptional marketing track record with technology companies such as General Electric, Apple Computer, InnoMedia and Mediabolic."    Prior to Mediabolic, Selzler served as vice president of marketing with InnoMedia, Kenwood Technologies and Zen Research. His tenure with these companies was marked by significant growth in brand visibility, market share, and revenue, resulting from strong marketing strategies, the establishment of partnership programs, and proactive outbound communications. Selzler also held senior marketing management positions with Apple Computer for over 9 years, where he led a global team responsible for the worldwide technology evangelism of its software. He was also instrumental in helping Apple launch into the engineering and scientific markets. Earlier in his career, Selzler held several positions with mining and engineering companies and with companies supplying related technology, including 4 years as a Product Manager with GE Calma, where he managed a line of 3D mapping software.    "Gemcom is widely recognized as the global leader in delivering compelling software and comprehensive services for the mining industry. Their vision for addressing the key issues facing this market sets them apart from the competition," stated Robert W. Selzler, Vice President of marketing at Gemcom. "I look forward to working closely with Gemcom's global management team to execute on that vision, raise visibility for our solutions, and deliver increased value to our worldwide customers."    Gemcom's software solutions are focused on enabling mining companies to meet the most challenging issues they face, including: rising demand and costs; shortage of skilled mining specialists; and the need to improve global management capabilities. Selzler will be tasked with raising awareness for Gemcom's solutions and working closely with the Company's product management and sales teams to create initiatives to ultimately drive customers from consideration to the purchase of the Company's solutions.    About Gemcom    When mining companies seek to increase mine productivity, they turn to Gemcom for technology and services. The Company is home to world-renowned mining solutions like GEMS, Surpac, Minex, Whittle, Maximiser and Gemcom InSite, and to industry thought-leaders, who are pushing the boundaries of what's possible in mining. Established in 1985, Gemcom has a global reach, with more than 20 offices worldwide, delivering comprehensive solutions in all major mining centres in more than 90 countries. Every major mining company, including BHP Billiton, Codelco, CVRD, De Beers and Newmont, is a Gemcom client. Through growth and acquisitions, the Company is the largest global supplier of specialised mining productivity solutions. For more information, please visit www.gemcomsoftware.com.    Gemcom, the Gemcom logo and combinations thereof, are trademarks of Gemcom Software International Inc. GEMS, Surpac, Minex, Whittle, Maximiser and Gemcom InSite are either registered trademarks or trademarks of Gemcom Software International Inc. Headline: : Contrans Income Fund Announces Distribution>CSS.UN.T
Story: WOODSTOCK, ON, Jan. 15 /CNW/ - Contrans Income Fund (TSX. Symbol CSS.UN) today declared a cash distribution of CDN $0.1042 per unit, for the month of January 2007, to unitholders of record at the close of business on January 31, 2007. The distribution payment will be made on February 15, 2007.    The Fund is an unincorporated, open-ended limited purpose trust created for the purpose of acquiring and holding certain investments.    Contrans has been providing freight transportation services since 1985. With approximately 1,500 power units and 2,300 trailers under management, Contrans is one of the largest freight transportation companies in Canada.    The Fund provides unitholders with monthly distributions. Trust units are listed on The Toronto Stock Exchange (under CSS.UN) and are eligible for registered retirement savings plans (RRSP's), registered retirement income funds (RRIF's) and deferred profit sharing plans (DPSP's). The Fund has also implemented a distribution reinvestment plan (DRIP) which will allow unitholders to receive distributions in the form of additional units in lieu of cash and will also enable participants to purchase additional units directly from the Fund.             /CONTACT: Stan Dunford, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer; or Greg Rumble, President and Chief Operating Officer; Phone: (519) 421-4600, E-mail: info@contrans.ca, Web site: www.contrans.ca     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 10:51 ET (15:51 GMT)

Headline: :Moody's Changes Rosneft Outlook To Positive
Story: The following is a press release from Moody's Investors Service:     Moody's Investors Service has changed the outlook for the Baa2 foreign and local currency issuer ratings of OJSC Oil Company Rosneft ("Rosneft") to positive from stable.   The rating action follows significant improvements to the company's financial and liquidity position following last year's initial public offering (IPO) and the prospect of further strengthening of its business profile, both as regards upstream field development and downstream integration. As a result, the company's baseline credit assessment (BCA) -- which measures a government-related issuer's fundamental credit strength excluding any government support -- has improved to a 11-13 range (corresponding to a "Ba" range) from a 14-16 range (which equates to a "B" range). Sustained efforts to improve transparency and investor relations have also supported strengthening of the group's credit profile.   "We believe that Rosneft has successfully addressed many of its recent financial uncertainties, particularly its high leverage and constrained liquidity, from its recent IPO and strong cash flow generation, which translates into a strengthening of its credit profile", says Philipp Lotter, Senior Credit Officer at Moody's and lead analyst for Rosneft. "Furthermore, we believe that the company will aim to re-balance the level of integration of its up- and downstream operations, which could support a rating upgrade over the medium term", adds Lotter.   Most importantly Moody's highlights (1) Rosneft's ongoing strong financial and operational performance on the back of above-average production growth, (2) a sharp reduction in adjusted debt with Rosneftegaz's debt being repaid from IPO proceeds, (3) the extension of the group's debt maturity profile thus easing liquidity pressure, (4) improvements in financial transparency and corporate governance and (5) its solid project pipeline which should support production growth targets going forward, as driving factors of Rosneft's improving credit profile.   At the same time, Moody's notes that Rosneft's acquisitive strategy combined with an ambitious upstream investment programme are likely to fuel further borrowings going forward, which Moody's would expect to be managed within certain parameters in order to support any rating upgrades.   The positive outlook reflects Moody's expectation that Rosneft will focus on strengthening its business profile by addressing the current imbalance between its substantial upstream business and its comparatively minor refining operations. Whilst this will entail investments and acquisitions, Moody's could envisage that the benefits gained from strengthening integration could outweigh the higher leverage attained from such transactions. Accordingly, ratings could be upgraded over the medium term, if Rosneft succeeds in acquiring refining capacity while maintaining retained cash flow to net adjusted debt above 30% and leverage no higher than 50%.   Moody's regards Rosneft as a government-related issuer (GRI) and thus ratings incorporate significant uplift for high implied state support from its baseline credit assessment, which is currently in the 11-13 range. Moody's thus factors in high government support and medium dependence assumptions into Rosneft's ratings.   OJSC Oil Company Rosneft, headquartered in Moscow, Russia, is the country's second largest vertically integrated oil & gas company in terms of reserves and production, and one of the largest oil & gas companies in the world. In the first 9 months of 2006, the group produced 1.86 million barrels of oil equivalent (boe) per day and in 2005 had refinery throughput of 10.5 million tonnes per annum. Total SEC reserves in 2005 were around 9.4 billion boe. The group's 9M2006 revenues were USD 25.5 billion.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 06:52 ET (11:52 GMT)

Headline: : True Energy Trust Announces Intention To Convert Into A Growth Oriented Intermediate E&P Company>TUI.UN.T
Story: CALGARY, Jan. 15 /CNW/ - True Energy Trust ("True" or the "Trust") is pleased to announce its intention to convert into a growth oriented, dividend paying intermediate exploration and production company (the "Reorganization"). This corporate structure is well-suited to True's assets. Specifically, True has a significantly large inventory of high quality development and exploration opportunities along with a significant undeveloped land base. Management and the board of directors believe the best opportunity and strategic direction to create securityholder value is to reinvest a substantial portion of True's cash flow and focus on increasing per share cash flow, production, reserves, and net asset value.    Background and Mechanics of the Reorganization    True has been investigating a number of restructuring alternatives subsequent to the Federal Government's October 31, 2006 announcement on tax policy on Canadian oil and gas royalty trusts, the clarification update that was provided on December 15, 2006 and December 21, 2006 draft legislation. The Government's announcements have resulted in management and the board of directors revisiting the long-term strategic direction of the Trust. Based on this review of the alternatives, conversion back to a corporation before 2011 has been determined by management and the board of directors as the best opportunity to enhance unit and asset value over time. By converting to a growth-oriented E&P company True can pursue ample development opportunities and, combined with an attractive balance of high-quality tax pools, should not be cash taxable in the near term.    Pursuant to the Reorganization, it is currently contemplated that holders of True trust units ("Trust Units") will receive an equal number of shares of a newly formed corporation that will hold the assets previously held directly or indirectly by the Trust. The exchangeable shares will also be exchanged for common shares based on the conversion ratio thereof. This will result in approximately 70 million shares being issued and outstanding. True's outstanding convertible debentures will be assumed by the new corporation. In the course of finalization of the structure of the Reorganization, the board of directors of True will continue to take into account any further clarification that is released under the proposals outlined by the government on October 31, 2006.    The board of directors of True has unanimously determined the Reorganization is in the best interest of the Trust and all securityholders and recommend to securityholders approval of the Reorganization at a special meeting. It is anticipated that an information circular and proxy statement in connection with the Special Meeting will be mailed to Unitholders in the first quarter of 2007. Tristone Capital Inc. and National Bank Financial Inc. have been engaged as financial advisors to the board of directors in connection with the Reorganization. FirstEnergy Capital Corp., Orion Securities Inc. and Peters & Co. Limited are acting as strategic advisors to True. The Reorganization will be subject to all required regulatory approvals and securityholder approval by at least 66 2/3% of the votes cast by unitholders of the Trust and holders of the exchangeable shares. In connection with the Reorganization, securityholders will also be asked to approve a standard stock option plan as part of the long term compensation structure of the new public corporation. All True securityholders are encouraged to vote in person or by proxy at the Meeting. True has engaged Kingsdale Shareholders Services Inc. to act as True's information agent and to provide assistance to True securityholders in completing forms of proxy and related documents. True securityholders may contact Kingsdale Shareholder Services Inc. at 1-866-639-8089 for assistance.    Pro forma Intermediate Producer    Prior to converting to an energy trust structure in November 2005, True was a successful growing junior E&P company. True currently owns in excess of 1.1 million gross acres (730,000 net acres) of undeveloped land and has identified a current drilling inventory in excess of 600 locations. Current tax pools are estimated at approximately $460 million.    As an intermediate producing company, True's exploration and development capital program will initially be increased to $120 million for 2007. This level of capital expenditure program would enable True to grow production and reserves as an E&P company while maintaining a prudent balance sheet. The majority of this capital will be spent in Kerrobert, Willesden Green and Ferrier areas. Based on various commodity price assumptions ranging from WTI US$50 - US$65 per bbl and AECO CDN$6.00 - CDN$7.75 per mcf and production of between 20,000 and 21,000 boe/d 2007 cash flow is forecast to range from $110 million to $175 million.    As at November 30, 2006, True has a net working capital deficit of $38 million and $150 million in bank indebtedness. This leaves approximately $75 million available on a $225 million credit facility.    True's leadership team has the experience and expertise to lead the growth of the newly formed intermediate E&P company through an active drilling program and acquisition strategy. Over the past six years the technical team and Board of Directors at True has been successful in increasing production from 160 boe/d to its current level of 19,700 boe/d through a combination of drilling and acquisitions. The team will continue to apply this aggressive approach along with focusing on controllable costs associated with the production base. True will continue to further enhance personnel of the organization to reflect the requirements of an intermediate producing company and an expanded capital program. It will be proposed that True's existing management and board of directors will remain in place following the effective date of the Reorganization.    Dividend Policy & Notice of Distribution    Combined with a capital efficient growth strategy, True intends to establish a dividend policy to take effect following completion of the Reorganization which will further differentiate True from existing intermediate producing companies. The initial dividend is proposed to be set at $0.02 per month to be paid quarterly.    True also announces that the cash distribution for the month of January will be $0.12 per unit, to be paid on February 15, 2007 to all unitholders of record as of January 31, 2007. The ex-distribution date for this payment is January 29, 2007.    Interested parties are encouraged to review the latest corporate presentation for further details available on True's website at http://www.trueenergytrust.com/Investors/Presentation.asp. True will also hold a conference call on Monday, January 15, 2007 at 2:00 PM MST/4:00 PM EST. To participate, please call toll-free 1-800-731-5319 or 416-644-3416 and enter passcode 21216204 followed by the number sign. The conference call will also be recorded and available by calling 1-877-289-8525 or 416-640-1917 and entering passcode 21216204 followed by the number sign.    Members of the senior management team will be hosting investor information sessions in Montreal on Tuesday, January 16, 2007, in Toronto on Wednesday, January 17, 2007, in Vancouver on Friday, January 19, 2007 and in Calgary on Tuesday, January 23, 2007. Details and registration information is posted on our website at www.trueenergytrust.com.    Forward Looking Statements: Certain information herein including management's assessment of future plans and operations, the proposed Reorganization, details and timing of matters related thereto and future plans following completion thereof, capital expenditure budgets and the results of the expenditure thereof, forecast cash flow for 2007 and the dividend policy following completion of the Reorganization may constitute forward-looking statements under applicable securities laws and necessarily involve risks including, without limitation, risks as to whether all required regulatory and other approvals related to the completion of the Reorganization will be obtained and the timing thereof risks associated with oil and gas exploration, development, exploitation, production, marketing and transportation, loss of markets, volatility of commodity prices, currency fluctuations, imprecision of reserve estimates, environmental risks, competition from other producers, inability to retain drilling rigs and other services, incorrect assessment of the value of acquisitions, failure to realize the anticipated benefits of acquisitions, delays resulting from or inability to obtain required regulatory approvals and ability to access sufficient capital from internal and external sources. Headline: Irish Continental: P&O Extends Ferry Charter To 2010
Story: Edited Press Release     LONDON (Dow Jones)--Irish Continental Group said Monday that P&O European Ferries Ltd (P&O) has exercised its option to extend the  charter of the 1986 built cruise ferry "Pride of Bilbao"  from Oct. 15, 2007 to 15th October 2010.   P&O retains one further option to extend the charter  from 2010 to 2013. P&O previously exercised the option to  renew the 1995 built "Kaitaki" also from 2007 to 2010.   The combined charter income from the two vessels on a full year basis and at current exchange rates is 80% of the current rates.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 10:11 ET (15:11 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE: Smiths To Sell Aerospace Unit To GE For $4.8B
Story: By Steve McGrath   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--U.K. engineering company Smiths Group PLC (SMIN.LN) Monday said it will sell its aerospace division to General Electric Co. (GE) for $4.8 billion in cash, and return GBP2.1 billion of the GBP2.25 billion proceeds to its shareholders.   It also said the two companies have signed a letter of intent to form a new joint venture company, Smiths GE Detection, combining Smiths' Detection operations with GE Homeland Protection. Smiths will own 64% of the new JV and GE the remaining 36%.   After selling its aerospace division, Smiths will be left with detection, medical and speciality engineering operations. The company has been under pressure from shareholders to break itself up, but has long resisted.   In a statement, Smiths said the sale of the aerospace unit is expected to generate improved returns on capital and boost margins. The net effect of the sale and capital return would have been accretive to the company's 2006 pro-forma earnings, it added.   The company will call an extraordinary shareholders meeting during the second quarter to approve the sale, which is also subject to completion.   The capital return is proposed as a B share scheme combined with share consolidation.   In a separate statement, GE said the acquisition will broaden the U.S. company's offerings to its aerospace customers by adding Smiths' flight management systems, electrical power management, mechanical actuation systems and airborne platform computing systems.   "GE Aviation is growing about 10% a year and this acquisition gives us a technology growth platform that will be accretive to our net income and will deliver immediate and future value for our investors," GE Chairman and CEO Jeff Immelt said in the statement.   Smiths Aerospace has more than 11,000 employees and had $2.4 billion in revenues in 2006. It has been working on projects like Boeing Co.'s (BA) 787 aircraft, the Airbus A380 as well as the Joint Strike Fighter military project.   On the Detection JV, the companies said they view a deal as a long-term commitment and there will be no voluntary exit rights for the first five years of the JV.   The companies didn't say when the JV would be finalized, but said they have agreed an exclusivity period to reach a deal.   Smiths Group shares closed at 985 pence Friday.     Company Web site: http://www.smiths-group.com     -By Steve McGrath, Dow Jones Newswires; 44-20-7842-9284; steve.mcgrath@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 02:33 ET (07:33 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : IBM Brings Datacenter Management Technologies To Retail Stores>IBM
Story: RALEIGH, NC -- (MARKET WIRE) -- 01/15/07 --    IBM (NYSE: IBM) announced today a comprehensive series of offerings based on datacenter technologies that are designed to help retailers improve security, systems management and serviceability. The hardware and software enhancements are the latest efforts by IBM to simplify and automate retail environments -- helping retailers to lower costs, streamline operations, and protect existing investments.   The new technologies include upgrades to IBM's flagship 4690 point of sale (POS) operating system, new advanced systems management software, and serviceability enhancements to the SurePOS 500 series of POS systems.   "Retailers continue to seek out new technologies that can improve the customer experience, while streamlining and simplifying operations," said Steve Ladwig, general manager of IBM's Retail Store Solutions. "We've takensome of our most innovative data center advancements and applied those to the retail environment. This has resulted in solutions that help retailers improve end-to-end systems management, tighten security and ease serviceability -- allowing them to leverage the investments they've already made."   Enhancements to the 4690 operating system deliver store-level management capabilities and new features designed to help retailers protect store dataand maintain robust network security. Enhanced systems management capabilities with remote management agent (RMA) and its new retail extensions for IBM Director include the ability to manage multiple stores remotely from a central location -- managing traditional IT, today's retail devices and next generation technology offerings with one easy-to-use tool. The newest SurePOS 500 offers easier serviceability, with a virtually tool-less design that enables fast, easy service to help reduce the total cost of ownership.   In addition to its new offerings, IBM's Retail Store Solutions Division also recognized the 25th anniversary of its Retail Solutions Business Partner program. Since it launched in 1982, the program has grown to over 1,000 members today that sell more than half of IBM POS and Kiosk solutions.   ScanSource, an international distributor of specialty technology products providing distribution sales to resellers in the specialty technology markets, was an early RSS business partner.   "We have been distributing IBM's POS products and retail solutions for morethan 12 years and truly value their partnership," said Jeff Yelton, vice president of merchandising for ScanSource. "We continue to strengthen our relationship with IBM, and the new products IBM is announcing today will help the solution providers we work with better serve the needs of their retail customers."   New solutions from IBM   IBM's enhanced 4690 Operating System offers a strong platform for retail, with enhanced security and a single, convenient access point for POS, back-office and web-based applications. This latest version helps retailers establish a safe, secure and easy-to-manage platform for advanced software in all kinds of environments, and works equally well in stores of different sizes and segments. IBM's continued investment in 4690 also underscores its commitment to address the needs and protect the investments of its customers in order to better support their growth.   IBM's Remote Management Agent, a component of the IBM Store Integration Framework, empowers retailers to manage their store environments competitively by enabling them to achieve end-to-end stores system management of the retail devices and applications.  This software can help retailers lower the total cost of ownership by improving the efficiency and consistency of new systems and application deployments in stores and across the enterprise. When implemented in conjunction with IBM Director software, Remote Management Agent software interoperates with best-of-breed, retail-specific software point products and enterprise systems management solutions across IBM's entire Retail Store portfolio. Consequently,retailers make use of existing management tools, which can help lower totalcost of ownership, and have the flexibility to add solutions that are best suited to their business goals.   For example, leading cellular telephone provider T-Mobile Direct has started to implement IBM Director together with IBM Remote Management Agent for complete management, monitoring and reporting across all 2,000 of its point-of-sale solutions in the T-Mobile retail stores. IBM Remote Management Agent software enables T-Mobile to achieve end-to-end store system management of retail devices and applications.   Enhancements to IBM's SurePOS 500 systems offer next generation store capabilities that support a broad range of applications and include models that meet specialized retail requirements, particularly in the food service, hospitality, specialty and gas and convenience segments. They include a new tool-free design that allows customers or field repair technicians to quickly and economically remove and replace modules helping reduce outages and simplify recovery when needed. This can help reduce total cost of ownership.   These products and more can be seen at this year's National Retail Federation show January 14-17, 2007 at the Jacob Javits Center in New York, NY -- IBM booth #1319. For more information on IBM's activities at NRF 2007, please access the online Press Kit at www.ibm.com/press/nrf2007   About IBM   For more information on IBM's solutions for the retail industry, please visit www.ibm.com/retail.   Contact: Joanna Brewer IBM Media Relations (415) 971-2777 jmbrewer@us.ibm.com     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 07:07 ET (12:07 GMT)

Headline: : Napier's Lenders Waive December Interest Payments>NIR.T
Story: VANCOUVER, BRITISH COLUMBIA--(CCNMatthews - Jan. 12, 2007) - Napier Environmental Technologies Inc. (TSX:NIR) reports that its lenders have agreed to waive their rights to interest for the month of December 2006 in an effort to help Napier during this time of re-building their customer base. These interest payments have been waived and the interest otherwise payable shall not be paid or payable currently or in the future.    Napier is a Canadian company primarily engaged in the development, manufacture and distribution of a wide range of products utilizing environmentally advanced technology. The product lines include coating removal and wood restoration products for both the industrial/commercial market and the consumer/retail market.    This release and referenced materials contain forward-looking statements that are subject to a number of known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors that may cause actual results to differ materially from those anticipated in Napier's forward-looking statements. Such factors include, among others, risks related to going concern status of Napier, historical losses and cash flow, the future need for capital and uncertainty of additional financing being available, the potential dilution to shareholders, the volatility of the market price of the common shares, the historical lack of dividend payments, competition, dependence on key personnel, dependence on key customers, weather, seasonality and economic cycles, the availability of raw materials, the retail industry and the influence of economic conditions and consumer behavior, exchange rate fluctuations and conflicts of interest. For further details regarding such risk factors, see the section entitled "Description of the Business - Risk Factors" in Napier's annual information form dated March 30, 2006 and filed with the British Columbia and Ontario securities commissions and the Toronto Stock Exchange, which can be found on SEDAR at www.sedar.com. Headline: WSJA(1/16) Glossy Magazines Target India's Middle Class
Story: (From THE WALL STREET JOURNAL ASIA)     By Binny Sabharwal   New Delhi -- AS INDIA'S booming middle class shops, travels and eats out like never before, international glossy magazines are racing to the subcontinent to cash in on an advertising boom.   Lured by a growing pool of deep-pocketed readers and advertisers anxious to reach out to India's 300-million-strong middle class, some 10 foreign consumer magazines have launched Indian editions in the past two years, and close to 20 more are expected to start publishing in India in 2007.   Indian versions of Maxim, Marie Claire and Good Housekeeping are already on magazine racks; Vogue and others have announced plans to publish here. Even Playboy and Penthouse have announced an interest in coming to India, although they are still working to devise tamer layouts to suit India's more conservative society.   With advertising and profit growth slowing in their home countries in the developed world, big-name publications need new markets.   "Compared to developed markets like the U.S. and U.K. that are showing single-digit [annual revenue] growth in the entertainment and media sector, India has close to a 19% growth rate and a large, untapped market," says Smita Jha, a consultant at PricewaterhouseCoopers Pvt. Ltd. in New Delhi. "Moving to emerging markets like India becomes a natural progression for publishers wanting to expand."   Advertisers overall spent more than 130 billion rupees ($2.93 billion) in India in 2005, according to estimates by PricewaterhouseCoopers, compared with 118 billion rupees the year before. Although magazine advertising accounted for less than 20% of the 63 billion rupees spent on print advertising in India in 2005 (much of the rest went to newspapers), analysts still expect magazine advertising to grow at a double-digit-percentage annual pace for the next five years at least, says PricewaterhouseCoopers's Ms. Jha.   As in other countries, not all the trends are positive. Overall magazine readership in India is declining as television and the Internet establish themselves in Indian living rooms, and the circulation of some of the newest magazines remains relatively small. With TV, radio and the Internet competing for advertisers, magazines could face more pressure in the future.   Still, most analysts believe the newest slate of high-end magazines will continue to attract lots of advertisers for the next several years, making India a relatively bright spot on the global publishing map. This is largely because analysts believe international brands operating in India will prefer to advertise their products in magazines, due to their cachet and popularity among middle-class and affluent Indians. It is also much more cost effective to advertise in magazines than on television.   India's economy is growing more than 8% a year, meaning its consumers have more money to spend. Indians spend about $14.4 billion a year on luxury goods, according to Technopak, an Indian research consultancy. With more Indians becoming fashion- and design-conscious, they represent a crucial new target audience for luxury brands around the world.   A host of global brands with hefty advertising budgets are already showing up in India to sell their expensive perfumes, cosmetics and clothing. A recent issue of the Indian edition of France-based luxury and lifestyle magazine L'Officiel -- one of the first foreign fashion and lifestyle titles to come to India five years ago -- included ads from foreign brands like Chanel, Versace, Piaget, Ebel, Chopard, Breguet, Dior, Harry Winston, Canali and Burberry, among others. To complete the circle, there are also advertisements from many high-end Indian fashion designers.   A monthly print run of just about 45,000 copies of L'Officiel hasn't lessened the interest from advertisers. Half of the 300-odd pages of the magazine are advertisements.   "We are doing exceedingly well with almost all luxury brands advertising with us," says Superna Motwane, editor in chief of L'Officiel India. "For Indians, luxury is money and wealth is indulgence and they are willing to spend. And this is reason enough for the advertisers to flock to us."   L'Officiel isn't the only magazine flourishing amid growing advertiser interest. Maxim, a London-based men's lifestyle magazine that recently completed its first year in India, said it was able to sell all its advertising for the first year before it even launched there.   "Name the industry, and they are our advertisers," says Piyush Sharma, chief executive officer and associate publisher of New Delhi-based Maxim India.   Unlike in the U.S., where there are more than 2,000 magazine publishers, in India only about 15 magazines now dominate the ad market, attracting some 80% of the money spent on magazine advertising. According to a study conducted by PricewaterhouseCoopers, revenue in India's print-media industry will grow at a rate of 12% a year over the next five years.   For Media Transasia India Ltd., a magazine-publishing house that licenses Maxim in India, the success of Maxim has encouraged it to bring other titles to the country. The company has already launched Travel and Leisure and will soon be bringing Better Homes and Gardens.   While most international publications are printed under license agreements with Indian publishers -- partly to take advantage of the local companies' existing distribution networks -- Conde Nast Publications has recently decided to launch Vogue in India on its own.   "It shows our seriousness toward the Indian market that is showing double-digit growth," says Alex Kuruvilla, managing director of Conde Nast Publications India. The magazine is slated to hit stands this autumn.   Publishers believe the market will only get better. In addition to the luxury brands that already have a presence in India, a number of other brands, including Gucci and Giorgio Armani, are slated to open their first stores by 2008.   "All these brands will look out for a cost-effective medium to reach their niche set of target audience and we will be here to provide that," says Mr. Sharma of Maxim India.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 16:31 ET (21:31 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE: BA Faces Strike Action Over Cabin Crew Sick Pay
Story: By Steve McGrath   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--British Airways PLC (BAB) Monday faced the threat of strike action by cabin crew after Transport and General Workers Union members voted overwhelmingly for action over what the union descibes as unfair working practices.   The T&G said 96% of cabin crews voting on the action opted for a strike.   The news hit British Airways shares and at 1158 GMT, the stock was down 6.5 pence, or 1.2%, at 544.50 pence in a higher FTSE 100.   British Airways said it was "very disappointed by the T&G's threat of what would be completely unnecessary industrial action."   The airline said it has arranged to meet T&G officals this week and it hopes the union will enter "meaningful discussions" on the issues unions have raised.   The union said the cabin crew's concerns, which include issues over the implementation of sickness absence policies as well as pay grading and on-board staffing and responsibility levels, had built up over the last two years but had failed to be addressed properly by the company's senior management.   BA is separately struggling to get unions to agree to plans designed to close a whopping GBP2.1 billion deficit in its main pension scheme. To help cut the deficit in the New Airways Pension Scheme, BA has proposed measures such as raising retirement ages and capping future pension pay rises in return for injecting a GBP800 million lumpsum into the scheme.   Friday, the powerful pilots union, The British Airline Pilots' Association, said it will recommend that its 3,000 members at BA accept the airline's pension proposals. However, the GMB union, which represents ground staff, said it will hold a preliminary ballot on Jan. 17 in which it will recommend that members back strike action and reject the pension offer.   The T&G had deferred a decision on the pensions issue while the ongoing strike ballot over working practices was continuing.   However, in its response statement to the T&G's strike decision Monday, BA said: "The union says that one of its key concerns is pensions - yet we have just concluded 16 months of talks by accepting a proposal put forward by the T&G and our other unions. On that basis alone, we believe the T&G should pause to reflect before threatening the travel plans of our customers and their families."     Company Web site: http://www.tgwu.org.uk                    www.britishairways.com     -By Steve McGrath, Dow Jones Newswires; 44-20-7842-9284; steve.mcgrath@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 07:13 ET (12:13 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Cabot Microelectronics to Release Financial Results for First Quarter of Fiscal Year 2007 on January 25
Story: AURORA, Ill.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   Cabot Microelectronics Corporation (Nasdaq:CCMP), the world's leading supplier of chemical mechanical planarization (CMP) slurries to the semiconductor industry, announced today that it will release financial results for its first quarter of Fiscal Year 2007, which ended December 31, 2006, on Thursday, January 25.     The press release, which will be issued prior to market open and available in the Investor Relations section of the company's website, www.cabotcmp.com, will be followed by a conference call at 9:00 a.m. Central Time.     The conference call will be available via webcast from www.cabotcmp.com, or by phone at (800)291-5365. Callers outside the U.S. can dial (617)614-3922. The conference code for the call is 19626176.       About Cabot Microelectronics     Cabot Microelectronics Corporation, headquartered in Aurora, Illinois, is the world's leading supplier of CMP slurries used in semiconductor and data storage manufacturing. The company's products play a critical role in the production of the most advanced semiconductor devices, enabling the manufacture of smaller, faster and more complex devices by its customers. Since becoming an independent public company in 2000, the company has grown to nearly 750 employees who work at research and development labs, sales and business offices, manufacturing facilities and customer service centers in China, France, Germany, Japan, Singapore, South Korea, Taiwan, the United Kingdom and the United States. The company's vision is to become the world leader in shaping, enabling and enhancing the performance of surfaces, and thus looks beyond its core CMP business in the semiconductor industry. For more information about Cabot Microelectronics Corporation, visit www.cabotcmp.com or contact Barbara Ven Horst, Director of Investor Relations at 630-375-5412.
