Headline: : Heritage Oil encounters hydrocarbons in Kingfisher-1A well in Uganda
Story: /THIS PRESS RELEASE IS NOT FOR DISTRIBUTION TO UNITED STATES NEWSWIRE      SERVICES OR FOR DISSEMINATION IN THE UNITED STATES/      CALGARY, Jan. 15 /CNW/ - Heritage Oil Corporation (TSX: HOC) today announced that hydrocarbons in three zones totalling approximately 40 metres have been encountered in the Kingfisher-1A well in Block 3A, Uganda.      As reported on November 6, 2006, a secondary objective of the Kingfisher-1 well successfully flow tested 4,120 barrels of oil per day from two zones perforated over an interval between 1,783 and 1,795 metres. The oil was light (c. 30 degrees API) and sweet with a low gas-oil ratio and some associated wax.      Following the encouraging result in the secondary objective of the Kingfisher-1 well, the partners commenced drilling the Kingfisher-1A sidetrack, which aimed to step-out into the basin to test the primary exploration objectives of the well and penetrate as much of the deeper sedimentary section as possible to a maximum depth of 4,000 metres. Since the last report, the Kingfisher-1A well has been successfully cased to 2,502 metres and drilled to a depth of 2,962 metres.      New drilling in the deeper section has encountered three additional potential oil-bearing zones totalling approximately 40 metres between 2,260 and 2,370 metres, evidenced by wireline logging and formation pressure testing. Planned testing of these zones will follow completion of drilling, to a target depth of between 3,000 and 4,000 metres, which it is estimated will take up to a further 45 days. Test equipment has remained on site in readiness for the testing.      The Kingfisher prospect is a very large structural high that is expressed at surface on the bed of Lake Albert. Seismic data indicates the Kingfisher prospect has an areal extent of up to approximately 70 square kilometres, although the Kingfisher-1A well is only investigating a limited part of this structure.      As part of an accelerated work program in Uganda, the joint venture partners are planning to acquire approximately 270 square kilometres of 3D seismic over the Kingfisher structure commencing in the first half of 2007. Options for further drilling of the Kingfisher prospect and other prospects in Lake Albert are being appraised.      Heritage is operator of and holds a 50% interest in Block 3A, which has an area of 1,991 square kilometres. Heritage is also operator of and holds a 50% interest in Block 1, which has an area of 4,285 square kilometres and is located to the north of Block 3A in the Albert Basin. Tullow Oil plc holds the other 50% interests in Blocks 3A and 1.      Heritage is an international oil and gas corporation with a producing property in the Sultanate of Oman, a development property in Russia and exploration projects in the Republic of Uganda and the Democratic Republic of Congo. The Company is also pursuing opportunities in the Kurdistan region of Iraq and in other regions of Iraq.      The Company's Common Shares trade on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol HOC.             <<          If you would prefer to receive press releases via email contact        Ana Augusta (ana@chfir.com) and specify "Heritage press releases"                                in the subject line.       >>         FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS: Except for statements of historical fact, all statements in this news release - including, without limitation, statements regarding production estimates and future plans and objectives of Heritage - are forward-looking statements that involve various risks and uncertainties. Headline: Microsoft Japan:Vista OS Japan Launch Jan 30, On Time -2-
Story: Huston was speaking in Tokyo at a Microsoft press conference for the upcoming release of the new operating system. In addition to assurances that Vista would be released on schedule, the software giant also emphasized that a large number of compatible computers and peripheral devices would be available at launch.   A host of Japanese consumer electronics companies, including Sony Corp. (6758.TO), Toshiba Corp. (6502.TO) and NEC Corp. (6701.TO) presented new computers that could run the system.   Some industry observers have said that users will be slow to adopt Vista. Huston said that based on PC turnover in Japan, more computers would be equipped with Vista than the current XP operating system within two to three years.     -By Jay Alabaster, Dow Jones Newswires; 813-5255-2929; jay.alabaster@dowjones.com   -Edited by Mayuko Ota     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 00:54 ET (05:54 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Aspect Medical to Report Fourth Quarter 2006 Results February 7, 2007
Story: Conference Call Scheduled for Same Day  NEWTON, Mass.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   Aspect Medical Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ: ASPM) will report earnings results for the 2006 fourth quarter on Wednesday, February 7, 2007. Following the earnings announcement on Wednesday morning, the Company will host a conference call and live webcast at 10:00 a.m. Eastern Time for all interested parties, including financial analysts, portfolio managers, individual investors and members of the press. To participate in the call, please dial 1-877-704-5379 (domestic), 1-913-312-1293 (international), or access the webcast at www.aspectmedical.com on the Investor page, or at www.earnings.com. Telephone replays will be available by dialing 1-888-203-1112 (domestic), or 1-719-457-0820 (international), access code 4337015. The webcast replay will be available from February 7 to February 14, 2007.       About the Company     Aspect Medical Systems, Inc. is a global market leader in brain monitoring technology. To date, the company's Bispectral Index(TM) (BIS(TM)) technology has been used to assess more than 17.4 million patients and has been the subject of approximately 2,570 published articles and abstracts. BIS technology is installed in approximately 70 percent of hospitals listed in the July 2006 U.S. News and World Report ranking of America's Best Hospitals and in approximately 51 percent of all domestic operating rooms. In the last twelve months, BIS technology was used in approximately 16 percent of all U.S. surgical procedures requiring general anesthesia or deep sedation. BIS technology is available in more than 160 countries. Aspect Medical Systems has OEM agreements with seven leading manufacturers of patient monitoring systems. The company is also investigating how other methods of analyzing brain waves may aid in the diagnosis and management of neurological diseases, including depression and Alzheimer's disease. Headline: : Stewart Connector's New CAT 6a PCB Mounted Jacks for Premise Wiring and 10-G Ethernet Applications
Story: Internally Compensated Jacks Require Minimal Secondary     Compensation To Promote Shorter Design Cycle and Minimize PCB                          Complexity and Cost  GLEN ROCK, Pa.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   Announced today by Stewart Connector, a division of Bel Fuse Inc. (NASDAQ:BELFA)(NASDAQ:BELFB), is the availability of the SS-60300 Series of Category 6a PCB mounted jacks. The new CAT 6a jacks are the latest addition to Stewart Connector's expanding portfolio of connectors specifically designed to satisfy the demands of emerging high-speed networking and computing applications. Engineered to meet and exceed the 500 MHz requirements of the CAT 6a specifications, the jacks feature internal compensation to enhance electrical performance without the need for extensive secondary compensation on the main PCB. The Series boasts a patent-pending design, which integrates the capacitive and inductive compensation on a flexible circuit board that attaches directly to the tips of the jacks' contacts, close to where the jack and modular plug interface. The proximity of this flexible board to the connection helps cancel NEXT crosstalk introduced to the jack from the plug. Moreover, as the flexible circuit board attaches to the jacks' contacts, the jacks preserve the standard modular connector design to ensure durable and reliable connections.     Stewart's newest FCC and RoHS-compliant parts may be confidently specified for employment in premise wiring systems, and 10GBASE-T (10 Gigabit Ethernet over twisted-pair copper cabling) applications. They are most commonly used in wall outlets throughout buildings to connect computers, printers and varied peripheral equipment to networks. Jacks are equally appropriate for employment on patch panels at the consolidation points where buildings' network cables interconnect.     These PCB mountable components are offered in vertical or right-angle configurations, and in shielded and unshielded versions to afford engineers the utmost in design flexibility. Manufactured of UL94-V0 polycarbonate, they are provided standard with selective gold-plated (50-microinch) contacts to ensure high-cycle life. Additional specifications include an operating temperature range of -40 degrees to +85 degrees C, and durability of 750 mating cycles. Voltage rating is 150 VDC, and current rating is 1.5 A @ 25 degrees C. For more information, visit http://www.belfuse.com/Data/DBObject/Cat6aJacks.pdf.     Pricing for Stewart Connector's SS-60300 Series of CAT 6a PCB mounted jacks is $1.35 each in quantities of 5,000 for the unshielded version. While delivery is 4 weeks, samples are immediately available for design-in quantities. To locate a representative or distributor, visit http://belfuse.com/StewartConnector/RepsList.asp, or http://belfuse.com/StewartConnector/DistributorList.asp.       About Bel     Bel (www.belfuse.com) and its divisions, including Stewart Connector, are primarily engaged in the design, manufacture, and sale of products used in networking, telecommunications, high-speed data transmission, and consumer electronics. Products include magnetics (discrete components, power transformers and MagJack(R)connectors with integrated magnetics), modules (dc-dc converters, integrated analog front-end modules, custom designs), circuit protection (miniature, micro and surface mount fuses) and interconnect devices (passive jacks, plugs and cable assemblies). The Company operates facilities around the world.      Stewart Connector  11118 Susquehanna Trail South  Glen Rock, PA 17327  717-235-7512; Fax: 717-235-4675  Web Site: www.stewartconnector.com       Except for historical information contained in this news release, the matters discussed are (including information regarding the SS-60300 Series of Category 6a jacks) forward looking statements that involve risks and uncertainties. Among the factors that could cause actual results to differ materially are the following: the effect of business and economic conditions, the impact of competitive products and pricing; capacity and supply constraints or difficulties; product development, commercializing or technological difficulties; the regulatory and trade environment; and the risk factors reported from time to time in the Company's SEC reports.        CONTACT: Bel Fuse Inc.               Donna Marganella, 858-676-9650 Ext. 108        SOURCE: Bel Fuse Inc.  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 08:00 ET (13:00 GMT)

Headline: Bank Of Georgia Names Merrill Lynch For Debut Dollar Bond
Story: LONDON (Dow Jones)--Bank of Georgia has mandated Merrill Lynch as sole lead manager for a dollar-denominated bond issue, the country's first international bond offering, the syndicate bank said Monday.   The offering will be launched, subject to market conditions, following Asian and European investor roadshows. The presentations will start in Asia Jan. 22 before moving to Europe.   Bank of Georgia is the largest bank in Georgia by equity, assets, and loans. It is a full service bank providing commercial, investment banking, insurance, asset management and card services to corporate and retail clients.   The issuer is rated B3 by Moody's Investors Service Inc., B+ by Standard & Poor's Corp., and B- by Fitch Ratings.      -By Peppi Kiviniemi, Dow Jones Newswires; 44 20 7842 9496; peppi.kiviniemi@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 07:37 ET (12:37 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Keg Royalties Income Fund Announces Strong Quarterly Sales Results
Story: VANCOUVER, BRITISH COLUMBIA--(CCNMatthews - Jan. 15, 2007) - The Keg Royalties Income Fund (TSX:KEG.UN) (the "Fund") and Keg Restaurants Ltd. today announced sales results for the 13 and 52-week periods ended December 31, 2006.    Keg Restaurants Ltd.'s total system sales for the 13 weeks ended December 31, 2006 were $106.4 million compared to $93.4 million for the 13 weeks ended January 1, 2006, an increase of $13.0 million or 13.8%. For the 52-week period ended December 31, 2006, The Keg's total system sales were $393.1 million compared to $353.7 million for the 52-week period ended January 1, 2006, an increase of $39.4 million or 11.1%. Royalty Pool Sales increased by 15.8% to $98.7 million for the quarter, and by 14.4% to $372.5 million for the year.    The Keg's same store sales (sales of restaurants that operated during the entire period of both the current and prior years) increased by 10.5% in Canada and by 7.9% in the United States for the 13-week period ended December 31, 2006, and by 8.3% in Canada and by 7.2% in the U.S. for the 52-week period ended December 31, 2006. After translating the sales of the U.S. restaurants into their Canadian dollar equivalent, consolidated same store sales increased by 9.6% for the 13-week period and by 6.9% for the 52-week period, despite the continuing negative effect of the exchange rate between Canadian and U.S. dollars.    "We are extremely pleased with our sales results. The Keg has once again delivered excellent growth by any industry measure," said David Aisenstat, Keg President & CEO. "This continuing quarterly performance is a strong endorsement of the strength of The Keg brand."    Vancouver-based Keg Restaurants Ltd. is the leading operator and franchisor of steakhouse restaurants in Canada and has a substantial presence in select regional markets in the United States. Keg Restaurants Ltd. continues to operate The Keg restaurant system and expand that system through the addition of both corporate and franchised Keg steakhouses. The Keg has been named one of the "50 Best Employers in Canada" for the past five years by the Globe and Mail's Report on Business Magazine.    This press release may contain certain "forward looking" statements reflecting The Keg Royalties Income Fund's current expectations in the casual dining segment of the restaurant food industry. Investors are cautioned that all forward looking statements involve risks and uncertainties, including those relating to the Keg's ability to continue to realize historical same store sales growth, changes in market and existing competition, new competitive developments, and potential downturns in economic conditions generally. Additional information on these and other potential factors that could affect the Fund's financial results are detailed in documents filed from time to time with the provincial securities commissions in Canada.    This press release shall not constitute an offer to sell or the solicitation of an offer to buy, which may be made only by means of the prospectus, nor shall there be any sale of the Fund units in any state, province or other jurisdiction in which such offer, solicitation or sale would be unlawful prior to registration or qualification under the securities laws of any state, province or jurisdiction. The Keg Royalties Income Fund units have not been, and will not be registered under the U.S. Securities Act of 1933, as amended and may not be offered or sold in the United States absent registration or an application for exemption from the registration requirement under U.S. securities laws.    The Trustees of the Fund have approved the contents of this press release.               FOR FURTHER INFORMATION PLEASE CONTACT:             The Keg Royalties Income Fund           Karyn Byrne           Investor Relations Manager           (416) 646-4960           Email: karynb@kegrestaurants.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 16:45 ET (21:45 GMT)

Headline: : YRC Worldwide Announces Organizational Changes
Story: -- Yellow Transportation and Roadway to be led by a single management team for accelerated business growth -- Enterprise Solutions Group established for easier customer access to the complete service portfolio of YRC Worldwide brands       OVERLAND PARK, Kan., Jan. 15 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- YRC Worldwide Inc. (Nasdaq: YRCW) today announced organizational changes designed to support the corporation's growth through increased efficiencies and focused business development strategies.     "The first phase of our strategy involved gaining sufficient scale and building greater capabilities through our acquisitions of Roadway and the USF companies, as well as our activities in China, such as our JHJ joint venture," said Bill Zollars, Chairman, President and CEO. "YRC Worldwide now has the comprehensive service portfolio needed to support ongoing, profitable growth in the U.S. and around the world."        YRC National Transportation     Zollars announced that the next phase of the strategy will bring the management of the corporation's two largest subsidiaries -- Yellow Transportation and Roadway -- under one organization established as YRC National Transportation. Mike Smid has been named President and CEO of YRC National Transportation.     "Yellow Transportation and Roadway will maintain their strong, independent brands and networks in the marketplace," Smid said. "The new organization will allow us to respond faster and more efficiently to the changing marketplace by leveraging our resources and experience. We are committed to bringing added value to customers for both brands through enhanced services and stronger supply chain solutions."     Smid had been President of Roadway. He will be succeeded in that position by Terry Gilbert, who had been Executive Vice President of Sales and Marketing of Roadway. James Welch, President of Yellow Transportation, is retiring effective January 31. Welch will be succeeded by Maynard Skarka, who had been Senior Vice President of Operations for Yellow Transportation. Both Skarka and Gilbert will report to Smid.        YRC Enterprise Solutions Group     Zollars also announced the establishment of the YRC Enterprise Solutions Group to serve customers with transportation and logistics needs that span the comprehensive portfolio of services provided by the YRC Worldwide family of brands. This group will be led by Greg Reid, Executive Vice President - Enterprise Solutions Group and Chief Marketing Officer.     "This group will create a single point of contact for easier access to the portfolio of YRC Worldwide brands," said Reid. "The YRC Enterprise Solutions Group will develop strategic solutions leveraging the services of all the YRC Worldwide companies and provide more value to our customers, resulting in additional growth for our operating companies."     YRC Worldwide Inc., a Fortune 500 company and one of the largest transportation service providers in the world, is the holding company for a portfolio of successful brands including Yellow Transportation, Roadway, Reimer Express, Meridian IQ, New Penn, USF Holland, USF Reddaway, and USF Glen Moore. The enterprise provides global transportation services, transportation management solutions and logistics management. The portfolio of brands represents a comprehensive array of services for the shipment of industrial, commercial and retail goods domestically and internationally. Headquartered in Overland Park, Kansas, YRC Worldwide employs approximately 70,000 people.    SOURCE  YRC Worldwide Inc.       /CONTACT: Investor Contact, Phil J. Gaines of YRC Worldwide Inc., +1-913-696-6108, phil.gaines@yrcw.com ; or, Media Contact, Suzanne Dawson of Linden Alschuler & Kaplan, +1-212-329-1420, sdawson@lakpr.com      /Web site: http://www.yrcw.com/     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 09:25 ET (14:25 GMT)

Headline: : Adobe Announces Commercial Availability of Acrobat Connect Web-Hosted Service
Story: New Service Delivers Easy-to-use, "Always-on" Personal Meeting Rooms for Web-based Communication and Collaboration  SAN JOSE, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   Adobe Systems Incorporated (Nasdaq:ADBE) today announced the immediate commercial availability of Adobe(R) Acrobat(R) Connect(TM), the first hosted web conferencing service to offer "always-on" personal meeting rooms. Acrobat Connect enables knowledge workers to instantly meet and conduct business online through real-time, interactive web conferencing that is simple to access and easy to use.     "The feedback from users during our Acrobat Connect trial the past few months has been overwhelmingly positive. It has reinforced our belief that the product stands apart from traditional web conferencing solutions in terms of ease-of-use, elegance, and the instant access it provides anyone with an Adobe Flash enabled browser," said Tom Hale, senior vice president, Knowledge Worker Business Unit at Adobe. "Now that we're delivering the hosted service at an extremely approachable price, we expect knowledge workers to begin making Acrobat Connect personal meeting rooms as much a part of their daily work as email and the phone."     Unlike other web conferencing solutions, Acrobat Connect enables users to choose an easy-to-remember web address for their online personal meeting room that is unique to them, much like a phone number or e-mail address. Accessing a personal meeting room is easy and instant, requiring little more than a web browser and the ubiquitous Adobe Flash(R) Player software, installed on more than 97 percent of Internet-connected computers worldwide. Because there is no cumbersome software to download, knowledge workers can easily hold spontaneous, ad-hoc meetings that are virtually hassle-free to join.     "Working with manufacturers to ensure homes meet federal and state code requirements is a process heavily dependent on efficient and accurate communication and collaboration," said Dennis Newman, general manager, Information Technology Services, PFS Corporation, an independent quality control, testing, certification, and evaluation agency serving the architecture, engineering and construction industry. "Acrobat Connect helps eliminate many of the common communication problems we've encountered in the past. The one-button access to Acrobat Connect from Acrobat 8 enables our staff to instantly pull clients into a web-based meeting and show them first-hand where design problems exist. Ultimately, it helps speed the process of completing projects, saving both our clients and us valuable time and money."     Acrobat Connect provides users with essential collaboration tools, such as screen sharing, whiteboarding, chat, video conferencing, and audio conferencing(1)--all for unlimited usage for up to 15 participants for one low monthly fee. Additionally, with one-button "Start Meeting" access from the Adobe Acrobat 8 software product line and free Adobe Reader(R) 8 software, users can launch Acrobat Connect directly from a PDF document to start collaborating immediately.     For more advanced web conferencing and collaboration needs, the Acrobat Connect product line also includes Acrobat Connect Professional software. Available as of Dec. 2006, Acrobat Connect Professional offers a highly scalable solution for wide organizational deployment that offers extensive meeting management capabilities, as well as a powerful reporting system. For online meetings and events, including large meetings of up to 2,500 participants, companies can reach target audiences virtually any time with interactive multimedia, integrated telephony, and Voice over Internet Protocol. Organizations can deploy Acrobat Connect Professional in either an on-premise, behind the firewall configuration, or through Adobe's hosted service.     The entire Acrobat family consists of Acrobat 8 Professional, Acrobat 8 Standard, Acrobat 8 Elements, Acrobat 3D Version 8, Acrobat Connect, and Acrobat Connect Professional.       Pricing and Availability     Acrobat Connect is immediately available in English in North America for a subscription price of US$39 per month, or US$395 per year per personal meeting room. The product is expected to be available in French, German and Japanese language versions later in the current calendar year. For more information, please visit www.adobe.com/products/acrobatconnect/. A free trial version of Acrobat Connect is available at www.adobe.com/go/tryconnect.       About Adobe Systems Incorporated     Adobe revolutionizes how the world engages with ideas and information - anytime, anywhere and through any medium. For more information, visit www.adobe.com.       (C) 2007 Adobe Systems Incorporated. All rights reserved. Adobe,  the Adobe logo, Acrobat, Acrobat Connect, Flash, and Reader are either  registered trademarks or trademarks of Adobe Systems Incorporated in  the United States and/or other countries. All other trademarks are the  property of their respective owners.       (1) Telephone toll charges may apply.        CONTACT: Adobe Systems Incorporated               John Cristofano, 408-536-4135               jcristof@adobe.com               or               A&R Edelman               Leah Taylor, 212-704-8126               ltaylor@ar-edelman.com        SOURCE: Adobe Systems Incorporated  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 00:01 ET (05:01 GMT)

Headline: Italy Crt: Some Charges Vs Berlusconi Too Late - Reports
Story: MILAN (AP)--A court ruled Monday that the statute of limitations had expired for some of the charges against former Premier Silvio Berlusconi in a case involving the purchase by Berlusconi's Mediaset (MDIUY) empire of TV rights for U.S. movies, Italian news agencies reported.   Judge Edoardo D'Avossa threw out charges of embezzlement, receiving stolen property and accounting fraud against Berlusconi, the ANSA and Apcom news agencies reported. The judge also threw out a charge of receiving stolen goods against David Mills, the estranged husband of the U.K.'s culture secretary, Tessa Jowell.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 05:28 ET (10:28 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: ShawCor Plans C$8.2M Pipe Coating Capacity Addition
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   Shawcor Ltd.'s (SCL.A.T) Shaw Pipe Protection Ltd. division will invest C$8.2 million in additional fusion bonded epoxy, or FBE, pipe-coating capacity for the Western Canadian Sedimentary Basin.   Toronto-based ShawCor said the additional coating capacity will be added to Shaw Pipe's coating facility now under construction in Camrose, Alta. as part of a previously announced C$30 million expansion program.   The new production line will provide advanced FBE technology for small- and large-diameter pipe and will be in-service by the end of the third quarter of 2007.   ShawCor is an energy-services company that operates through six divisions.   -Carolyn King; 416-306-2100; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 14:22 ET (19:22 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Dassault Aviation: No Talks With Libya Over Rafale Sale-2
Story: Dassault acknowledged it was talking to the Libyan authorities but said the talks only involve a contract to bring Libya's Dassault-made Mirage F1 fighters up to operational status.   According to a French press report Sunday, Libya was interested in buying between 12 and 18 of the Rafale multi-role combat aircraft which so far have been sold only to the French government.   A report Monday in La Tribune, a French financial daily newspaper, said an eventual Rafale order would be part of a package deal to revamp Libya's armed forces that is being negotiated with France. Libya is interested in buying helicopters and missiles, including the Mica air-air missile made by MBDA, the report said.   -By David Pearson, Dow Jones Newswires; +331 4017 1740; david.pearson@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 04:13 ET (09:13 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Brazil Bradespar Eyes Sale Of Stake In Miner CVRD -Report
Story: SAO PAULO (Dow Jones)-Bradespar (BRAP4.BR), the equity arm of Brazilian private-sector bank Bradesco (BBD), is studying whether to sell part of its stake in mining company Companhia Vale do Rio Doce (RIO), or CVRD, according to a report Monday in local business daily Valor Economico.   According to the report, Bradespar could sell as much as half of its 21.2% stake in CVRD controlling shareholder Valepar to Japanese conglomerate Mitsui, which currently has an 18% stake in Valepar.   The rest of Valepar shares would be transferred to the bank's insurance unit, Bradesco Seguros.   Bradesco and Bradespar officials were not available for comment when contacted by Dow Jones Newswires on Monday.   The sale would be part of a possible Bradesco strategy to dissolve Bradespar in an effort to secure profits gained from rising Brazilian share prices.   Bradespar also has a stake in the controlling group of Brazilian utility CPFL Energia (CPL). In the case of CPFL, in which Bradespar holds 9% of the voting shares, the exit could be through a public offer of shares on the capital market.   CPFL's controlling block is formed by Bradespar, Votorantim Energia Ltda and Camargo Correa Energia.     -By Rogerio Jelmayer, Dow Jones Newswires; 55-11-3145-1480; rogerio.jelmayer@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 07:29 ET (12:29 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Kaboose Closes Over-Allotment Of Public Offering>KAB.T
Story: TORONTO, Jan. 15 /CNW/ - Kaboose Inc. (TSX: KAB) is pleased to announce that it has closed the over-allotment option granted in connection with its previously announced public offering (the "Offering") with an aggregate of 1,500,000 common shares sold for gross proceeds of $3,750,000.    With the exercise of the over-allotment option, the aggregate gross proceeds of the Offering are now $28.75 million.    The syndicate of underwriters for the Offering was led by GMP Securities L.P. and included Sprott Securities Inc. and Dundee Securities Corporation.    About Kaboose Inc.    Kaboose is the largest independent, family-focused online media company in North America and one of the top-five most visited family destinations online. From pregnancy to parenting, birthday parties to scrapbooking, and entertainment to education, Kaboose has the content and applications to help parents plan and share their family life. Kaboose owns some of the world's leading online properties targeting families, including BabyZone.com, Kaboose.com, TwoPeasInABucket.com, BirthdayInABox.com, BubbleShare.com, Funschool.com and Zeeks.com. Kaboose trades on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol "KAB". Headline: 5th UPDATE: Smiths To Sell Aerospace Ops To GE For $4.8B
Story: (Updates an item published at 1047 GMT, adding more executive comment and details of Smiths' advisers.)     By Steve McGrath and Rod Stone   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--U.K. engineering company Smiths Group PLC (SMIN.LN) Monday said it will sell its aerospace division to General Electric Co. (GE) for $4.8 billion in cash and return GBP2.1 billion of the GBP2.25 billion proceeds to its shareholders.   It also said the two companies have signed a letter of intent to form a new joint venture company, Smiths GE Detection, combining Smiths' Detection operations with GE Homeland Protection. Smiths will own 64% of the new JV and GE the remaining 36%.   After selling its aerospace division, Smiths will be left with detection, medical and specialty engineering operations. The company has been under pressure from shareholders to break itself up, but has long resisted.   The announcements were welcomed by the markets and at 1236 GMT, Smiths' shares were up 138.5 pence, or 14%, at 1,123.5 pence, the biggest gainer on the FTSE 100. In Frankfurt, General Electric shares were down 0.3% at EUR29.18.   One trader, who requested anonymity, said the sale made perfect sense since Smiths aerospace has been suffering from downward pricing pressure from Boeing Co. (BA) and Airbus owner European Aeronautic Defence & Space Co. (5730.FR).   In a research note, Panmure Gordon said there's clearly scope for other bidders to step in although counter offers might have to involve a bid for the whole of Smiths. It said it's concerned that the merger of the two market leaders in detection may struggle to get antitrust clearance. The brokerage has a buy rating on Smiths.   In a statement, Smiths said the sale of the aerospace unit is expected to generate improved returns on capital and boost margins. The net effect of the sale and capital return would have been accretive to the company's 2006 pro-forma earnings, it added.   On a conference call, Smiths Chief Executive Keith Butler-Wheelhouse said the deal would have boosted pro-forma 2006 earnings per share by 7%, even though aerospace accounted for GBP1.3 billion of the company's GBP3.5 billion in revenues in 2006.   The company will call an extraordinary shareholders meeting during the second quarter to approve the sale, which is also subject to completion and regulatory approval.   On the conference call, GE Chairman and Chief Executive Jeff Immelt said he looked forward to "a constructive process" with E.U. antitrust regulators.   He noted that the acquisition would be complimentary rather than consolidating and told analysts separately he doesn't anticipate serious regulatory issues. Regarding the detection joint venture, Immelt said there are a "multitude of competitors" in the industry.   GE hasn't always had success with E.U. regulators, which blocked the company's intended acquisition of Honeywell after U.S. authorities had approved the deal.   The Smiths capital return is proposed as a B share scheme combined with share consolidation.   Smiths Finance Director John Langston said the aerospace division sale would leave Smiths with a loosened dividend policy and lower credit ratings, but the company could live with that because the remaining businesses are less capital intensive. The new dividend cover would be 1.8 times, down from 2 times, while its credit ratings at Standard & Poor's are expected to fall from A- to BBB+, he said.   In a separate statement, GE said the acquisition will broaden the U.S. company's offerings to its aerospace customers by adding Smiths' flight management systems, electrical power management, mechanical actuation systems and airborne platform computing systems.   A Smiths official said he doesn't expect the sale to impact the acquired unit's business with Rolls-Royce PLC (RR.LN), the U.K. company that competes head-to-head with GE on aircraft engines.   "GE Aviation is growing about 10% a year and this acquisition gives us a technology growth platform that will be accretive to our net income and will deliver immediate and future value for our investors," GE's Immelt said in the statement.   Smiths Aerospace has more than 11,000 employees and had $2.4 billion in revenues in 2006. It has been working on projects like Boeing's 787 aircraft, the Airbus A380 as well as the Joint Strike Fighter military project.   On the Detection JV, the companies said they view a deal as a long-term commitment and there will be no voluntary exit rights for the first five years of the JV.   The companies didn't say when the JV would be finalized, but said they have agreed an exclusivity period to reach a deal. Immelt said there are no plans   Butler-Wheelhouse said he had asked Immelt to sell Smiths the whole of GE's Homeland Protection unit while they were talking about aerospace, but had been turned down. Further talks had agreed on a JV. Speaking at a press conference in London, Butler-Wheelhouse said the involvement of GE might help the JV to secure additional security contracts in the huge U.S. market.   The CEO added that he now plans to stay at Smiths beyond his planned March 2008 retirement to oversee the full financial year ending July 31, 2008.   There is a "great deal of industrial logic" in putting the businesses together, Immelt said on the conference call, without quantifying synergies.   The JV will have pro-forma revenues of about GBP600 million. Its board will be made up of four Smiths members and two from GE, and will be chaired by Butler-Wheelhouse.   Butler-Wheelhouse said there are currently no talks to sell off the remaining Smiths units, but said "we reconsider these things continuously." Immelt said GE had no interest in Smiths' medical operations because the two companies operate in different parts of the medical engineering industry.   The Smiths CEO said his company remains well placed to make acquisitions worth up to GBP500 million despite plans to return much of the proceeds from the planned sale of its aerospace business to shareholders.   Smiths' lead financial adviser was Evercore Partners with Credit Suisse and JPMorgan Cazenove acting as joint financial advisers and brokers.     Company Web site: http://www.smiths-group.com     -By Steve McGrath and Rod Stone, Dow Jones Newswires; 44-20-7842-9284; steve.mcgrath@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 07:46 ET (12:46 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Canadian National, Union Reach Tentative Agreement >CNI
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   After weeks of "tough" bargaining, Canadian Auto Workers union Local 100 and National Council 4000 reached a tentative collective agreement Sunday with Canadian National Railway Co. (CNI) in Toronto.   The union said the agreement is subject to ratification by CAW members who work for the Montreal-based railway operator.   Details of the agreement weren't disclosed.   The CAW represents more than 4,000 shopcraft, clerical, supplemental and owner-operator members at CN facilities across the country. It said membership ratification meetings are being organized for later this week.   -Carolyn King; 416-306-2100; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 10:21 ET (15:21 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Hannaford Supermarkets Selects New VeriFone MX830>PAY
Story: NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   VeriFone Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: PAY) today announced that the Hannaford Bros. Co. supermarket chain has selected the new consumer-facing VeriFone MX830 as its next generation payment solution. The PCI PED-approved MX830, equipped with touchscreen signature capture capability, will be deployed initially in new and remodeled Hannaford stores in the Northeast and Sweetbay Supermarket stores in Florida.     The MX830 is a new member of the MX800 Series, a product family that provides the most effective mix-and-match combination of payment devices in multi-lane retail environments. The MX830 is designed to meet the highest levels of security and shares the architecture, software and peripherals of the industry-leading MX870 multimedia system and provides ultra-crisp on-screen graphics with 320x240 pixels on a 1/4-VGA resolution 16-shade gray scale backlit screen.     "VeriFone has developed a payment product that meets our needs for the latest in customer-activated capabilities," said Kevin Carleton, director of retail automation with Hannaford. "The MX830 provides great graphics in a highly durable form that will meet the rigorous requirements at our checkout counters."     A performance-oriented, durable payment device with ultra-crisp graphics, the MX830 is the entry point to the MX800 Series. The multi-lane payment product family leverages sophisticated technology and security features, and offers retailers a broad range of functions from basic debit and credit payment acceptance to advanced capabilities such as electronic signature capture, multimedia branding, contactless payment and smart card acceptance.     "The MX830 represents a new benchmark in quality and affordability in a customer-facing payment solution with touch-screen capabilities," said Jennifer Miles, VeriFone general manager of Integrated Retail Systems. "We are delighted that our expanding multi-lane solutions have won back Hannaford as a VeriFone customer."     A key requirement for Hannaford's payment solution selection was the ability to integrate the MX830 with the WinEPS Electronic Payments software from MTXEPS, Inc. WinEPS is a payment engine that provides electronic payment options that range from Debit and Credit transactions, to EBT, gift card, and check authorization.     "VeriFone has tremendous momentum in the multi-lane market with the MX800 Series," said MTXEPS President Jon Elwood. "We are looking forward to working with VeriFone and Hannaford in this migration to the next-generation payment platform."     VeriFone touch screen-enabled MX800 Series products utilize the best-quality capacitive technology with chemically hardened glass and feature a non-mechanical stylus with no moving parts to ensure a long-lasting product that will hold up to continued consumer use. All MX800 Series products feature a modular architecture to accommodate future needs, such as field-upgradeable contactless payment modules.       Additional Resources:       www.verifone.com/mxsolutions       About Hannaford     Hannaford Bros. Co., based in Scarborough, Maine, operates 158 stores under the Hannaford Supermarket and Hannaford Supermarket and Pharmacy names. Hannaford stores feature Guiding Stars, America's first storewide nutrition navigation system. Hannaford employs more than 26,000 associates. The company is owned by Delhaize Group of Brussels, Belgium.       About MTXEPS     MTXEPS is a privately held company, based in California, which markets their products directly and through their reseller channels. The WinEPS software product has been in the market place for over 10 years and now is a feature-rich, mature product with over 8,500 installations. The MTXEPS solution integrates with Point of Sale software from ACR, AutoStar, Casio, IBM, Innovax, JDA, JPMA, NCR, Retalix, RORC Fujitsu Transaction Solutions, StoreNext, and Systech. For additional information, please visit www.MTXEPS.com.       About VeriFone Holdings, Inc. (www.verifone.com)     VeriFone Holdings, Inc. ("VeriFone") (NYSE: PAY) is the global leader in secure electronic payment solutions. VeriFone provides expertise, solutions and services that add value to the point of sale with merchant-operated, consumer-facing and self-service payment systems for the financial, retail, hospitality, petroleum, government and healthcare vertical markets. VeriFone solutions are designed to meet the needs of merchants, processors and acquirers in developed and emerging economies worldwide.        CONTACT: VeriFone               Editorial Contact:               Pete Bartolik, 508-283-4112               pete_bartolik@verifone.com        SOURCE: VeriFone Holdings, Inc.  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 08:14 ET (13:14 GMT)

Headline: : Lawson Software Sees Demand for Lawson System Foundation 9 Among Retailers
Story: New technology platform gives retailers a secure, scalable and        high-performance, standards-based technology foundation  ST. PAUL, Minn.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   Lawson Software (Nasdaq:LWSN) today announced that 24 retailers, including After Hours Formalwear, Boddie-Noell Enterprises and Hannaford Bros. Co., licensed Lawson System Foundation 9 in Lawson's second quarter of fiscal year 2007, which ended Nov. 30, 2006. The retailers are moving to Lawson's latest technology platform to achieve enhanced performance, security, application simplicity and scalability.     These customers are part of a group of nearly 50 retailers that have licensed Lawson System Foundation (LSF 9). And, 17 of these retailers licensed LSF 9 on the IBM System i platform, which Lawson released in November 2006.     LSF 9 helps retail customers by combining Lawson's newest technology with other world-class technologies, including IBM middleware, for a high-performance, standards-based technology solution. The highly secure and solid foundation provides a platform for Lawson's next-generation applications designed for use within a service-oriented architecture (SOA).     Additionally, by separating the technical foundation from its applications, Lawson provides customers with cross-version compatibility. This enables Lawson customers to upgrade their enterprise applications and technology independently - at their own pace and on their own budgets.     By moving to LSF 9, existing Lawson customer After Hours Formalwear will be able to better leverage its ERP investment and more quickly upgrade to Lawson's newest applications.     "LSF 9 gives us a strong technology platform at a lower total cost of ownership to support our future business solutions," said Robert C. Hunnicutt, manager of Financial Systems, After Hours Formalwear. "And because migrating to LSF 9 is more like a simple refresh than a formal upgrade process, it won't disrupt our business processes."     After Hours Formalwear is the nation's largest chain of company-owned tuxedo and men's formal wear stores. Recognized for its quality formal wear and accessibility, After Hours Formalwear has more than 450 store locations throughout the country.     LSF 9 includes IBM's leading WebSphere Application Server ND, Tivoli Directory Server and DB2 technology.     "Retail enterprises adopting demand-driven business strategies need technology foundations that can react quickly to customer service needs during peak/off-peak periods and help them orchestrate supply and demand activities while enhancing their margins and reputation," said Michelle Schooff, marketing director, Retail, Lawson Software. "Strong demand for LSF among retailers of different sizes and geographies validates our strategy of delivering low-cost, retail-specific solutions that simplify and support enterprise interoperability and integration so retailers can focus on responding to changing consumer preferences and market conditions."     Lawson's industry-focused software solutions help retailers integrate the systems they use to run and grow their businesses. Lawson has more than 350 retail customers worldwide. Specifically, customers include 10 of the top 25 specialty retailers, seven of the top 25 grocery chains, eight of the top 25 global retailers, six of the top 25 food service chains and eight of the top 30 U.S. convenience store companies.       About Lawson Software     Lawson Software provides software and service solutions to 4,000 customers in manufacturing, distribution, maintenance and service sector industries across 40 countries. Lawson's solutions include Enterprise Performance Management, Supply Chain Management, Enterprise Resource Planning, Customer Relationship Management, Manufacturing Resource Planning, Enterprise Asset Management and industry-tailored applications. Lawson solutions assist customers in simplifying their businesses or organizations by helping them streamline processes, reduce costs and enhance business or operational performance. Lawson is headquartered in St. Paul, Minn., and has offices around the world. Visit Lawson online at www.lawson.com. Headline: : Republic Airways to Host Recruiting Sessions in the Denver Metro Area as it Launches Plans to Hire More Than 200 Flight Attendants in Preparation for Its 2007-2008 Expansion
Story: INDIANAPOLIS--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   Republic Airways Holdings (NASDAQ:RJET) announced today that it will be hosting a series of recruiting sessions in the Denver Metro area as part of its announced plans to grow its flight attendant workforce by more than 200.     All three of Republic's carriers - Chautauqua Airlines, Republic Airlines and Shuttle America - expect to add Flight Attendants thanks to the company's strong partnerships with American Airlines, Delta Air Lines, United Airlines, US Airways, Continental Airlines and beginning in March of this year, Denver based Frontier Airlines. The company's existing flight attendant workforce of approximately 1,100 is expected to grow to 1,600 by 2008.     Republic Airway's Republic Airlines subsidiary will have major operations at Denver International Airport when it begins its partnership with Frontier Airlines on March 4, 2007. Republic Airlines will operate 17, seventy-six seat Embraer 170 aircraft for Frontier Airlines when the last aircraft is delivered in December 2008.     "The regional airline industry continues to generate the bulk of the growth and jobs in aviation, and as we lead the sector in expanding and flying even larger jets, we are excited about the future of the airline and the opportunities for our employees," said Republic Airways CEO Bryan Bedford. "Our new relationship with Frontier Airlines will create expanded employment opportunities for candidates interested in joining a growing company on the leading edge of the regional airline industry."     Open house recruiting sessions will be held January 18th at 10:00 am, 2:00 pm and 6:00 pm as well as 10:00 am on January 19th at 10:00 am at The Renaissance Denver Hotel located at 3801 Quebec Street in Denver. Take I-70 West. Exit #278 South. Stay right and go across Smith Road. Hotel is on right 1/8 of mile ahead. Please note the doors to all recruiting sessions will close promptly at the beginning of the session.     Candidates must be 19 years of age with a high school diploma/GED, customer service skills and good communication skills. Please complete an on-line application and bring two valid forms of ID to the Arlington Employment Center. The employment package includes paid training, generous health insurance and related benefits, as well as travel benefits. For more information and to complete an on-line application candidates should visit our employment website at http://jobs.rjet.com     The three Republic-owned airlines operate a series of flight attendant crew bases at Indianapolis, Louisville, Buffalo, Greensboro, St. Louis, New York LaGuardia, Columbus, Richmond, Chicago O'Hare, Washington Reagan National Airport, Pittsburgh, Orlando and beginning in March Denver, Colorado. New hire flight attendants must be willing to relocate initially to any of these bases, but if eligible, can bid for openings at a preferred base. The company works with flight attendants to help them secure their preferred base as quickly as possible.       About Republic Airways Holdings     Republic Airways Holdings, based in Indianapolis, Indiana is an airline holding company that owns Chautauqua Airlines, Republic Airlines and Shuttle America. The airlines offer scheduled passenger service on approximately 1,000 flights daily to 90 cities in 35 states, Canada, Mexico and the U.S. Virgin Islands through airline services agreements with five major U.S. airlines. All of the airlines' flights are operated under their major airline partner brand, such as AmericanConnection, Continental Express, Delta Connection, United Express and US Airways Express. The airlines currently employ approximately 3,700 aviation professionals and operate 173 regional jet aircraft. For more in-depth information on Republic Airways Holdings please visit our website at www.RJET.com        CONTACT: Republic Airways Holdings               Warren R. Wilkinson, 317-484-6042        SOURCE: Republic Airways Holdings  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 09:12 ET (14:12 GMT)

Headline: : Hong Kong I.T. Publication Recognizes Feature Superiority of Juniper Networks SSG Platform
Story: IT Square Editor's Choice 2006 Awarded for Most Full-Featured  Unified Threat Management Appliance for Small and Medium Enterprises  SUNNYVALE, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--January 15, 2007--   Juniper Networks, Inc. (Nasdaq:JNPR) today announced that IT Square, one of Hong Kong's leading information technology publications, has selected the Juniper Networks Secure Services Gateway (SSG) family as an IT Square Editor's Choice 2006.     "Of all the devices on the market offering Unified Threat Management (UTM) features, Juniper's SSG family excels in feature richness and low management overhead, making it the ideal solution for SMEs," said Mr. S.W. Jong, Managing Editor for IT Square. "Only the SSG family provides a true deep packet inspection firewall. We also liked the platforms' support for multiple security zones and its robust authentication mechanism, two crucial features that compensate for the inherent vulnerabilities of wireless LANs often used by SMEs."     Published by the Sing Tao Newspaper Group, IT Square has a weekly circulation of 100,000 and focuses on small and medium enterprise (SME) and personal computing.     The Juniper Networks SSG family of integrated network security appliances is purpose-built to deliver a perfect blend of performance, security and LAN/WAN connectivity for small branch office and small business deployments that may not have the extensive IT resources of larger organizations. Traffic flowing in and out of the branch office can be protected from worms, Spyware, Trojans, and malware by a complete set of Unified Threat Management (UTM) security features including Stateful firewall, IPSec VPN, IPS, Antivirus (including Anti-Spyware, Anti-Adware, Anti-Phishing), Anti-Spam, and Web Filtering.     The rich set of UTM security features allows SSG family products to be deployed as stand-alone network protection devices. With their robust routing engines, SSG family products can also be deployed as traditional branch office routers or as combination security and routing devices to help reduce IT capital and operational expenditures.     Presented on November 29, the IT Square award joins other accolades for Juniper Networks' network security products, including the 2006 Frost & Sullivan Market Leadership Award in the Asia Pacific SSL VPN Market.     "Asia Pacific's small and medium enterprises need reliable and comprehensive network security solutions to safeguard their continued growth," said Abby Tang, Asia Pacific solutions marketing manager for Juniper Networks. "We are pleased that IT Square recognizes the value of the SSG family to organizations that lack extensive IT resources. The SSG family delivers comprehensive measures to protect against the growing frequency and variety of network threats, without prohibitive overhead or compromise."       About Juniper Networks, Inc.     Juniper Networks develops purpose-built, high performance IP platforms that enable customers to support a wide variety of services and applications at scale. Service providers, enterprises, governments and research and education institutions rely on Juniper to deliver a portfolio of proven networking, security and application acceleration solutions that solve highly complex, fast-changing problems in the world's most demanding networks. Additional information can be found at www.juniper.net.     Juniper Networks and the Juniper Networks logo are registered trademarks of Juniper Networks, Inc. in the United States and other countries. All other trademarks, service marks, registered trademarks, or registered service marks are the property of their respective owners.        CONTACT: Juniper Networks, Inc. Headline: : Update: Richmond Refinery Fire
Story: RICHMOND, Calif., Jan. 15 /PRNewswire/ -- Chevron (NYSE: CVX) Richmond Refinery officials report that a fire within the crude separating unit has been contained and Contra Costa Health Services at 8:40 a.m. PST lifted their shelter-in-place for local residents.     The fire occurred at approximately 5:15 a.m. PST and was responded to by Chevron's own fire department and local emergency services. The fire was contained at 7:50 a.m. PST and is now being allowed to extinguish itself.     One employee sustained minor burns and has been treated and released from hospital. The employee has since returned to work.        The cause of the incident is under investigation.     Dean O'Hair, Chevron Richmond Refinery External Affairs Manager said, "We don't expect this event to affect the current production plan at the refinery, since the crude unit was at the beginning of a planned maintenance cycle, however at this time we don't know the full extent of the damage. We would also like to acknowledge the support we received from other emergency responders who helped us with this incident."    SOURCE  Chevron Corporation       /CONTACT: Richmond Refinery Public Affairs, +1-510-242-4507      /Web site: http://www.chevron.com/     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 13:37 ET (18:37 GMT)

Headline: Customers Miffed Over DirecTV With TiVo Problems - Report
Story: NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--Customers of DirecTV Group (DTV) with TiVo Inc. (TIVO) have been blanketing the satellite provider's online user forums with complaints of a malfunction in the DVR service, CNET News.com reported on its Web Site Monday.   Complaints of the problem first surfaced in early December, but DirecTV spokesman Robert Mercer said Friday he didn't know the exact cause of the glitch. The company "is aware of the problem and should have it fixed by this evening," Mercer said.   Many forum posters say that the Season Pass feature, which enables users to tell the set-top box which programs to automatically record, has stopped recording those shows altogether, or is only doing so intermittently.   CNET.News reports that some customers claim that it's not until speaking with their third or fourth DirecTV customer service representative that the company admits to a problem. Many say they were told it was a "known issue" that DirecTV was working on, and that the problem might be corrected in anything from a day to 30 days.   Newspaper Web Site: http://www.cnetnews.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 02:52 ET (07:52 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Armistice Resources Corp. Appoints New Director>AZ.T
Story: TORONTO, Jan. 15 /CNW/ - Armistice Resources Corp. (TSX: AZ) ("Armistice" or the "Corporation") is pleased to announce the appointment of Mr. James O'Donnell as a new director effective January 3, 2007. Mr. James O'Donnell, has over 40 years experience in business, including leadership roles in the brokerage, mutual fund and investment management industries. Prior to founding O'Donnell Capital Group, Mr. O'Donnell was founder, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of O'Donnell Investment Management Corp. ("OIMC"). OIMC was launched in December 1995 and within one year had attracted over $1 billion in assets under management. Mr. O'Donnell took OIMC public 18 months after its launch in a successful initial public offering on the TSX. In June 1999, Mr. O'Donnell oversaw the successful sale of OIMC for over $80 million.    Previously, Mr. O'Donnell was President and one of the founders of Mackenzie Financial Corporation ("MFC"). Mr. O'Donnell was instrumental in building MFC's asset base from less than $10 million to several billion dollars during his 20 years with MFC. When Mr. O'Donnell retired from MFC in 1993, he left one of the largest mutual fund companies in Canada. Mr. O'Donnell expanded MFC into the United States, setting up Mackenzie Investment Management Inc., which was subsequently taken public. Mr. O'Donnell also moved MFC into the Canadian trust industry with Mackenzie Trust Company. Todd J. Morgan, President and CEO, commented, "We are very pleased to have Mr. O'Donnell join our board of directors. He brings with him an impressive pedigree in the financial community and adds a welcome new dimension to our board."    Armistice is a Canadian exploration company that owns an advanced exploration underground gold project in North-eastern Ontario located on the prolific Larder Lake break. The McGarry project consists of 34 contiguous patented mining claims and licences of occupation totalling 484 hectares which adjoins the former producing Kerr Addison gold mine which produced in excess of 11 million ounces of gold. The dewatering of the underground workings is progressing as planned.    ARMISTICE RESOURCES CORP.    "Todd J. Morgan"    Todd J. Headline: INTERVIEW: TV Demand Underpins Harvey Norman 1H Sales
Story: By Susan Murdoch     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     MELBOURNE (Dow Jones)--Australia's largest furniture and electrical retailer Harvey Norman Ltd. (HVN.AU) Monday said first half sales roses 17%, citing continued demand for flat-panel televisions.   Chief operating officer John Slack-Smith said despite strong growth in the last few years, market penetration of large-screen televisions in Australian households remains relatively low.   "We expect plasma and LCDs to continue to be the lead growth category for the group for the discernible future," Slack-Smith told Dow Jones Newswires.   "We don't think we're anywhere near saturation," he said, predicting penetration will exceed 50% compared with the mid-teens nowadays.   The Sydney-based company has been one of main beneficiaries of consumer demand for new technology, with sales of large-screen televisions, laptops and iPods seemingly unaffected by rises in fuel prices and interest rates.   Harvey Norman said sales for the six months to Dec. 31 rose 17% to A$2.71 billion from a year ago. Like-for-like store sales increased 7.1%, with growth slowing toward the end of the period after a gain of 8.2% in the first quarter.   Slack-Smith said the slowing growth was mainly due to timing of its major finance promotion in the first quarter this year, compared with running a similar promotion in the second quarter of the previous fiscal year.   Shoppers also held out from spending until late in the Christmas period, he said, and a cooler start to summer in the states of New South Wales and Queensland also slowed sales in outdoor furniture and air-conditioners.   Citigroup said in a recent report that a pickup in demand for furniture, which has been suffering from softer housing activity, should benefit Harvey Norman.   But Slack-Smith said while there are "signs of improvement," the furniture sector "still has a way to go".   The company has outlets in Australia, New Zealand Slovenia and Ireland. It also operates stores in Singapore and Malaysia through a separate joint venture.   In November, Harvey Norman agreed to sell its 53% stake in sporting goods retailer Rebel Sport Ltd. (REB.AU) to private equity group Archer Capital. Chairman Gerry Harvey has said some of the A$196 million raised by the sale will be returned to shareholders through an increased dividend.   Chief financial officer Chris Mentis told Dow Jones Newswires the board is still determining how much will be returned, but it won't be until the second half.   Slack-Smith wouldn't comment on trading in the third quarter. Analysts expect Harvey Norman to report a net profit of A$239.6 million this financial year, up 20% on fiscal 2006, according to a survey of 11 analysts by Thomson Financial.     -By Susan Murdoch, Dow Jones Newswires; 61-3-9671-4393; susan.murdoch@dowjones.com     -Edited by Ian Pemberton     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 01:42 ET (06:42 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: SGS Will Speed Up Identifying Takeover Targets - CEO -2-
Story: Kirk said that most of the company's 10 divisions have at least one takeover possibility.   SGS's recent attempt to buy Germany-based Germanischer Lloyd has failed not because of the price but because Germanischer Loyd has preferred a German solution, Kirk said.   SGS, which earlier Monday reported a 19.4% rise in 2006 net profit to CHF443 million Swiss francs, ($355.3 million), from CHF371 million,  a year earlier parted ways with former CEO Dan Kerpelman because that executive was considered too wary of acquisitions.   Kirk reiterated SGS's 2008 targets of CHF5 billion in sales, an operating profit margin of 17%.   In the past few years, SGS has been rumored to be interested in acquiring Paris-based Bureau Veritas.     Company Web site: http://www.sgs.com     -By Martin Gelnar, Dow Jones Newswires; +43 79 821 5617; martin.gelnar@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 05:35 ET (10:35 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: 2nd UPDATE: SGS 06 Net Pft +19%; Remains Vague On Buys
Story: (This updates an article published at 0905 GMT, adding executive comments and fresh share price.)   By Martin Gelnar   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     GENEVA (Dow Jones)--SGS SA (SGSN.VX), the world's largest goods inspection and quality control company by market capitalization, Monday reported a 19.4% rise in 2006 net profit on continued strong business and the effect of past restructuring moves.   Geneva-based SGS, which has operations ranging from of goods shipments on behalf of governments to quality checks of China-made consumer goods, said net profit rose to CHF443 million Swiss francs, or around $355.3 million, from CHF371 million in the year-ago period. The result was in line with analyst estimates of CHF444 million.   Sales in 2006 rose 15.5% to CHF3.82 billion from CHF3.31 billion and earnings before interest and taxes rose 24.3% to CHF624 million from CHF502 million.   The company didn't provide a specific guidance for 2007 other than saying that "2007 continues the positive trend experienced in 2006.   But SGS reiterated its 2008 target of achieving 2008 targets of CHF5 billion in sales, an operating profit margin of 17% and earnings per share of CHF80. In 2006, the operating margin was 16.3% and earnings per share stood at CHF57.89, up 18.5% from the year-earlier period.   "The figures are solid but not spectacular", said Philipp Gamper, an analyst at Bank Sarasin. He said he would keep a neutral rating on the stock with a CHF1,450 price target.   Scott Weldon, analyst at Bank Vontobel, agreed. He noted that five out of 10 SGS units, among them key operations such as oil, gas & chemical services as well as industrial services, performed well. He said he would maintain a market perform rating, citing a relatively high valuation.   At 1204 GMT SGS shares were down 0.7%, or CHF9 lower, at CHF1386, in a higher Swiss market.   At a media conference in Geneva, recently-installed Chief Executive Officer Chris Kirk remained vague on the subject of acquisitions-driven growth, a strategy SGS flagged late last year when it parted ways with former chief executive Dan Kerpelman.   "The pipeline is full, but we can also be very successful growing organically." said Kirk, who is expected to quicken the pace of acquisitions after former CEO Kerpelman was criticized for slipping up growth growth opportunities.   Kirk said that most of the company's 10 divisions have at least one takeover possibility.   In the past few years, SGS has been rumored to be interested in acquiring Paris-based Bureau Veritas, controlled by France-based investment company Wendel Investissement (12120.FR).   As expected, the company proposed a reduced dividend of CHF20, down from the exceptionally high CHF50 per share paid last year. Expectations for the dividend had ranged between CHF18 to more than CHF30 per share.   SGS has often stated it plans to play an active role in an industry consolidation, citing the high fragmentation of the market and its financial power.   SGS's rivals include Bureau Veritas of France, German TUEV and London-based Intertek Group Plc (ITRK.LN).   SGS shareholders include the German Von Finck family, which owns a 23.7% stake and Ifil Investments SpA (IFL.MI), the Italian Agnelli family holding, which holds 13.2%.     Company Web site: http://www.sgs.com     -By Martin Gelnar, Dow Jones Newswires; +43 79 821 5617; martin.gelnar@dowjones.com   (Goran Mijuk in Zurich contributed to this article.)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 07:06 ET (12:06 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: ICE-Nybot Merger Closes; Nybot Now ICE Subsidiary
Story: (This article was originally published Friday)         By Susan Buchanan     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--IntercontinentalExchange and the New York Board of Trade on Friday completed their more-than $1 billion merger, making Nybot a wholly-owned subsidiary of ICE and a for-profit, publicly traded corporation, the exchanges said.   Fred W. Schoenhut and Terrence F. Martell, two directors of the Nybot board, have joined the ICE board of directors, effective Friday. ICE will operate under the regulatory regimes of the home countries of each exchange. Combined businesses includes Nybot, operating as a U.S. futures exchange under the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission, and London-based ICE Futures - regulated by the U.K. Financial Services Authority.   ICE bought Nybot for 10.297 million shares of ICE common stock and $400 million in cash. Proceeds will be distributed to Nybot members by Jan. 29. The acquisition provides ICE with a wholly-owned clearing house. Meanwhile, ICE's global OTC electronic platform will continue to operate as an exempt commercial market under the U.S. Commodity Exchange Act.   Last week, ICE announced that Nybot soft-commodity futures will be listed for trading on ICE's electronic trading platform on Jan. 19.    "We are already beginning to leverage our strengths for the benefit of customers and shareholders, setting a new standard within the industry with our diverse product line of futures and over-the-counter offerings. Our commitment to growth, innovation and customer service will play out in continued product offerings and the enhancement of our world-class electronic trading and clearing platforms," ICE Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Jeffrey C. Sprecher said.   Nybot Chairman Frederick W. Schoenhut said: "As a part of the ICE team, we believe we can make a strong contribution to the group, as well as benefit from ICE's innovations in technology and products to serve a diverse global customer base."   In connection with the acquisition, ICE entered into senior, unsecured credit facilities worth $500 million on Jan. Credit includes a $250 million, five-year floating-rate term loan and a $250 million revolving credit line.  Credit facilities were arranged by Wachovia Bank, National Association and Bank of America, N.A.    ICE used the proceeds of a $250 million term loan, along with $150 million of cash on hand, to finance the $400 million cash component of the merger. A remaining $250 million capacity available under a revolving credit line can be used by ICE for general purposes.   Meanwhile, Nybot traders and New York softs-desk managers expressed some trepidation about the upcoming era under ICE management.   "The merger's done, and a week from now ICE trading in electronic softs futures starts - which should mean more work for us," a coffee-desk manager in New York said. "ICE's electronic futures will be fungible against open-outcry markets and will allow physical delivery, which our customers need. I expect open-outcry to remain strong, and ICE's electronic open interest to pick up gradually."   "ICE electronic softs will trade 22 hours a day, and Nymex (New York Mercantile Exchange) electronic-softs futures - which just started - are around the clock," he said. "But I don't expect the electronic softs to be very liquid at night, especially at the beginning. And I doubt our customers are interested in Nymex cash-settled futures."   Other traders expressed concern about the 22-hour market and said softs brokers are expected to lobby ICE soon to shorten electronic trading to about 10 hours a day.   Meanwhile, New York traders said they heard that Nymex has offered cash incentives to Nymex brokers to encourage them to start trading Nymex softs futures. A Nymex spokeswoman late Friday was unable to confirm that talk.   -By Susan Buchanan, Dow Jones Newswires; 201-938-5950; susan.buchanan@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 07:30 ET (12:30 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Burntsand Announces C$600,000 In Contracts For First Phase Of Business Service Management Solution>BRT.T
Story: TORONTO, Jan. 15 /CNW/ - Burntsand Inc. (Burntsand) (TSX:BRT), a North American business consulting and technology services company, today announced the signing of approximately $600,000 in new contracts for a leading pharmaceutical company. The contracts consist of $300,000 for resale of third party software licenses and $300,000 in professional services to be delivered over the next 4 months.    The contracts are for the initial phases of a roadmap to implement a world class Business Service Management solution. The initial contracts will focus on defining and deploying the client's Configuration Management process including the implementation of an industry leading Configuration Management Database (CMDB) Solution.    Burntsand was originally engaged with this pharmaceutical client to create a strategic Service Management roadmap that would enable the customer to achieve higher levels of IT service provision and responsiveness, creating a competitive advantage.    "This is an extremely exciting project for us because of the significant competitive value it will offer to our client," said Tim Duffy, Burntsand's CEO. "We have the opportunity to transform our client's business by implementing a detailed framework and solution for managing IT information and operations. This project illustrates Burntsand's unique position as a partner that can offer both experience-driven strategic planning, and skilled solution deployment services."    Burntsand has been a leader in delivering "best practice" Service Management and Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) aligned solutions to leading organizations in Canada and the US for the past 10 years.    About Burntsand    With a unique and forward-thinking focus on helping clients unify enterprise information to increase productivity and insight, Burntsand is a North American leader in the delivery of Enterprise Content Management, Collaboration, Enterprise Operations and Service Management, and Customer Relationship Management services. Burntsand delivers business advantage to its mid-market clients through risk-managed projects and unmatched customer experience. Strong partnerships with Documentum, Remedy and Microsoft reflect the company's business maturity and ensure sustained technology depth. Headquartered in Toronto, Burntsand operates from locations across North America. The Company's shares (TSX: BRT) are traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange. More information about Burntsand can be found at www.burntsand.com.    %SEDAR: 00007529E         /CONTACT: Tim Duffy, President & Chief Executive Officer, Voice: (416) 234-3807, Email: TDuffy@burntsand.com; Martin Glover, Chief Operating Officer, Voice: (617) 923-6611, Email: MGlover@burntsand.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  January 15, 2007 08:03 ET (13:03 GMT)
